  • Last updated: July 21, 2025

Introduction

Comprehensive API for managing products, orders, payments, users, vendors, and more in an e-commerce platform.

Base URL: http://marketplace.com

Welcome to the E-Commerce API

This comprehensive API allows you to build powerful e-commerce applications with features including:

üîê Authentication & Security

  • User registration and login with Laravel Passport
  • Account lockout protection after failed attempts
  • Password validation and expiry policies
  • Email verification and password reset

üõçÔ∏è Product Management

  • Product catalog with categories, tags, and variants
  • Media management for product images
  • Inventory tracking and status management
  • Vendor-specific product management

üì¶ Order Processing

  • Complete order lifecycle management
  • Order item tracking and management
  • Order status updates and notifications

üí≥ Payment Integration

  • Stripe payment processing
  • Payment status tracking and webhooks
  • Secure payment verification

üîÑ Returns & Refunds

  • Customer return request system
  • Admin return review and approval
  • Automated refund processing via payment gateways
  • Comprehensive refund tracking

üë• User & Vendor Management

  • Role-based access control
  • User profile and address management
  • Vendor account management

üìä Security & Monitoring

  • Comprehensive security logging
  • Account lock monitoring
  • Failed attempt tracking
  • Security score calculation

All endpoints follow RESTful conventions and return JSON responses. Most endpoints require authentication using Bearer tokens.

Authenticating requests

To authenticate requests, include an Authorization header with the value "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}".

All authenticated endpoints are marked with a requires authentication badge in the documentation below.

You can obtain your authentication token by logging in via the /login endpoint. The token should be included in the Authorization header as Bearer {token}.

Authentication

Register a new user

Creates a new user account with email verification. The user will receive an email to verify their account. Passwords must meet security requirements including minimum length, character diversity, and cannot be common passwords.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/register" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"John Doe\",
    \"email\": \"john@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"MySecurePass123!\",
    \"password_confirmation\": \"MySecurePass123!\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/register"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "password": "MySecurePass123!",
    "password_confirmation": "MySecurePass123!"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/register';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'John Doe',
            'email' => 'john@example.com',
            'password' => 'MySecurePass123!',
            'password_confirmation' => 'MySecurePass123!',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/register'
payload = {
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "password": "MySecurePass123!",
    "password_confirmation": "MySecurePass123!"
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [],
    "message": "User registered successfully.",
    "status": 200
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Password does not meet security requirements.",
    "errors": [
        "Password must contain at least 1 uppercase letter(s).",
        "Password cannot contain common words or patterns that are not secure."
    ],
    "strength": {
        "score": 45,
        "strength": "medium",
        "feedback": [
            "Add special characters",
            "Use more unique characters"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (423):


{
    "message": "Registration temporarily blocked. Please try again later.",
    "time_remaining_minutes": 15
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/register

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The user's full name. Example: John Doe

email   string   

The user's email address. Must be unique. Example: john@example.com

password   string   

The user's password. Must be at least 12 characters with uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols. Example: MySecurePass123!

password_confirmation   string   

Password confirmation. Must match the password field. Example: MySecurePass123!

User login

Authenticates a user and returns an access token. Implements account lockout protection and tracks failed attempts.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/login" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"email\": \"john@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"MySecurePass123!\",
    \"remember\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/login"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "password": "MySecurePass123!",
    "remember": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/login';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'email' => 'john@example.com',
            'password' => 'MySecurePass123!',
            'remember' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/login'
payload = {
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "password": "MySecurePass123!",
    "remember": true
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200):


{
    "data": {
        "token_type": "Bearer",
        "access_token": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9...",
        "expires_at": 1640995200,
        "user": {
            "id": 1,
            "email": "john@example.com",
            "role": "user"
        }
    },
    "message": "User logged in successfully.",
    "status": 200
}

Example response (401):


{
    "message": "Invalid credentials"
}

Example response (423):


{
    "message": "Account is temporarily locked due to multiple failed login attempts.",
    "locked_until": "2024-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z",
    "time_remaining_seconds": 1800,
    "time_remaining_minutes": 30,
    "lockout_count": 2
}

Example response (426):


{
    "message": "Your password has expired and must be changed before logging in.",
    "password_expired": true,
    "change_password_required": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/login

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

email   string   

The user's email address. Example: john@example.com

password   string   

The user's password. Example: MySecurePass123!

remember   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to remember the user for extended period. Example: true

User logout

requires authentication

Logs out the authenticated user and revokes their access token.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/logout" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/logout"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/logout';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/logout'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [],
    "message": "User logged out successfully",
    "status": 200
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/logout

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Change password

requires authentication

Changes the authenticated user's password. Requires current password verification and validates new password strength.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/change-password" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"current_password\": \"MyOldPass123!\",
    \"new_password\": \"MyNewSecurePass456!\",
    \"new_password_confirmation\": \"MyNewSecurePass456!\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/change-password"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "current_password": "MyOldPass123!",
    "new_password": "MyNewSecurePass456!",
    "new_password_confirmation": "MyNewSecurePass456!"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/change-password';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'current_password' => 'MyOldPass123!',
            'new_password' => 'MyNewSecurePass456!',
            'new_password_confirmation' => 'MyNewSecurePass456!',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/change-password'
payload = {
    "current_password": "MyOldPass123!",
    "new_password": "MyNewSecurePass456!",
    "new_password_confirmation": "MyNewSecurePass456!"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200):


{
    "data": {
        "password_strength": {
            "score": 85,
            "strength": "very strong",
            "feedback": []
        },
        "security_score": {
            "score": 95,
            "level": "excellent",
            "issues": []
        }
    },
    "message": "Password changed successfully",
    "status": 200
}

Example response (401):


{
    "message": "Current password is incorrect"
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "New password does not meet security requirements.",
    "errors": [
        "Password cannot be the same as your last 5 passwords."
    ],
    "strength": {
        "score": 45,
        "strength": "medium",
        "feedback": [
            "Add special characters"
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/change-password

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

current_password   string   

The user's current password. Example: MyOldPass123!

new_password   string   

The new password. Must meet security requirements. Example: MyNewSecurePass456!

new_password_confirmation   string   

Confirmation of the new password. Example: MyNewSecurePass456!

Get security information

requires authentication

Retrieves comprehensive security information for the authenticated user including account lock status, security score, and password expiry details.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/security-info" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/security-info"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/security-info';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/security-info'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200):


{
    "data": {
        "account_lock": {
            "is_locked": false,
            "failed_attempts": 0,
            "max_attempts": 5,
            "lockout_count": 0,
            "locked_until": null,
            "time_until_unlock": null,
            "last_attempt_at": null,
            "last_successful_login": "2024-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
            "should_reset": false
        },
        "security_score": {
            "score": 85,
            "level": "good",
            "issues": [
                "Medium strength password"
            ]
        },
        "password_expiry": {
            "requires_change": false,
            "days_until_expiry": 45,
            "last_changed": "2024-01-01T12:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        "login_history": {
            "last_login": "2024-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
            "last_login_ip": "192.168.1.100"
        }
    },
    "message": "Security information retrieved",
    "status": 200
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/security-info

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Forgot password

Sends a password reset link to the user's email address.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/forgot-password" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"email\": \"john@example.com\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/forgot-password"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "email": "john@example.com"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/forgot-password';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'email' => 'john@example.com',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/forgot-password'
payload = {
    "email": "john@example.com"
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [],
    "message": "We have emailed your password reset link!",
    "status": 200
}

Example response (423):


{
    "message": "Password reset temporarily blocked. Please try again later."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/forgot-password

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

email   string   

The user's email address. Example: john@example.com

Reset password

Resets the user's password using a valid reset token from the forgot password email.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reset-password" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"token\": \"abc123def456\",
    \"email\": \"john@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"MyNewSecurePass456!\",
    \"password_confirmation\": \"MyNewSecurePass456!\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reset-password"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "token": "abc123def456",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "password": "MyNewSecurePass456!",
    "password_confirmation": "MyNewSecurePass456!"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reset-password';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'token' => 'abc123def456',
            'email' => 'john@example.com',
            'password' => 'MyNewSecurePass456!',
            'password_confirmation' => 'MyNewSecurePass456!',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reset-password'
payload = {
    "token": "abc123def456",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "password": "MyNewSecurePass456!",
    "password_confirmation": "MyNewSecurePass456!"
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [],
    "message": "Your password has been reset!",
    "status": 200
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "New password does not meet security requirements.",
    "errors": [
        "Password must contain at least 1 special character(s)."
    ],
    "strength": {
        "score": 60,
        "strength": "strong",
        "feedback": [
            "Add special characters"
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reset-password

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

token   string   

The password reset token from the email. Example: abc123def456

email   string   

The user's email address. Example: john@example.com

password   string   

The new password. Must meet security requirements. Example: MyNewSecurePass456!

password_confirmation   string   

Confirmation of the new password. Example: MyNewSecurePass456!

Email Verification

Verify a user's email address

This endpoint verifies a user's email address using a signed URL that is sent to their email after registration. The verification link contains the user ID and a hash for security. Once verified, the user's email_verified_at timestamp is set and they can access protected features.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/email/verify/architecto/abc123def456ghi789?expires=1640995200&signature=xyz789abc123def456" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/email/verify/architecto/abc123def456ghi789"
);

const params = {
    "expires": "1640995200",
    "signature": "xyz789abc123def456",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/email/verify/architecto/abc123def456ghi789';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'expires' => '1640995200',
            'signature' => 'xyz789abc123def456',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/email/verify/architecto/abc123def456ghi789'
params = {
  'expires': '1640995200',
  'signature': 'xyz789abc123def456',
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (302, Email verified successfully):


{
    "description": "User is redirected to the frontend email verification success page",
    "headers": {
        "Location": "https://yourfrontend.com/email-verified"
    }
}

Example response (302, Email already verified):


{
    "description": "User is redirected to the frontend (email was already verified previously)",
    "headers": {
        "Location": "https://yourfrontend.com/email-verified"
    }
}

Example response (401, Invalid or expired verification link):


{
    "message": "Invalid/Expired url provided.",
    "status": 401
}

Example response (403, Signature verification failed):


{
    "message": "Invalid/Expired url provided.",
    "status": 401
}

Example response (403):

Show headers 
cache-control: no-cache, private
content-type: application/json
x-content-type-options: nosniff
x-frame-options: DENY
x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block
content-security-policy: default-src 'none'; frame-ancestors 'none';
referrer-policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
permissions-policy: camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=(), payment=()

}

Example response (404, User not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\User] 123"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/email/verify/{id}/{hash}

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   string   

The ID of the verify. Example: architecto

hash   string   

The verification hash that ensures the link is valid and hasn't been tampered with. This is automatically included in the verification link. Example: abc123def456ghi789

user_id   integer   

The ID of the user whose email is being verified. This is automatically included in the verification link. Example: 123

Query Parameters

expires   integer   

The expiration timestamp for the verification link. Automatically included. Example: 1640995200

signature   string   

The signature that validates the signed URL. Automatically included. Example: xyz789abc123def456

Resend email verification notification

requires authentication

Sends a new email verification link to the authenticated user's email address. This is useful when users don't receive the initial verification email or when the verification link has expired. The user must be authenticated to request a resend.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/email/resend" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/email/resend"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/email/resend';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/email/resend'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Verification email sent successfully):


{
    "message": "Email verification link sent on your email id.",
    "status": 200
}

Example response (400, Email already verified):


{
    "message": "Email already verified.",
    "status": 400
}

Example response (401, User not authenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated.",
    "status": 401
}

Example response (429, Too many requests):


{
    "message": "Too many verification emails sent. Please wait before requesting another.",
    "status": 429
}

Example response (500, Email sending failed):


{
    "message": "Failed to send verification email. Please try again later.",
    "status": 500
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/email/resend

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

User Management

Retrieve a paginated list of users with advanced filtering

requires authentication

Get a comprehensive paginated list of all users in the system with advanced filtering capabilities. This endpoint provides administrators with complete user information including personal details, addresses, role assignments, vendor associations, and account status. Essential for user management, administrative oversight, customer service, and system analytics. Supports powerful filtering and search functionality to help administrators quickly find specific users or user groups.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users?filter[]=architecto&filter%5Bname%5D=john&filter%5Bemail%5D=%40gmail.com&filter%5Bsearch%5D=sarah+johnson&filter%5Brole%5D=3%2C5%2C7&filter%5Bcreated_at%5D=2025-01-01%2C2025-01-31&filter%5Bupdated_at%5D=2024-12-01%2C2025-01-31&filter%5Binclude%5D=role%2Cvendors%2CuserAddress&page=2&per_page=25&sort=-created_at%2Cname" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"filter\": {
        \"name\": \"b\",
        \"email\": \"zbailey@example.net\",
        \"role\": \"9,31\",
        \"created_at\": \"2559-31-42\",
        \"updated_at\": \"2559-31-42\",
        \"search\": \"h\",
        \"include\": \"uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv\"
    },
    \"page\": 4,
    \"per_page\": 9,
    \"sort\": \"y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users"
);

const params = {
    "filter[0]": "architecto",
    "filter[name]": "john",
    "filter[email]": "@gmail.com",
    "filter[search]": "sarah johnson",
    "filter[role]": "3,5,7",
    "filter[created_at]": "2025-01-01,2025-01-31",
    "filter[updated_at]": "2024-12-01,2025-01-31",
    "filter[include]": "role,vendors,userAddress",
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "25",
    "sort": "-created_at,name",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "filter": {
        "name": "b",
        "email": "zbailey@example.net",
        "role": "9,31",
        "created_at": "2559-31-42",
        "updated_at": "2559-31-42",
        "search": "h",
        "include": "uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv"
    },
    "page": 4,
    "per_page": 9,
    "sort": "y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'filter[0]' => 'architecto',
            'filter[name]' => 'john',
            'filter[email]' => '@gmail.com',
            'filter[search]' => 'sarah johnson',
            'filter[role]' => '3,5,7',
            'filter[created_at]' => '2025-01-01,2025-01-31',
            'filter[updated_at]' => '2024-12-01,2025-01-31',
            'filter[include]' => 'role,vendors,userAddress',
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'sort' => '-created_at,name',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'filter' => [
                'name' => 'b',
                'email' => 'zbailey@example.net',
                'role' => '9,31',
                'created_at' => '2559-31-42',
                'updated_at' => '2559-31-42',
                'search' => 'h',
                'include' => 'uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv',
            ],
            'page' => 4,
            'per_page' => 9,
            'sort' => 'y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users'
payload = {
    "filter": {
        "name": "b",
        "email": "zbailey@example.net",
        "role": "9,31",
        "created_at": "2559-31-42",
        "updated_at": "2559-31-42",
        "search": "h",
        "include": "uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv"
    },
    "page": 4,
    "per_page": 9,
    "sort": "y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH"
}
params = {
  'filter[0]': 'architecto',
  'filter[name]': 'john',
  'filter[email]': '@gmail.com',
  'filter[search]': 'sarah johnson',
  'filter[role]': '3,5,7',
  'filter[created_at]': '2025-01-01,2025-01-31',
  'filter[updated_at]': '2024-12-01,2025-01-31',
  'filter[include]': 'role,vendors,userAddress',
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '25',
  'sort': '-created_at,name',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The filter.email must be a valid email format.",
        "The filter.role field must contain only comma-separated numbers.",
        "The filter.created_at field must be a valid date or date range in YYYY-MM-DD format."
    ]
}

Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/users

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

filter   string[]  optional  

optional Array of filter parameters to narrow down results.

filter[name]   string  optional  

optional Filter users by name (partial match supported). Example: john

filter[email]   string  optional  

optional Filter users by email address (partial match supported). Example: @gmail.com

filter[search]   string  optional  

optional Search across user names and email addresses. Example: sarah johnson

filter[role]   string  optional  

optional Filter by role ID(s). Single ID or comma-separated multiple IDs. Example: 3,5,7

filter[created_at]   string  optional  

optional Filter by registration date. Single date or comma-separated date range (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-01,2025-01-31

filter[updated_at]   string  optional  

optional Filter by last update date. Single date or comma-separated date range (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2024-12-01,2025-01-31

filter[include]   string  optional  

optional Include related data. Options: role,vendors,userAddress. Example: role,vendors,userAddress

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of users per page (max 100). Default: 15. Example: 25

sort   string  optional  

optional Sort users. Prefix with '-' for descending. Available: name, email, created_at, updated_at. Example: -created_at,name

Body Parameters

filter   object  optional  
name   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: b

email   string  optional  

Must be a valid email address. Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: zbailey@example.net

role   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\d,?)+$/. Example: 9,31

created_at   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}(,\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})?$/. Example: 2559-31-42

updated_at   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}(,\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})?$/. Example: 2559-31-42

search   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: h

include   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\w+(,\w+)*)?$/. Example: uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 4

per_page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100. Example: 9

sort   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(-?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)(,-?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$/. Example: y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH

Retrieve a specific user's detailed information

requires authentication

Get comprehensive information about a specific user including personal details, address, role assignments, vendor associations, and account status. This endpoint provides administrators with complete visibility into user accounts for customer service, account management, and administrative oversight purposes.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

        "last_login_at": "2025-01-15T16:30:00.000000Z",

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\User] 999"

Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/users/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the user. Example: 1

user   integer   

The ID of the user to retrieve. Example: 123

Create a new user account

requires authentication

Create a new user account with complete profile information including personal details, address, and role assignment. This endpoint allows administrators to onboard new users directly into the system with predefined access levels. The created user will receive appropriate notifications and can immediately begin using the system with their assigned role permissions.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"Sarah Jane Johnson\",
    \"email\": \"sarah.johnson@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"SecurePassword123!\",
    \"role_id\": 6,
    \"address\": {
        \"address_line1\": \"123 Oak Street\",
        \"city\": \"London\",
        \"country\": \"United Kingdom\",
        \"postal_code\": \"SW1A 1AA\",
        \"address_line2\": \"Apartment 4B\",
        \"state\": \"England\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson",
    "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
    "password": "SecurePassword123!",
    "role_id": 6,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "123 Oak Street",
        "city": "London",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "SW1A 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Apartment 4B",
        "state": "England"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'Sarah Jane Johnson',
            'email' => 'sarah.johnson@example.com',
            'password' => 'SecurePassword123!',
            'role_id' => 6,
            'address' => [
                'address_line1' => '123 Oak Street',
                'city' => 'London',
                'country' => 'United Kingdom',
                'postal_code' => 'SW1A 1AA',
                'address_line2' => 'Apartment 4B',
                'state' => 'England',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users'
payload = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson",
    "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
    "password": "SecurePassword123!",
    "role_id": 6,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "123 Oak Street",
        "city": "London",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "SW1A 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Apartment 4B",
        "state": "England"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

            "id": 89,
            "address_line1": "123 Oak Street",
            "address_line2": "Apartment 4B",
            "city": "London",
            "state": "England",

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The email has already been taken.",
        "The password must be at least 8 characters.",
        "The role id must exist in roles table.",
        "The address.address_line1 field is required.",
        "The address.city field is required.",
        "The address.country field is required.",
        "The address.postal_code field is required."
    ]
}

{
    "errors": [
        "The email has already been taken."
    ]
}

{
    "errors": [
        "The selected role id is invalid."
    ]
}

You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/users

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The user's full name. Will be automatically formatted with proper capitalization. Example: Sarah Jane Johnson

email   string   

The user's email address. Must be unique across all users. Example: sarah.johnson@example.com

password   string   

The user's initial password. Must meet security requirements (minimum 8 characters). Example: SecurePassword123!

role_id   integer   

The role ID to assign to the user. Must be a valid role that exists in the system. Example: 6

address   object   

Complete address information for the user.
address_line1   string   

Primary address line. Example: 123 Oak Street

city   string   

City name. Example: London

country   string   

Country name. Example: United Kingdom

postal_code   string   

Postal or ZIP code. Example: SW1A 1AA

address_line2   string  optional  

optional Secondary address line (apartment, suite, etc.). Example: Apartment 4B

state   string  optional  

optional State, region, or county. Example: England

Update an existing user's information

requires authentication

Modify an existing user's profile information including personal details, address, role assignment, and password. This endpoint supports partial updates - only provided fields will be updated, others remain unchanged. Administrators can update any user's information including role changes and password resets for customer service and account management purposes.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"Sarah Jane Johnson-Smith\",
    \"email\": \"sarah.johnson.new@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"NewSecurePassword456!\",
    \"role_id\": 3,
    \"address\": {
        \"address_line1\": \"456 Maple Avenue\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"country\": \"United Kingdom\",
        \"postal_code\": \"M1 1AA\",
        \"address_line2\": \"Suite 201\",
        \"state\": \"Greater Manchester\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson-Smith",
    "email": "sarah.johnson.new@example.com",
    "password": "NewSecurePassword456!",
    "role_id": 3,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "M1 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Suite 201",
        "state": "Greater Manchester"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'Sarah Jane Johnson-Smith',
            'email' => 'sarah.johnson.new@example.com',
            'password' => 'NewSecurePassword456!',
            'role_id' => 3,
            'address' => [
                'address_line1' => '456 Maple Avenue',
                'city' => 'Manchester',
                'country' => 'United Kingdom',
                'postal_code' => 'M1 1AA',
                'address_line2' => 'Suite 201',
                'state' => 'Greater Manchester',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1'
payload = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson-Smith",
    "email": "sarah.johnson.new@example.com",
    "password": "NewSecurePassword456!",
    "role_id": 3,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "M1 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Suite 201",
        "state": "Greater Manchester"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

        "stripe_customer_id": "cus_1234567890abcdef",

        "role": {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "customer_service"
        },
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:45:00.000000Z"
    }

        "The email has already been taken.",
        "The password must be at least 8 characters.",
        "The role id must exist in roles table.",
        "The address.address_line1 field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.city field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.country field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.postal_code field is required when address is present."
    ]
}

Request      

POST api/admin/users/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the user. Example: 1

user   integer   

The ID of the user to update. Example: 123

Body Parameters

name   string  optional  

optional The user's updated full name. Will be automatically formatted with proper capitalization. Example: Sarah Jane Johnson-Smith

email   string  optional  

optional The user's updated email address. Must be unique across all users. Example: sarah.johnson.new@example.com

password   string  optional  

optional New password for the user. Must be at least 8 characters. Useful for admin password resets. Example: NewSecurePassword456!

role_id   integer  optional  

optional Updated role ID for the user. Must be a valid role that exists in the system. Example: 3

address   object  optional  

optional Updated address information. If provided, all address fields are required.
address_line1   string   

Primary address line when address is provided. Example: 456 Maple Avenue

city   string   

City name when address is provided. Example: Manchester

country   string   

Country name when address is provided. Example: United Kingdom

postal_code   string   

Postal or ZIP code when address is provided. Example: M1 1AA

address_line2   string  optional  

optional Secondary address line. Example: Suite 201

state   string  optional  

optional State, region, or county. Example: Greater Manchester

Permanently delete a user account

requires authentication

Permanently remove a user account from the system along with their associated address information. This action is irreversible and will completely remove the user's data from the database. Exercise extreme caution when deleting users as this may affect order history, vendor relationships, and system audit trails. Consider deactivating accounts instead of deletion for data integrity.

Warning: This permanently deletes all user data including address information. Order history and other related records may be affected. Ensure this action is intentional and authorized.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/users/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, User deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "User deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, User not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\User] 999"
}

Example response (409, User has dependencies):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete user with active orders or vendor associations. Please transfer or resolve dependencies first."
}

Example response (422, Protected user account):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete system administrator accounts or users with special privileges."
}

Example response (422, User has active sessions):


{
    "message": "User has active sessions. Please revoke all tokens and sessions before deletion."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the user account."
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/users/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the user. Example: 1

user   integer   

The ID of the user to permanently delete. Example: 123

Vendor Management

Retrieve a paginated list of vendors with advanced filtering

requires authentication

Get a comprehensive paginated list of all vendors in the system with advanced filtering capabilities. This endpoint provides administrators with complete vendor information including business details, associated user accounts, product counts, media assets, and vendor status. Essential for vendor management, marketplace oversight, business analytics, and partner relationship management. Supports powerful filtering and search functionality to help administrators efficiently manage vendor partnerships and monitor marketplace activity.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors?filter[]=architecto&filter%5Bname%5D=tech&filter%5Bsearch%5D=electronics+hardware&filter%5Buser%5D=45%2C67%2C89&filter%5Bcreated_at%5D=2025-01-01%2C2025-01-31&filter%5Bupdated_at%5D=2024-12-01%2C2025-01-31&filter%5Binclude%5D=user%2Cproducts&page=2&per_page=25&sort=-created_at%2Cname" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors"
);

const params = {
    "filter[0]": "architecto",
    "filter[name]": "tech",
    "filter[search]": "electronics hardware",
    "filter[user]": "45,67,89",
    "filter[created_at]": "2025-01-01,2025-01-31",
    "filter[updated_at]": "2024-12-01,2025-01-31",
    "filter[include]": "user,products",
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "25",
    "sort": "-created_at,name",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'filter[0]' => 'architecto',
            'filter[name]' => 'tech',
            'filter[search]' => 'electronics hardware',
            'filter[user]' => '45,67,89',
            'filter[created_at]' => '2025-01-01,2025-01-31',
            'filter[updated_at]' => '2024-12-01,2025-01-31',
            'filter[include]' => 'user,products',
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'sort' => '-created_at,name',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors'
params = {
  'filter[0]': 'architecto',
  'filter[name]': 'tech',
  'filter[search]': 'electronics hardware',
  'filter[user]': '45,67,89',
  'filter[created_at]': '2025-01-01,2025-01-31',
  'filter[updated_at]': '2024-12-01,2025-01-31',
  'filter[include]': 'user,products',
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '25',
  'sort': '-created_at,name',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Request      

GET api/admin/vendors

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

filter   string[]  optional  

optional Array of filter parameters to narrow down results.

filter[name]   string  optional  

optional Filter vendors by business name (partial match supported). Example: tech

filter[search]   string  optional  

optional Search across vendor names and descriptions. Example: electronics hardware

filter[user]   string  optional  

optional Filter by user ID(s) who own vendors. Single ID or comma-separated multiple IDs. Example: 45,67,89

filter[created_at]   string  optional  

optional Filter by vendor registration date. Single date or comma-separated date range (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-01,2025-01-31

filter[updated_at]   string  optional  

optional Filter by last update date. Single date or comma-separated date range (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2024-12-01,2025-01-31

filter[include]   string  optional  

optional Include related data. Options: user,products,media. Example: user,products

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of vendors per page (max 100). Default: 15. Example: 25

sort   string  optional  

optional Sort vendors. Prefix with '-' for descending. Available: name, created_at, updated_at. Example: -created_at,name

Retrieve a specific vendor's detailed information

requires authentication

Get comprehensive information about a specific vendor including business details, associated user account, branding assets, product statistics, and marketplace performance data. This endpoint provides administrators with complete visibility into vendor profiles for partnership management, performance monitoring, and customer service purposes.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Request      

GET api/admin/vendors/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the vendor. Example: 1

vendor   integer   

The ID of the vendor to retrieve. Example: 12

Create a new vendor profile

requires authentication

Register a new vendor in the marketplace with complete business profile information. This endpoint allows administrators to onboard new business partners with detailed company information, branding assets, and user account associations. The created vendor can immediately begin listing products and managing their marketplace presence. Supports secure logo upload with comprehensive validation.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "user_id=45"\
    --form "name=TechCraft Solutions Ltd"\
    --form "description=Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting."\
    --form "logo=@/tmp/php61xGQh" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('user_id', '45');
body.append('name', 'TechCraft Solutions Ltd');
body.append('description', 'Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting.');
body.append('logo', document.querySelector('input[name="logo"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'multipart/form-data',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'multipart' => [
            [
                'name' => 'user_id',
                'contents' => '45'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'name',
                'contents' => 'TechCraft Solutions Ltd'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'description',
                'contents' => 'Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting.'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'logo',
                'contents' => fopen('/tmp/php61xGQh', 'r')
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors'
files = {
  'user_id': (None, '45'),
  'name': (None, 'TechCraft Solutions Ltd'),
  'description': (None, 'Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting.'),
  'logo': open('/tmp/php61xGQh', 'rb')}
payload = {
    "user_id": 45,
    "name": "TechCraft Solutions Ltd",
    "description": "Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting."
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, files=files)
response.json()

        "The logo must be an image.",
        "The logo may not be greater than 2048 kilobytes."

Request      

POST api/admin/vendors

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

user_id   integer   

The ID of the user account that will own this vendor profile. Must be a valid, existing user. Example: 45

name   string   

The vendor's business name. Will be used for public display and branding. Example: TechCraft Solutions Ltd

description   string   

Detailed description of the vendor's business, products, or services. Maximum 1000 characters. Example: Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting.

logo   file  optional  

optional Business logo file. Must be an image (JPG, JPEG, PNG) with maximum size of 2MB. Recommended dimensions: 200x200px minimum. Example: /tmp/php61xGQh

Update an existing vendor's information

requires authentication

Modify an existing vendor's profile information including business details, user associations, descriptions, and branding assets. This endpoint supports partial updates - only provided fields will be updated, others remain unchanged. Administrators can update vendor information for partnership management, profile corrections, and branding updates. Includes secure logo replacement with comprehensive validation.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "user_id=67"\
    --form "name=TechCraft Solutions International Ltd"\
    --form "description=Global leader in innovative technology solutions. We specialize in enterprise software development, cloud migration services, AI integration, and digital transformation consulting with over 15 years of proven industry experience."\
    --form "logo=@/tmp/php0L1HWN" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('user_id', '67');
body.append('name', 'TechCraft Solutions International Ltd');
body.append('description', 'Global leader in innovative technology solutions. We specialize in enterprise software development, cloud migration services, AI integration, and digital transformation consulting with over 15 years of proven industry experience.');
body.append('logo', document.querySelector('input[name="logo"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/vendors/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'multipart/form-data',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'multipart' => [
            [
                'name' => 'user_id',
                'contents' => '67'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'name',
                'contents' => 'TechCraft Solutions International Ltd'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'description',
                'contents' => 'Global leader in innovative technology solutions. We specialize in enterprise software development, cloud migration services, AI integration, and digital transformation consulting with over 15 years of proven industry experience.'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'logo',
                'contents' => fopen('/tmp/php0L1HWN', 'r')
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

    "user_id": 67,

  'Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}
