Order Management

Retrieve paginated list of orders

requires authentication

Get a paginated list of all orders in the system. This endpoint supports filtering by user and status, and includes comprehensive order information including items, user details, and current status.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders?user_id=123&status_id=2&page=1&per_page=20" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders"
);

const params = {
    "user_id": "123",
    "status_id": "2",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "20",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'user_id' => '123',
            'status_id' => '2',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '20',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders'
params = {
  'user_id': '123',
  'status_id': '2',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '20',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Success with orders):


{
    "message": "Orders retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "total_amount": 29.99,
                "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T10:35:00.000000Z",
                "deleted_at": null,
                "user": {
                    "id": 5,
                    "name": "John Smith",
                    "email": "john.smith@example.com",
                    "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z"
                },
                "status": {
                    "id": 2,
                    "name": "Processing"
                },
                "order_items": [
                    {
                        "id": 1,
                        "quantity": 2,
                        "price": 1499,
                        "price_formatted": "£14.99",
                        "line_total": 2998,
                        "line_total_formatted": "£29.98",
                        "product": {
                            "id": 10,
                            "name": "Wireless Headphones",
                            "description": "High-quality wireless headphones with noise cancellation"
                        },
                        "product_variant": {
                            "id": 3,
                            "value": "Black",
                            "additional_price": 0,
                            "product_attribute": {
                                "id": 1,
                                "name": "Color"
                            }
                        },
                        "order_return": null
                    }
                ],
                "payments": [
                    {
                        "id": 1,
                        "amount": 2999,
                        "amount_formatted": "£29.99",
                        "status": "Paid",
                        "method": "stripe",
                        "transaction_reference": "pi_1234567890abcdef",
                        "processed_at": "2025-01-15T10:32:00.000000Z"
                    }
                ]
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 42,
        "last_page": 3,
        "from": 1,
        "to": 15
    }
}

Example response (200, No orders found):


{
    "message": "Orders retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The user id field must be an integer.",
        "The status id field must exist in order_statuses table."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/orders

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter orders by specific user ID. Example: 123

status_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter orders by specific status ID. Example: 2

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of orders per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 20

Body Parameters

user_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the users table.

status_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the order_statuses table.

Create a new order

requires authentication

Create a new order with multiple order items. The system will automatically calculate the total amount based on the items and their quantities. All monetary values should be provided in pennies.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"user_id\": 5,
    \"status_id\": 1,
    \"order_items\": [
        \"architecto\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "user_id": 5,
    "status_id": 1,
    "order_items": [
        "architecto"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'user_id' => 5,
            'status_id' => 1,
            'order_items' => [
                'architecto',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders'
payload = {
    "user_id": 5,
    "status_id": 1,
    "order_items": [
        "architecto"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order created successfully):


{
    "message": "Order created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 43,
        "total_amount": 2999,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "user": {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "John Smith",
            "email": "john.smith@example.com"
        },
        "status": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Pending Payment"
        },
        "order_items": [
            {
                "id": 85,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price": 1499,
                "price_formatted": "£14.99",
                "line_total": 2998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£29.98",
                "product": {
                    "id": 10,
                    "name": "Wireless Headphones",
                    "price": 1499,
                    "price_formatted": "£14.99"
                },
                "product_variant": {
                    "id": 3,
                    "value": "Black",
                    "additional_price": 0
                }
            }
        ],
        "payments": []
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, User not found):


{
    "message": "The selected user id is invalid."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The user id field is required.",
        "The order items field is required.",
        "The order items.0.product id field is required.",
        "The order items.0.quantity must be at least 1.",
        "The order items.0.price must be greater than 0."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while creating the order."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/orders

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

user_id   integer   

The ID of the user placing the order. Example: 5

status_id   integer  optional  

optional The initial status ID for the order. If not provided, defaults to "Pending Payment". Example: 1

order_items   string[]   

Array of order items. Must contain at least one item.
product_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: architecto

product_variant_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the product_variants table.

quantity   integer   

Must be at least 1. Example: 22

price   number   

Must be at least 0. Example: 84

*   object  optional  
product_id   integer   

The ID of the product being ordered. Example: 10

product_variant_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the product variant (if applicable). Example: 3

quantity   integer   

The quantity of this item (minimum 1). Example: 2

price   numeric   

The price per item in pounds (will be converted to pennies). Example: 14.99

Retrieve a specific order

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific order including all order items, user details, payment information, and any associated returns or refunds.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order found):


{
    "message": "Order retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 43,
        "total_amount": 5998,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£59.98",
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:25:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "user": {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "John Smith",
            "email": "john.smith@example.com",
            "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        "status": {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "Confirmed"
        },
        "order_items": [
            {
                "id": 85,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price": 1499,
                "price_formatted": "£14.99",
                "line_total": 2998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£29.98",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
                "product": {
                    "id": 10,
                    "name": "Wireless Headphones",
                    "description": "High-quality wireless headphones with noise cancellation",
                    "price": 1499,
                    "price_formatted": "£14.99"
                },
                "product_variant": {
                    "id": 3,
                    "value": "Black",
                    "additional_price": 0,
                    "product_attribute": {
                        "id": 1,
                        "name": "Color"
                    }
                },
                "order_return": {
                    "id": 12,
                    "reason": "Product arrived damaged",
                    "status": {
                        "id": 1,
                        "name": "Requested"
                    },
                    "created_at": "2025-01-16T09:15:00.000000Z"
                }
            },
            {
                "id": 86,
                "quantity": 1,
                "price": 2999,
                "price_formatted": "£29.99",
                "line_total": 2999,
                "line_total_formatted": "£29.99",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Bluetooth Speaker",
                    "description": "Portable waterproof Bluetooth speaker",
                    "price": 2999,
                    "price_formatted": "£29.99"
                },
                "product_variant": null,
                "order_return": null
            }
        ],
        "payments": [
            {
                "id": 25,
                "amount": 5998,
                "amount_formatted": "£59.98",
                "status": "Paid",
                "method": "stripe",
                "transaction_reference": "pi_1234567890abcdef",
                "processed_at": "2025-01-15T14:22:00.000000Z",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:21:00.000000Z"
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Order not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Order] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/orders/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the order. Example: 1

order   integer   

The ID of the order to retrieve. Example: 43

Update an existing order

requires authentication

Update an existing order including its items. This will replace all existing order items with the new ones and recalculate the total amount. Use with caution as this will affect order history.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"user_id\": 5,
    \"status_id\": 2,
    \"order_items\": [
        \"architecto\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "user_id": 5,
    "status_id": 2,
    "order_items": [
        "architecto"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'user_id' => 5,
            'status_id' => 2,
            'order_items' => [
                'architecto',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1'
payload = {
    "user_id": 5,
    "status_id": 2,
    "order_items": [
        "architecto"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Order updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 43,
        "total_amount": 4497,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£44.97",
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "user": {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "John Smith",
            "email": "john.smith@example.com"
        },
        "status": {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Processing"
        },
        "order_items": [
            {
                "id": 87,
                "quantity": 3,
                "price": 1499,
                "price_formatted": "£14.99",
                "line_total": 4497,
                "line_total_formatted": "£44.97",
                "product": {
                    "id": 10,
                    "name": "Wireless Headphones"
                }
            }
        ],
        "payments": []
    }
}

Example response (400, Order cannot be updated):


{
    "message": "Cannot update order that has been shipped or completed."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Order not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Order] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The order items field is required.",
        "The order items.0.quantity must be at least 1."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/orders/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the order. Example: 1

order   integer   

The ID of the order to update. Example: 43

Body Parameters

user_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the user (can be changed if needed). Example: 5

status_id   integer  optional  

optional The new status ID for the order. Example: 2

order_items   string[]   

Array of order items (replaces existing items).
product_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: architecto

product_variant_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the product_variants table.

quantity   integer   

Must be at least 1. Example: 22

price   number   

Must be at least 0. Example: 84

*   object  optional  
product_id   integer   

The ID of the product. Example: 10

product_variant_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the product variant. Example: 3

quantity   integer   

The quantity (minimum 1). Example: 3

price   numeric   

The price per item in pounds. Example: 14.99

Soft delete an order

requires authentication

Soft delete an order, making it inactive but preserving the data for audit purposes. The order will be hidden from normal queries but can be restored if needed.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order soft deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Order deleted (soft)."
}

Example response (400, Order cannot be deleted):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete order with active payments or shipments."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Order not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Order] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/orders/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the order. Example: 1

order   integer   

The ID of the order to soft delete. Example: 43

Permanently delete an order

requires authentication

Permanently remove an order from the database. This action is irreversible and should be used with extreme caution. The order must be soft deleted first before it can be permanently deleted.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/force-delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/force-delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/force-delete';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/force-delete'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order permanently deleted):


{
    "message": "Order permanently deleted."
}

Example response (400, Order must be soft deleted first):


{
    "message": "Order must be soft deleted before force deleting."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Order not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Order] 43"
}

Example response (409, Order has dependencies):


{
    "message": "Cannot permanently delete order with associated payments or returns."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/orders/{id}/force-delete

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the soft deleted order to permanently delete. Example: 43

Restore a soft deleted order

requires authentication

Restore a previously soft deleted order, making it active again in the system. Only orders that have been soft deleted can be restored.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/restore" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/restore"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/restore';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/orders/43/restore'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('PATCH', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order restored successfully):


{
    "message": "Order restored successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 43,
        "total_amount": 2999,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T16:45:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "user": {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "John Smith",
            "email": "john.smith@example.com"
        },
        "status": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Pending Payment"
        }
    }
}

Example response (400, Order not deleted):


{
    "message": "Order is not deleted."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Order not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Order] 43"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

PATCH api/admin/orders/{id}/restore

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the soft deleted order to restore. Example: 43

Payment Processing

Create or retrieve payment intent

requires authentication

Creates a new Stripe PaymentIntent for the specified order, or returns an existing one if already created. This prevents duplicate payment intents for the same order. The client secret returned should be used on the frontend to complete the payment with Stripe's client-side libraries.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"order_id\": 123
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "order_id": 123
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'order_id' => 123,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create'
payload = {
    "order_id": 123
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, New PaymentIntent created):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "PaymentIntent created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "client_secret": "pi_1234567890abcdef_secret_xyz789abc123"
    }
}

Example response (200, Existing PaymentIntent retrieved):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Existing PaymentIntent retrieved.",
    "data": {
        "client_secret": "pi_1234567890abcdef_secret_xyz789abc123"
    }
}

Example response (200, Order already paid):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment has already been processed for this order.",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Unsupported gateway):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unsupported payment gateway",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Order not eligible for payment):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Order has already been paid or is not in a payable state.",
    "data": null
}

Example response (404, Order not found):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Order] 999",
    "data": null
}

Example response (422, Invalid order data):


{
    "errors": [
        "The order id field is required.",
        "The order id must be an integer.",
        "The selected order id is invalid."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Stripe API error):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unable to create payment intent with Stripe. Please try again.",
    "data": null
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/payments/{gateway}/create

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

gateway   string   

The payment gateway to use. Currently only "stripe" is supported. Example: stripe

Body Parameters

order_id   integer   

The ID of the order to create payment for. Must be a valid, unpaid order. Example: 123

Verify payment status

requires authentication

Manually verifies the status of a payment with Stripe and updates the local database accordingly. This is useful for handling cases where webhooks might have failed or been delayed. It fetches the latest payment status directly from Stripe and synchronizes it with your database.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"payment_intent_id\": \"pi_1234567890abcdef\",
    \"order_id\": 123
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "payment_intent_id": "pi_1234567890abcdef",
    "order_id": 123
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'payment_intent_id' => 'pi_1234567890abcdef',
            'order_id' => 123,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify'
payload = {
    "payment_intent_id": "pi_1234567890abcdef",
    "order_id": 123
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Payment verified as successful):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment verified",
    "data": {
        "payment_status": "Paid",
        "order_status": "Confirmed"
    }
}

Example response (200, Payment still pending):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment verified",
    "data": {
        "payment_status": "Pending",
        "order_status": "Pending Payment"
    }
}

Example response (200, Payment failed):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment verified",
    "data": {
        "payment_status": "Failed",
        "order_status": "Failed"
    }
}

Example response (400, Unsupported gateway):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unsupported payment gateway",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Payment amount mismatch):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Payment amount mismatch",
    "data": null
}

Example response (404, Payment not found in database):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Payment not found",
    "data": null
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The payment intent id field is required.",
        "The payment intent id format is invalid. Must be a valid Stripe payment intent ID.",
        "The order id field is required.",
        "The selected order id is invalid."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Stripe API error):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unable to retrieve payment from Stripe: No such payment_intent: 'pi_invalid'",
    "data": null
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/payments/{gateway}/verify

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

gateway   string   

The payment gateway used. Currently only "stripe" is supported. Example: stripe

Body Parameters

payment_intent_id   string   

The Stripe PaymentIntent ID to verify. Must be a valid Stripe PaymentIntent ID format. Example: pi_1234567890abcdef

order_id   integer   

The ID of the order associated with this payment for verification. Example: 123

Refund Management

Retrieve a paginated list of all refund records

requires authentication

Get a comprehensive list of all refunds processed in the system with detailed information about amounts, statuses, associated orders, and processing details. This endpoint is essential for financial reporting, refund tracking, customer service, and administrative oversight of refund operations. Includes complete audit trail for each refund transaction.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds?page=2&per_page=25&status=Refunded&date_from=2025-01-01&date_to=2025-01-31&order_id=45&user_id=123&amount_min=10.00&amount_max=500.00" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds"
);

const params = {
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "25",
    "status": "Refunded",
    "date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "date_to": "2025-01-31",
    "order_id": "45",
    "user_id": "123",
    "amount_min": "10.00",
    "amount_max": "500.00",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'status' => 'Refunded',
            'date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'date_to' => '2025-01-31',
            'order_id' => '45',
            'user_id' => '123',
            'amount_min' => '10.00',
            'amount_max' => '500.00',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds'
params = {
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '25',
  'status': 'Refunded',
  'date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'date_to': '2025-01-31',
  'order_id': '45',
  'user_id': '123',
  'amount_min': '10.00',
  'amount_max': '500.00',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

    }
}

{
    "message": "Refunds retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The status field must be one of: Pending, Processing, Refunded, Partially Refunded, Failed, Cancelled, Declined.",
        "The date from field must be a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format.",
        "The amount min field must be a number greater than 0.",
        "The order id field must be an integer."
    ]
}

Request      

GET api/admin/refunds

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of refunds per page (max 100). Default: 20. Example: 25

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by refund status. Available: Pending, Processing, Refunded, Partially Refunded, Failed, Cancelled, Declined. Example: Refunded

date_from   string  optional  

optional Filter refunds from this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-01

date_to   string  optional  

optional Filter refunds to this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-31

order_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter refunds by specific order ID. Example: 45

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter refunds by specific customer ID. Example: 123

amount_min   string  optional  

numeric optional Filter refunds with minimum amount in pounds. Example: 10.00

amount_max   string  optional  

numeric optional Filter refunds with maximum amount in pounds. Example: 500.00

Admin Review Management

Get all reported reviews for moderation

requires authentication

Retrieve all reviews that have been reported by users, sorted by priority and report severity. Essential for content moderation workflow.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports?status=pending&reason=spam&priority=high&sort_by=reports_count&per_page=50" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports"
);

const params = {
    "status": "pending",
    "reason": "spam",
    "priority": "high",
    "sort_by": "reports_count",
    "per_page": "50",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'status' => 'pending',
            'reason' => 'spam',
            'priority' => 'high',
            'sort_by' => 'reports_count',
            'per_page' => '50',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports'
params = {
  'status': 'pending',
  'reason': 'spam',
  'priority': 'high',
  'sort_by': 'reports_count',
  'per_page': '50',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

    "message": "Reported reviews retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [

                    "rating": 1,
                    "title": "Terrible product",
                    "content": "This is spam content with promotional links...",
                    "user": {
                        "id": 45,
                        "name": "Suspicious User"
                    },
                    "product": {
                        "id": 15,
                        "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds"
                    }
                },
                "reports": [
                    {
                        "id": 67,
                        "reason": "spam",
                        "details": "Contains promotional links and fake claims",
                        "status": "pending",
                        "priority": "high",
                        "reported_by": {
                            "id": 89,
                            "name": "John Doe"
                        },
                        "created_at": "2025-01-12T10:30:00.000000Z"
                    }
                ],
                "reports_count": 3,
                "last_reported_at": "2025-01-13T08:15:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 47
    }
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/reviews/reports

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by report status. Options: pending, reviewed, resolved, dismissed. Default: pending. Example: pending

reason   string  optional  

optional Filter by report reason. Options: spam, inappropriate_language, fake_review, off_topic, personal_information, other. Example: spam

priority   string  optional  

optional Filter by priority level. Options: high, medium, low. Example: high

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort reports. Options: newest, oldest, priority, reports_count. Default: priority. Example: reports_count

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of reports per page (1-100). Default: 20. Example: 50

Get review analytics and statistics

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive analytics about reviews including trends, moderation statistics, and quality metrics for administrative insights.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/analytics?period=week&product_id=15&include_trends=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/analytics"
);

const params = {
    "period": "week",
    "product_id": "15",
    "include_trends": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/analytics';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'period' => 'week',
            'product_id' => '15',
            'include_trends' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/analytics'
params = {
  'period': 'week',
  'product_id': '15',
  'include_trends': '1',
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

Request      

GET api/admin/reviews/analytics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

period   string  optional  

optional Time period for analytics. Options: today, week, month, quarter, year. Default: month. Example: week

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Get analytics for specific product. Example: 15

include_trends   boolean  optional  

optional Include trend data and charts. Default: false. Example: true

Bulk moderate multiple reviews

requires authentication

Perform the same moderation action on multiple reviews simultaneously. Useful for bulk approval, rejection, or featuring of reviews.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"review_ids\": [
        123,
        124,
        125
    ],
    \"action\": \"approve\",
    \"reason\": \"\\\"Quality assurance batch approval\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "review_ids": [
        123,
        124,
        125
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'review_ids' => [
                123,
                124,
                125,
            ],
            'action' => 'approve',
            'reason' => '"Quality assurance batch approval"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate'
payload = {
    "review_ids": [
        123,
        124,
        125
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Bulk moderation completed):


{
    "message": "Bulk moderation completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "action": "approve",
        "total_reviews": 3,
        "successful": 3,
        "failed": 0,
        "results": [
            {
                "review_id": 123,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Review approved"
            },
            {
                "review_id": 124,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Review approved"
            },
            {
                "review_id": 125,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Review approved"
            }
        ],
        "moderated_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "moderated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The review_ids field is required.",
        "The action field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

review_ids   string[]   

Array of review IDs to moderate.

action   string   

Bulk action to perform. Options: approve, reject, feature, unfeature. Example: approve

reason   string  optional  

optional Reason for bulk action (required for reject). Example: "Quality assurance batch approval"

Get all reviews with admin filtering capabilities

requires authentication

Retrieve all reviews in the system with advanced admin filtering and sorting. Provides comprehensive review management including pending approvals, reported reviews, and detailed analytics for administrative oversight.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews?product_id=15&user_id=45&rating[]=1&rating[]=2&status=pending&is_featured=1&is_verified=1&has_reports=1&sort_by=reports_count&per_page=50&page=2" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": 16,
    \"rating\": [
        2
    ],
    \"verified_only\": true,
    \"with_media\": false,
    \"sort_by\": \"rating_low\",
    \"per_page\": 1,
    \"page\": 66
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews"
);

const params = {
    "product_id": "15",
    "user_id": "45",
    "rating[0]": "1",
    "rating[1]": "2",
    "status": "pending",
    "is_featured": "1",
    "is_verified": "1",
    "has_reports": "1",
    "sort_by": "reports_count",
    "per_page": "50",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": true,
    "with_media": false,
    "sort_by": "rating_low",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'product_id' => '15',
            'user_id' => '45',
            'rating[0]' => '1',
            'rating[1]' => '2',
            'status' => 'pending',
            'is_featured' => '1',
            'is_verified' => '1',
            'has_reports' => '1',
            'sort_by' => 'reports_count',
            'per_page' => '50',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 16,
            'rating' => [
                2,
            ],
            'verified_only' => true,
            'with_media' => false,
            'sort_by' => 'rating_low',
            'per_page' => 1,
            'page' => 66,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews'
payload = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": true,
    "with_media": false,
    "sort_by": "rating_low",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
}
params = {
  'product_id': '15',
  'user_id': '45',
  'rating[0]': '1',
  'rating[1]': '2',
  'status': 'pending',
  'is_featured': '1',
  'is_verified': '1',
  'has_reports': '1',
  'sort_by': 'reports_count',
  'per_page': '50',
  'page': '2',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Reviews retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Reviews retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 123,
                "user": {
                    "id": 45,
                    "name": "Sarah Johnson",
                    "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com"
                },
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds"
                },
                "rating": 5,
                "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
                "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations...",
                "is_verified_purchase": true,
                "is_featured": false,
                "is_approved": true,
                "helpful_votes": 12,
                "total_votes": 15,
                "reports_count": 0,
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 1543,
        "last_page": 78
    },
    "meta": {
        "stats": {
            "total_reviews": 1543,
            "pending_approval": 23,
            "reported_reviews": 8,
            "featured_reviews": 45,
            "average_rating": 4.2
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/reviews

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific product ID. Example: 15

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific user ID. Example: 45

rating   string[]  optional  

optional Filter by specific ratings (1-5).

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by approval status. Options: approved, pending, rejected. Example: pending

is_featured   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by featured status. Example: true

is_verified   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by verified purchase status. Example: true

has_reports   boolean  optional  

optional Filter reviews that have been reported. Example: true

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort reviews. Options: newest, oldest, rating_high, rating_low, reports_count. Example: reports_count

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of reviews per page (1-100). Default: 20. Example: 50

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Body Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: 16

rating   integer[]  optional  

Must be between 1 and 5.

verified_only   boolean  optional  

Example: true

with_media   boolean  optional  

Example: false

sort_by   string  optional  

Example: rating_low

Must be one of:
  • newest
  • oldest
  • rating_high
  • rating_low
  • helpful
per_page   integer  optional  

Must be between 1 and 50. Example: 1

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 66

Get detailed review information for admin

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive admin view of a specific review including all reports, moderation history, user details, and administrative actions available.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Review details retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "user": {
            "id": 45,
            "name": "Sarah Johnson",
            "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
            "total_reviews": 8,
            "average_rating": 4.3
        },
        "product": {
            "id": 15,
            "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds",
            "average_rating": 4.5,
            "total_reviews": 127
        },
        "rating": 5,
        "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
        "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations...",
        "is_verified_purchase": true,
        "is_featured": false,
        "is_approved": true,
        "helpful_votes": 12,
        "total_votes": 15,
        "reports": [
            {
                "id": 67,
                "reason": "spam",
                "details": "Contains promotional links",
                "status": "pending",
                "reported_by": {
                    "id": 89,
                    "name": "John Doe"
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-12T10:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "moderation_history": [
            {
                "action": "featured",
                "moderator": "Admin User",
                "timestamp": "2025-01-11T15:45:00.000000Z",
                "reason": "High quality review with helpful details"
            }
        ],
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}

review   integer

Delete a review permanently

requires authentication

Permanently delete a review and all associated data including media files, helpfulness votes, and reports. This action is irreversible.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

{
    "message": "Review deleted permanently."

Moderate a review (approve, reject, feature, unfeature)

requires authentication

Perform moderation actions on reviews including approval, rejection, featuring, and unfeaturing. All actions are logged for audit trail and accountability.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"action\": \"approve\",
    \"reason\": \"\\\"Contains inappropriate language\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Contains inappropriate language\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'action' => 'approve',
            'reason' => '"Contains inappropriate language"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate'
payload = {
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Contains inappropriate language\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review moderated successfully):


{
    "message": "Review approved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "action": "approve",
        "is_approved": true,
        "is_featured": false,
        "moderated_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "moderated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "reason": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "Reason is required when rejecting a review.",
        "Invalid moderation action."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/reviews/{review_id}/moderate

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to moderate. Example: 123

Body Parameters

action   string   

Moderation action to perform. Options: approve, reject, feature, unfeature. Example: approve

reason   string  optional  

optional Reason for the action (required for reject). Example: "Contains inappropriate language"

Handle a review report (resolve, dismiss)

requires authentication

Take action on review reports by resolving or dismissing them. Resolved reports indicate action was taken, dismissed reports indicate the report was invalid or not actionable.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"action\": \"resolve\",
    \"notes\": \"\\\"Review content violates community guidelines\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "action": "resolve",
    "notes": "\"Review content violates community guidelines\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'action' => 'resolve',
            'notes' => '"Review content violates community guidelines"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle'
payload = {
    "action": "resolve",
    "notes": "\"Review content violates community guidelines\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Report handled successfully):


{
    "message": "Review report resolved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "report_id": 67,
        "review_id": 123,
        "action": "resolve",
        "status": "resolved",
        "admin_notes": "Review content violates community guidelines",
        "reviewed_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "reviewed_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Report not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ReviewReport] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/reviews/reports/{report_id}/handle

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

report_id   integer   

The ID of the report. Example: 16

report   integer   

The ID of the review report to handle. Example: 67

Body Parameters

action   string   

Action to take on the report. Options: resolve, dismiss. Example: resolve

notes   string  optional  

optional Admin notes explaining the decision. Example: "Review content violates community guidelines"

Admin Review Response Management

Get review response analytics and statistics

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive analytics about vendor responses including response rates, approval statistics, vendor performance metrics, and trends for administrative insights.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics?period=week&vendor_id=8&include_trends=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics"
);

const params = {
    "period": "week",
    "vendor_id": "8",
    "include_trends": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'period' => 'week',
            'vendor_id' => '8',
            'include_trends' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics'
params = {
  'period': 'week',
  'vendor_id': '8',
  'include_trends': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

{
    "message": "Response analytics retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "summary": {
            "total_responses": 156,
            "pending_approval": 12,
            "approved_responses": 144,
            "response_rate": 73.2,
            "average_response_time_hours": 6.4
        },
        "period_stats": {
            "new_responses": 23,
            "approved_responses": 21,
            "rejected_responses": 1
        },
        "top_vendors": [
            {
                "vendor_id": 8,
                "vendor_name": "Tech Solutions Inc",
                "response_count": 45,
                "response_rate": 89.5,
                "average_response_time": 4.2
            },
            {
                "vendor_id": 12,
                "vendor_name": "Premium Electronics",
                "response_count": 32,
                "response_rate": 78.3,
                "average_response_time": 8.1
            }
        ],
        "response_trends": {
            "daily_responses": [
                {
                    "date": "2025-01-10",
                    "responses": 8
                },
                {
                    "date": "2025-01-11",
                    "responses": 12
                },
                {
                    "date": "2025-01-12",
                    "responses": 6
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}
Received response:
