If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/review-responses/analytics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

period   string  optional  

optional Time period for analytics. Options: today, week, month, quarter, year. Default: month. Example: week

vendor_id   integer  optional  

optional Get analytics for specific vendor. Example: 8

include_trends   boolean  optional  

optional Include trend data and charts. Default: false. Example: true

Bulk moderate multiple vendor responses

requires authentication

Perform the same moderation action on multiple vendor responses simultaneously. Useful for bulk approval, rejection, or deletion of responses.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"response_ids\": [
        45,
        46,
        47
    ],
    \"action\": \"approve\",
    \"reason\": \"\\\"Quality assurance batch approval\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "response_ids": [
        45,
        46,
        47
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'response_ids' => [
                45,
                46,
                47,
            ],
            'action' => 'approve',
            'reason' => '"Quality assurance batch approval"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate'
payload = {
    "response_ids": [
        45,
        46,
        47
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Bulk moderation completed):


{
    "message": "Bulk moderation completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "action": "approve",
        "total_responses": 3,
        "successful": 3,
        "failed": 0,
        "results": [
            {
                "response_id": 45,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Approved successfully"
            },
            {
                "response_id": 46,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Approved successfully"
            },
            {
                "response_id": 47,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Approved successfully"
            }
        ],
        "moderated_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "moderated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The response_ids field is required.",
        "The action field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

response_ids   string[]   

Array of response IDs to moderate.

action   string   

Bulk action to perform. Options: approve, reject, delete. Example: approve

reason   string  optional  

optional Reason for bulk action (recommended for reject/delete). Example: "Quality assurance batch approval"

Get all review responses with admin filtering capabilities

requires authentication

Retrieve all vendor responses in the system with advanced admin filtering and sorting. Provides comprehensive response management including pending approvals, response analytics, and detailed oversight for administrative purposes.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses?vendor_id=5&product_id=15&review_rating[]=4&review_rating[]=5&status=pending&sort_by=newest&per_page=50&page=2" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses"
);

const params = {
    "vendor_id": "5",
    "product_id": "15",
    "review_rating[0]": "4",
    "review_rating[1]": "5",
    "status": "pending",
    "sort_by": "newest",
    "per_page": "50",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'vendor_id' => '5',
            'product_id' => '15',
            'review_rating[0]' => '4',
            'review_rating[1]' => '5',
            'status' => 'pending',
            'sort_by' => 'newest',
            'per_page' => '50',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses'
params = {
  'vendor_id': '5',
  'product_id': '15',
  'review_rating[0]': '4',
  'review_rating[1]': '5',
  'status': 'pending',
  'sort_by': 'newest',
  'per_page': '50',
  'page': '2',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Responses retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Review responses retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "review": {
                    "id": 123,
                    "rating": 4,
                    "title": "Good product",
                    "user": {
                        "id": 67,
                        "name": "John Doe",
                        "email": "john@example.com"
                    },
                    "product": {
                        "id": 15,
                        "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds"
                    }
                },
                "vendor": {
                    "id": 8,
                    "name": "Tech Solutions Inc",
                    "description": "Leading electronics vendor"
                },
                "user": {
                    "id": 89,
                    "name": "Vendor Manager",
                    "email": "manager@techsolutions.com"
                },
                "content": "Thank you for your feedback! We're glad you're satisfied with the product.",
                "is_approved": true,
                "approved_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
                "created_at": "2025-01-14T16:45:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 156,
        "last_page": 8
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/review-responses

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

vendor_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific vendor ID. Example: 5

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific product ID. Example: 15

review_rating   string[]  optional  

optional Filter by review ratings (1-5).

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by approval status. Options: approved, pending, rejected. Example: pending

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort responses. Options: newest, oldest, rating_high, rating_low. Example: newest

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of responses per page (1-100). Default: 20. Example: 50

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Get detailed review response information for admin

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive admin view of a specific vendor response including review context, vendor details, approval status, and administrative actions available.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Approve a vendor response

requires authentication

Approve a pending vendor response, making it visible to customers. Only responses that are currently unapproved can be approved through this endpoint.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16/approve" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16/approve"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Delete a vendor response permanently

requires authentication

Permanently delete a vendor response. This action is irreversible and will remove the response from the review thread completely.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

    "message": "Response deleted permanently."

Checkout

Get checkout summary with shipping costs

requires authentication

Calculate the total checkout cost including shipping for the current cart. This endpoint provides a preview of costs before final order creation.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/checkout/summary" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"shipping_method_id\": 1,
    \"shipping_address_id\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/checkout/summary"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "shipping_method_id": 1,
    "shipping_address_id": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/checkout/summary';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'shipping_method_id' => 1,
            'shipping_address_id' => 1,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/checkout/summary'
payload = {
    "shipping_method_id": 1,
    "shipping_address_id": 1
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Checkout summary calculated successfully):


{
    "message": "Checkout summary calculated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "items_total": 4599,
        "items_total_formatted": "£45.99",
        "shipping_cost": 599,
        "shipping_cost_formatted": "£5.99",
        "total_amount": 5198,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£51.98",
        "requires_shipping": true
    }
}

Example response (400, Cart is empty):


{
    "message": "Cart is empty."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The shipping method id field is required.",
        "The shipping address id field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/checkout/summary

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

shipping_method_id   integer   

The ID of the shipping method. Example: 1

shipping_address_id   integer   

The ID of the shipping address. Example: 1

Validate checkout data

requires authentication

Validate that the selected shipping method and address are compatible with the current cart contents before proceeding to payment.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/checkout/validate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"shipping_method_id\": 1,
    \"shipping_address_id\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/checkout/validate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "shipping_method_id": 1,
    "shipping_address_id": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/checkout/validate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'shipping_method_id' => 1,
            'shipping_address_id' => 1,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

    "shipping_method_id": 1,
    "shipping_address_id": 1

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'

        "shipping_available": true,

    }

    "message": "Selected shipping method is not available for this address."
}

Customer Shipment Management

Get user's shipments

requires authentication

Retrieve all shipments for the authenticated user, ordered by creation date. This endpoint provides a complete list of the user's shipments with basic information and pagination support. Essential for customer account pages.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments?per_page=10&page=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments"
);

const params = {
    "per_page": "10",
    "page": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'per_page' => '10',
            'page' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments'
params = {
  'per_page': '10',
  'page': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipments retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipments retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "shipments": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
                "carrier": "Royal Mail",
                "service_name": "Tracked 48",
                "status": "delivered",
                "status_label": "Delivered",
                "status_color": "green",
                "shipping_cost": 599,
                "shipping_cost_formatted": "£5.99",
                "tracking_url": "https://track.royalmail.com/AB123456789GB",
                "shipped_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z",
                "delivered_at": "2025-01-17T14:30:00.000000Z",
                "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-17T17:00:00.000000Z",
                "is_overdue": false,
                "order": {
                    "id": 123,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
                    "created_at": "2025-01-14T14:30:00.000000Z"
                },
                "shipping_method": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "Standard Delivery",
                    "carrier": "Royal Mail",
                    "estimated_delivery": "2-3 days"
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T09:45:00.000000Z"
            },
            {
                "id": 2,
                "tracking_number": "CD987654321GB",
                "carrier": "DPD",
                "service_name": "Next Day",
                "status": "shipped",
                "status_label": "Shipped",
                "status_color": "blue",
                "shipping_cost": 999,
                "shipping_cost_formatted": "£9.99",
                "tracking_url": "https://track.dpd.co.uk/CD987654321GB",
                "shipped_at": "2025-01-16T11:00:00.000000Z",
                "delivered_at": null,
                "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-17T13:00:00.000000Z",
                "is_overdue": false,
                "order": {
                    "id": 124,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£75.50",
                    "created_at": "2025-01-16T09:20:00.000000Z"
                },
                "shipping_method": {
                    "id": 2,
                    "name": "Express Delivery",
                    "carrier": "DPD",
                    "estimated_delivery": "1 day"
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-16T10:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "pagination": {
            "current_page": 1,
            "per_page": 15,
            "total": 8,
            "last_page": 1
        }
    }
}

Example response (200, No shipments found):


{
    "message": "Shipments retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "shipments": [],
        "pagination": {
            "current_page": 1,
            "per_page": 15,
            "total": 0,
            "last_page": 1
        }
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/my-shipments

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of shipments per page. Default: 15. Example: 10

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

Get specific user shipment

requires authentication

Retrieve detailed information about a specific shipment belonging to the authenticated user. This endpoint includes complete shipment details, order information, and attempts to fetch the latest tracking information from the carrier.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/my-shipments/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipment retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipment retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",

        "status": "delivered",
        "status_label": "Delivered",
        "status_color": "green",
        "shipping_cost": 599,
        "shipping_cost_formatted": "£5.99",
        "tracking_url": "https://track.royalmail.com/AB123456789GB",
        "shipped_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z",
        "delivered_at": "2025-01-17T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-17T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "days_in_transit": 2,
        "is_overdue": false,
        "notes": "Handle with care",
        "order": {
            "id": 123,
            "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
            "created_at": "2025-01-14T14:30:00.000000Z"
        },

            "name": "Standard Delivery",
            "carrier": "Royal Mail",
            "estimated_delivery": "2-3 days"
        },
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T09:45:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-17T14:30:00.000000Z"

}

Request      

GET api/my-shipments/{shipment_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shipment_id   integer   

The ID of the shipment. Example: 16

shipment   integer   

The ID of the shipment to retrieve. Example: 1

Customer Shipping Addresses

Retrieve user's shipping addresses

requires authentication

Get all shipping addresses for the authenticated user, ordered by default status and creation date. This endpoint returns the user's address book with default addresses appearing first, essential for checkout and order management.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Request      

GET api/shipping-addresses

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new shipping address

requires authentication

Create a new shipping address for the authenticated user. If the address is marked as default, it will automatically unset the default flag from other addresses of the same type. The system supports address validation and formatting.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"type\": \"shipping\",
    \"name\": \"John Smith\",
    \"company\": \"Acme Corp\",
    \"line1\": \"g\",
    \"line2\": \"z\",
    \"city\": \"London\",
    \"county\": \"i\",
    \"postcode\": \"SW1A 1AA\",
    \"country\": \"GB\",
    \"phone\": \"+44 20 7123 4567\",
    \"is_default\": true,
    \"address_line_1\": \"123 Main Street\",
    \"address_line_2\": \"Suite 100\",
    \"state\": \"Greater London\",
    \"special_instructions\": \"Leave at front door\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "type": "shipping",
    "name": "John Smith",
    "company": "Acme Corp",
    "line1": "g",
    "line2": "z",
    "city": "London",
    "county": "i",
    "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
    "country": "GB",
    "phone": "+44 20 7123 4567",
    "is_default": true,
    "address_line_1": "123 Main Street",
    "address_line_2": "Suite 100",
    "state": "Greater London",
    "special_instructions": "Leave at front door"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'type' => 'shipping',
            'name' => 'John Smith',
            'company' => 'Acme Corp',
            'line1' => 'g',
            'line2' => 'z',
            'city' => 'London',
            'county' => 'i',
            'postcode' => 'SW1A 1AA',
            'country' => 'GB',
            'phone' => '+44 20 7123 4567',
            'is_default' => true,
            'address_line_1' => '123 Main Street',
            'address_line_2' => 'Suite 100',
            'state' => 'Greater London',
            'special_instructions' => 'Leave at front door',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses'
payload = {
    "type": "shipping",
    "name": "John Smith",
    "company": "Acme Corp",
    "line1": "g",
    "line2": "z",
    "city": "London",
    "county": "i",
    "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
    "country": "GB",
    "phone": "+44 20 7123 4567",
    "is_default": true,
    "address_line_1": "123 Main Street",
    "address_line_2": "Suite 100",
    "state": "Greater London",
    "special_instructions": "Leave at front door"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipping address created successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipping address created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 3,
        "user_id": 45,
        "type": "shipping",
        "name": "John Smith",
        "company": "Acme Corp",
        "address_line_1": "123 Main Street",
        "address_line_2": "Suite 100",
        "city": "London",
        "state": "Greater London",
        "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
        "country": "GB",
        "phone": "+44 20 7123 4567",
        "is_default": true,
        "is_validated": false,
        "full_address": "123 Main Street, Suite 100, London, Greater London, SW1A 1AA, United Kingdom",
        "country_name": "United Kingdom",
        "validation_status": "unvalidated",
        "special_instructions": "Leave at front door",
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The address line 1 field is required.",
        "The city field is required.",
        "The postcode field is required.",
        "The country field is required.",
        "The country must be a valid ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/shipping-addresses

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

type   string   

The address type (shipping or billing). Example: shipping

name   string   

Full name for the address. Example: John Smith

company   string  optional  

optional Company name. Example: Acme Corp

line1   string   

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: g

line2   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: z

city   string   

City name. Example: London

county   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 100 characters. Example: i

postcode   string   

Postal code. Example: SW1A 1AA

country   string   

Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2). Example: GB

phone   string  optional  

optional Phone number. Example: +44 20 7123 4567

is_default   boolean  optional  

optional Whether this is the default address for the type. Default: false. Example: true

address_line_1   string   

First line of the address. Example: 123 Main Street

address_line_2   string  optional  

optional Second line of the address (apartment, suite, etc.). Example: Suite 100

state   string  optional  

optional State or county name. Example: Greater London

special_instructions   string  optional  

optional Special delivery instructions. Example: Leave at front door

Retrieve a specific shipping address

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific shipping address. Users can only access their own addresses. This endpoint returns complete address information including validation status and formatted address details.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

        "id": 1,

        "company": "Acme Corp",
        "address_line_1": "123 Main Street",
        "address_line_2": "Suite 100",
        "city": "London",
        "state": "Greater London",
        "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
        "country": "GB",
        "phone": "+44 20 7123 4567",
        "is_default": true,
        "is_validated": true,
        "full_address": "123 Main Street, Suite 100, London, Greater London, SW1A 1AA, United Kingdom",
        "country_name": "United Kingdom",
        "validation_status": "validated",
        "special_instructions": "Leave at front door",
        "validation_data": {
            "validated_at": "2025-01-10T09:15:00.000000Z",
            "validation_service": "postcode_anywhere",
            "confidence_score": 0.98
        },
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T09:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-14T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }

Request      

GET api/shipping-addresses/{shippingAddress_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shippingAddress_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingAddress. Example: 16

shippingAddress   integer   

The ID of the shipping address to retrieve. Example: 1

Update an existing shipping address

requires authentication

Update a shipping address for the authenticated user. If the address is marked as default, it will automatically unset the default flag from other addresses of the same type. Users can only update their own addresses.

Example request:
curl --request PUT \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"type\": \"shipping\",
    \"name\": \"John Smith\",
    \"company\": \"Acme Corp\",
    \"line1\": \"g\",
    \"line2\": \"z\",
    \"city\": \"London\",
    \"county\": \"i\",
    \"postcode\": \"SW1A 1AA\",
    \"country\": \"GB\",
    \"phone\": \"+44 20 7123 4567\",
    \"is_default\": true,
    \"address_line_1\": \"123 Main Street\",
    \"address_line_2\": \"Suite 100\",
    \"state\": \"Greater London\",
    \"special_instructions\": \"Ring doorbell twice\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "type": "shipping",
    "name": "John Smith",
    "company": "Acme Corp",
    "line1": "g",
    "line2": "z",
    "city": "London",
    "county": "i",
    "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
    "country": "GB",
    "phone": "+44 20 7123 4567",
    "is_default": true,
    "address_line_1": "123 Main Street",
    "address_line_2": "Suite 100",
    "state": "Greater London",
    "special_instructions": "Ring doorbell twice"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PUT",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16';
$response = $client->put(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'type' => 'shipping',
            'name' => 'John Smith',
            'company' => 'Acme Corp',
            'line1' => 'g',
            'line2' => 'z',
            'city' => 'London',
            'county' => 'i',
            'postcode' => 'SW1A 1AA',
            'country' => 'GB',
            'phone' => '+44 20 7123 4567',
            'is_default' => true,
            'address_line_1' => '123 Main Street',
            'address_line_2' => 'Suite 100',
            'state' => 'Greater London',
            'special_instructions' => 'Ring doorbell twice',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

    "special_instructions": "Ring doorbell twice"

  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'

response.json()

    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ShippingAddress] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The postcode field is required.",
        "The country must be a valid ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

PUT api/shipping-addresses/{shippingAddress_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shippingAddress_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingAddress. Example: 16

shippingAddress   integer   

The ID of the shipping address to update. Example: 1

Body Parameters

type   string  optional  

optional The address type (shipping or billing). Example: shipping

name   string  optional  

optional Full name for the address. Example: John Smith

company   string  optional  

optional Company name. Example: Acme Corp

line1   string   

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: g

line2   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: z

city   string  optional  

optional City name. Example: London

county   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 100 characters. Example: i

postcode   string  optional  

optional Postal code. Example: SW1A 1AA

country   string  optional  

optional Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2). Example: GB

phone   string  optional  

optional Phone number. Example: +44 20 7123 4567

is_default   boolean  optional  

optional Whether this is the default address for the type. Example: true

address_line_1   string  optional  

optional First line of the address. Example: 123 Main Street

address_line_2   string  optional  

optional Second line of the address. Example: Suite 100

state   string  optional  

optional State or county name. Example: Greater London

special_instructions   string  optional  

optional Special delivery instructions. Example: Ring doorbell twice

Delete a shipping address

requires authentication

Delete a shipping address from the user's address book. Default addresses cannot be deleted directly - you must first set another address as default. Users can only delete their own addresses.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipping address deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipping address deleted successfully."
}

Example response (400, Cannot delete default address):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete default shipping address. Please set another address as default first."
}

Example response (403, Access denied):


{
    "message": "You can only delete your own shipping addresses."
}

Example response (404, Shipping address not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ShippingAddress] 999"
}

Request failed with error:

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Set address as default

requires authentication

Set a shipping address as the default address for its type (shipping or billing). This automatically unsets the default flag from other addresses of the same type. Users can only modify their own addresses.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16/set-default" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16/set-default"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16/set-default';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Validate a shipping address

requires authentication

Validate a shipping address using external address validation services. This checks if the address exists, is deliverable, and provides standardized formatting. The validation result is stored with the address for future reference.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16/validate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16/validate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16/validate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/shipping-addresses/16/validate'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

{
    "message": "Address validated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "address": {
            "id": 1,
            "user_id": 45,
            "type": "shipping",
            "name": "John Smith",
            "company": "Acme Corp",
            "address_line_1": "123 Main Street",
            "address_line_2": "Suite 100",
            "city": "London",
            "state": "Greater London",
            "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
            "country": "GB",
            "phone": "+44 20 7123 4567",
            "is_default": true,
            "is_validated": true,
            "full_address": "123 Main Street, Suite 100, London, Greater London, SW1A 1AA, United Kingdom",
            "country_name": "United Kingdom",
            "validation_status": "validated",
            "validation_data": {
                "validated_at": "2025-01-15T12:30:00.000000Z",
                "validation_service": "postcode_anywhere",
                "confidence_score": 0.98
            },
            "updated_at": "2025-01-15T12:30:00.000000Z"
        },
        "validation": {
            "valid": true,
            "confidence_score": 0.98,
            "validation_service": "postcode_anywhere",
            "validated_at": "2025-01-15T12:30:00.000000Z",
            "standardized_address": {
                "address_line_1": "123 Main Street",
                "address_line_2": "Suite 100",
                "city": "London",
                "state": "Greater London",
                "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
                "country": "GB"
            },
            "deliverable": true,
            "residential": false,
            "suggestions": []
        }
    }
}

    "message": "You can only validate your own shipping addresses."
}

    "message": "Address validation failed.",

        "valid": false,
        "confidence_score": 0.2,

        "validated_at": "2025-01-15T12:30:00.000000Z",
        "errors": [
            "Postcode not found",
            "Street name does not match postcode area"
        ],
        "suggestions": [
            {
                "address_line_1": "123 Main Road",
                "city": "London",
                "postcode": "SW1A 1AA"
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (503, Validation service unavailable):


{
    "message": "Address validation service unavailable."
}

Dropship Order Management

Retrieve paginated list of dropship orders

requires authentication

Get a paginated list of all dropship orders in the system with comprehensive filtering options. This endpoint supports filtering by supplier, status, order ID, search terms, date ranges, and special conditions like overdue or retry-needed orders. Essential for dropshipping management.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders?supplier_id=5&status=pending&order_id=123&search=AB123456&date_from=2025-01-01&date_to=2025-01-31&overdue=1&needs_retry=1&page=1&per_page=25" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"status\": \"on_hold\",
    \"search\": \"b\",
    \"date_from\": \"2025-07-21T08:45:17\",
    \"date_to\": \"2051-08-14\",
    \"overdue\": true,
    \"needs_retry\": true,
    \"has_tracking\": false,
    \"min_total\": 39,
    \"max_total\": 84,
    \"carrier\": \"z\",
    \"page\": 27,
    \"per_page\": 15,
    \"sort_by\": \"id\",
    \"sort_direction\": \"desc\",
    \"include_items\": true,
    \"include_supplier\": true,
    \"include_order\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders"
);

const params = {
    "supplier_id": "5",
    "status": "pending",
    "order_id": "123",
    "search": "AB123456",
    "date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "date_to": "2025-01-31",
    "overdue": "1",
    "needs_retry": "1",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "25",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "status": "on_hold",
    "search": "b",
    "date_from": "2025-07-21T08:45:17",
    "date_to": "2051-08-14",
    "overdue": true,
    "needs_retry": true,
    "has_tracking": false,
    "min_total": 39,
    "max_total": 84,
    "carrier": "z",
    "page": 27,
    "per_page": 15,
    "sort_by": "id",
    "sort_direction": "desc",
    "include_items": true,
    "include_supplier": true,
    "include_order": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'supplier_id' => '5',
            'status' => 'pending',
            'order_id' => '123',
            'search' => 'AB123456',
            'date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'date_to' => '2025-01-31',
            'overdue' => '1',
            'needs_retry' => '1',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '25',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'status' => 'on_hold',
            'search' => 'b',
            'date_from' => '2025-07-21T08:45:17',
            'date_to' => '2051-08-14',
            'overdue' => true,
            'needs_retry' => true,
            'has_tracking' => false,
            'min_total' => 39,
            'max_total' => 84,
            'carrier' => 'z',
            'page' => 27,
            'per_page' => 15,
            'sort_by' => 'id',
            'sort_direction' => 'desc',
            'include_items' => true,
            'include_supplier' => true,
            'include_order' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders'
payload = {
    "status": "on_hold",
    "search": "b",
    "date_from": "2025-07-21T08:45:17",
    "date_to": "2051-08-14",
    "overdue": true,
    "needs_retry": true,
    "has_tracking": false,
    "min_total": 39,
    "max_total": 84,
    "carrier": "z",
    "page": 27,
    "per_page": 15,
    "sort_by": "id",
    "sort_direction": "desc",
    "include_items": true,
    "include_supplier": true,
    "include_order": true
}
params = {
  'supplier_id': '5',
  'status': 'pending',
  'order_id': '123',
  'search': 'AB123456',
  'date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'date_to': '2025-01-31',
  'overdue': '1',
  'needs_retry': '1',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '25',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Success with dropship orders):


{
    "message": "Dropship orders retrieved successfully.",
    "status": 200,
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "order_id": 123,
                "supplier_id": 5,
                "supplier_order_id": "SUP-2025-001",
                "status": "confirmed",
                "total_cost": 1599,
                "total_cost_formatted": "£15.99",
                "total_retail": 2999,
                "total_retail_formatted": "£29.99",
                "profit_margin": 1400,
                "profit_margin_formatted": "£14.00",
                "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
                "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-20T17:00:00.000000Z",
                "shipping_address": {
                    "name": "John Smith",
                    "address_line_1": "123 Main St",
                    "city": "London",
                    "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
                    "country": "GB"
                },
                "auto_retry_enabled": true,
                "retry_count": 0,
                "notes": "Handle with care",
                "order": {
                    "id": 123,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
                    "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z",
                    "user": {
                        "id": 45,
                        "name": "John Smith",
                        "email": "john@example.com"
                    }
                },
                "supplier": {
                    "id": 5,
                    "name": "Global Suppliers Ltd",
                    "status": "active",
                    "integration_type": "api"
                },
                "dropship_order_items": [
                    {
                        "id": 1,
                        "quantity": 2,
                        "supplier_price": 799,
                        "supplier_price_formatted": "£7.99",
                        "retail_price": 1499,
                        "retail_price_formatted": "£14.99",
                        "profit_per_item": 700,
                        "profit_per_item_formatted": "£7.00",
                        "supplier_product": {
                            "id": 10,
                            "name": "Wireless Mouse",
                            "supplier_sku": "WM-001"
                        }
                    }
                ],
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:20:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 47,
        "last_page": 4
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The supplier id must be an integer.",
        "The date from must be a valid date."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/dropship-orders

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

supplier_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific supplier ID. Example: 5

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by dropship status (pending, confirmed, shipped, delivered, etc.). Example: pending

order_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific order ID. Example: 123

search   string  optional  

optional Search in supplier order ID, tracking number, or customer details. Example: AB123456

date_from   string  optional  

optional Filter orders created from this date (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-01

date_to   string  optional  

optional Filter orders created until this date (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-31

overdue   boolean  optional  

optional Show only overdue orders (past estimated delivery). Example: true

needs_retry   boolean  optional  

optional Show only orders that need retry. Example: true

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of orders per page (max 100). Default: 15. Example: 25

Body Parameters

supplier_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the suppliers table.

status   string  optional  

Example: on_hold

Must be one of:
  • pending
  • sent_to_supplier
  • confirmed_by_supplier
  • processing
  • shipped_by_supplier
  • delivered
  • cancelled
  • rejected_by_supplier
  • refunded
  • on_hold
  • Out for Delivery
order_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the orders table.

search   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: b

date_from   string  optional  

Must be a valid date. Example: 2025-07-21T08:45:17

date_to   string  optional  

Must be a valid date. Must be a date after or equal to date_from. Example: 2051-08-14

overdue   boolean  optional  

Example: true

needs_retry   boolean  optional  

Example: true

has_tracking   boolean  optional  

Example: false

min_total   number  optional  

Must be at least 0. Example: 39

max_total   number  optional  

Must be at least 0. Example: 84

carrier   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: z

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 27

per_page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100. Example: 15

sort_by   string  optional  

Example: id

Must be one of:
  • id
  • created_at
  • updated_at
  • total_cost
  • total_retail
  • profit_margin
  • estimated_delivery
sort_direction   string  optional  

Example: desc

Must be one of:
  • asc
  • desc
include_items   boolean  optional  

Example: true

include_supplier   boolean  optional  

Example: true

include_order   boolean  optional  

Example: true

Create a new dropship order

requires authentication

Create a new dropship order for an existing order with specified supplier and items. The system validates that the supplier is active and calculates profit margins automatically. This endpoint creates both the dropship order and associated order items.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"order_id\": 123,
    \"supplier_id\": 5,
    \"total_cost\": \"15.99\",
    \"total_retail\": \"29.99\",
    \"shipping_address\": {
        \"name\": \"John Smith\",
        \"line1\": \"n\",
        \"line2\": \"g\",
        \"city\": \"London\",
        \"county\": \"m\",
        \"postcode\": \"SW1A 1AA\",
        \"country\": \"GB\",
        \"phone\": \"w\",
        \"address_line_1\": \"123 Main St\"
    },
    \"notes\": \"Handle with care\",
    \"auto_retry_enabled\": true,
    \"items\": [
        \"architecto\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "order_id": 123,
    "supplier_id": 5,
    "total_cost": "15.99",
    "total_retail": "29.99",
    "shipping_address": {
        "name": "John Smith",
        "line1": "n",
        "line2": "g",
        "city": "London",
        "county": "m",
        "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
        "country": "GB",
        "phone": "w",
        "address_line_1": "123 Main St"
    },
    "notes": "Handle with care",
    "auto_retry_enabled": true,
    "items": [
        "architecto"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'order_id' => 123,
            'supplier_id' => 5,
            'total_cost' => '15.99',
            'total_retail' => '29.99',
            'shipping_address' => [
                'name' => 'John Smith',
                'line1' => 'n',
                'line2' => 'g',
                'city' => 'London',
                'county' => 'm',
                'postcode' => 'SW1A 1AA',
                'country' => 'GB',
                'phone' => 'w',
                'address_line_1' => '123 Main St',
            ],
            'notes' => 'Handle with care',
            'auto_retry_enabled' => true,
            'items' => [
                'architecto',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders'
payload = {
    "order_id": 123,
    "supplier_id": 5,
    "total_cost": "15.99",
    "total_retail": "29.99",
    "shipping_address": {
        "name": "John Smith",
        "line1": "n",
        "line2": "g",
        "city": "London",
        "county": "m",
        "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
        "country": "GB",
        "phone": "w",
        "address_line_1": "123 Main St"
    },
    "notes": "Handle with care",
    "auto_retry_enabled": true,
    "items": [
        "architecto"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Dropship order created successfully):


{
    "message": "Dropship order created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "order_id": 123,
        "supplier_id": 5,
        "supplier_order_id": null,
        "status": "pending",
        "total_cost": 1599,
        "total_cost_formatted": "£15.99",
        "total_retail": 2999,
        "total_retail_formatted": "£29.99",
        "profit_margin": 1400,
        "profit_margin_formatted": "£14.00",
        "tracking_number": null,
        "estimated_delivery": null,
        "shipping_address": {
            "name": "John Smith",
            "address_line_1": "123 Main St",
            "city": "London",
            "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
            "country": "GB"
        },
        "auto_retry_enabled": true,
        "retry_count": 0,
        "notes": "Handle with care",
        "order": {
            "id": 123,
            "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
            "user": {
                "id": 45,
                "name": "John Smith",
                "email": "john@example.com"
            }
        },
        "supplier": {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "Global Suppliers Ltd",
            "status": "active"
        },
        "dropship_order_items": [
            {
                "id": 25,
                "quantity": 2,
                "supplier_price": 799,
                "retail_price": 1499,
                "profit_per_item": 700,
                "status": "pending"
            }
        ],
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (400, Supplier not active):


{
    "message": "Failed to create dropship order: Supplier is not active."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The order id field is required.",
        "The supplier id field is required.",
        "The items field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/dropship-orders

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

order_id   integer   

The ID of the order to create dropship order for. Example: 123

supplier_id   integer   

The ID of the supplier to fulfill this order. Example: 5

total_cost   numeric   

The total cost to pay the supplier in pounds. Example: 15.99

total_retail   numeric   

The total retail price charged to customer in pounds. Example: 29.99

shipping_address   object   

The shipping address for delivery.
name   string   

Customer name. Example: John Smith

line1   string   

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: n

line2   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: g

city   string   

City name. Example: London

county   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: m

postcode   string   

Postal code. Example: SW1A 1AA

country   string   

Country code. Example: GB

phone   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 50 characters. Example: w

address_line_1   string   

First line of address. Example: 123 Main St

notes   string  optional  

optional Special instructions or notes. Example: Handle with care

auto_retry_enabled   boolean  optional  

optional Enable automatic retry on failure. Default: true. Example: true

items   string[]   

Array of items to be dropshipped.
order_item_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the order_items table. Example: architecto

supplier_product_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the supplier_products table. Example: architecto

supplier_sku   string   

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: n

quantity   integer   

Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 1000. Example: 7

supplier_price   integer   

Must be at least 1. Example: 66

retail_price   integer   

Must be at least 1. Example: 27

product_details   object  optional  
*   object  optional  
order_item_id   integer   

The order item ID. Example: 1

supplier_product_id   integer   

The supplier product ID. Example: 10

supplier_sku   string   

The supplier SKU. Example: WM-001

quantity   integer   

Quantity to order. Example: 2

supplier_price   numeric   

Price per unit from supplier in pounds. Example: 7.99

retail_price   numeric   

Retail price per unit in pounds. Example: 14.99

product_details   object  optional  

optional Additional product details.

Get dropship order statistics

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive statistics about dropship orders including totals, status breakdowns, supplier performance, and recent activity. Essential for dashboards and reporting.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/stats" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/stats"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/stats';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/stats'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "message": "Dropship order stats retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {

            "all_orders": 156,
            "pending": 12,
            "active": 45,
            "completed": 89,
            "overdue": 3
        },
        "by_status": {
            "pending": 12,
            "confirmed": 25,
            "shipped": 20,
            "delivered": 89,
            "cancelled": 5,
            "rejected": 5
        },
        "by_supplier": [
            {
                "supplier_name": "Global Suppliers Ltd",
                "count": 45
            },
            {
                "supplier_name": "Fast Ship Co",
                "count": 38
            }
        ],
        "recent_activity": [
            {
                "id": 48,
                "order_id": 123,
                "supplier_name": "Global Suppliers Ltd",
                "customer_name": "John Smith",
                "status": "shipped",
                "total_cost": "£15.99",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ]
    }
}

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."

Retrieve a specific dropship order

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific dropship order including order details, supplier information, and all associated order items. This endpoint loads comprehensive relationship data for complete order visibility.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Request      

GET api/admin/dropship-orders/{dropshipOrder_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

dropshipOrder_id   integer   

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to retrieve. Example: 48

Update an existing dropship order

requires authentication

Update a dropship order's details including status, tracking information, and notes. The system validates status transitions and logs all changes for audit purposes. Status changes trigger appropriate notifications and order updates.

Example request:
curl --request PUT \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"supplier_order_id\": \"SUP-2025-001\",
    \"status\": \"confirmed\",
    \"total_cost\": 22,
    \"total_retail\": 67,
    \"profit_margin\": 16,
    \"shipping_address\": {
        \"name\": \"b\",
        \"line1\": \"n\",
        \"line2\": \"g\",
        \"city\": \"z\",
        \"county\": \"m\",
        \"postcode\": \"iyvdljnikhwaykcm\",
        \"country\": \"yu\",
        \"phone\": \"w\"
    },
    \"tracking_number\": \"AB123456789GB\",
    \"carrier\": \"w\",
    \"estimated_delivery\": \"2025-01-20 17:00:00\",
    \"notes\": \"Updated delivery instructions\",
    \"supplier_notes\": \"g\",
    \"auto_retry_enabled\": false
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "supplier_order_id": "SUP-2025-001",
    "status": "confirmed",
    "total_cost": 22,
    "total_retail": 67,
    "profit_margin": 16,
    "shipping_address": {
        "name": "b",
        "line1": "n",
        "line2": "g",
        "city": "z",
        "county": "m",
        "postcode": "iyvdljnikhwaykcm",
        "country": "yu",
        "phone": "w"
    },
    "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
    "carrier": "w",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-20 17:00:00",
    "notes": "Updated delivery instructions",
    "supplier_notes": "g",
    "auto_retry_enabled": false
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PUT",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16';
$response = $client->put(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'supplier_order_id' => 'SUP-2025-001',
            'status' => 'confirmed',
            'total_cost' => 22,
            'total_retail' => 67,
            'profit_margin' => 16,
            'shipping_address' => [
                'name' => 'b',
                'line1' => 'n',
                'line2' => 'g',
                'city' => 'z',
                'county' => 'm',
                'postcode' => 'iyvdljnikhwaykcm',
                'country' => 'yu',
                'phone' => 'w',
            ],
            'tracking_number' => 'AB123456789GB',
            'carrier' => 'w',
            'estimated_delivery' => '2025-01-20 17:00:00',
            'notes' => 'Updated delivery instructions',
            'supplier_notes' => 'g',
            'auto_retry_enabled' => false,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16'
payload = {
    "supplier_order_id": "SUP-2025-001",
    "status": "confirmed",
    "total_cost": 22,
    "total_retail": 67,
    "profit_margin": 16,
    "shipping_address": {
        "name": "b",
        "line1": "n",
        "line2": "g",
        "city": "z",
        "county": "m",
        "postcode": "iyvdljnikhwaykcm",
        "country": "yu",
        "phone": "w"
    },
    "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
    "carrier": "w",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-20 17:00:00",
    "notes": "Updated delivery instructions",
    "supplier_notes": "g",
    "auto_retry_enabled": false
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('PUT', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Dropship order updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Dropship order updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "order_id": 123,
        "supplier_id": 5,
        "supplier_order_id": "SUP-2025-001",
        "status": "confirmed",
        "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-20T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "notes": "Updated delivery instructions",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Dropship order not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\DropshipOrder] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The status must be a valid dropship status.",
        "The estimated delivery must be a valid date."
    ]
}
