Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

PUT api/admin/dropship-orders/{dropshipOrder_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

dropshipOrder_id   integer   

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to update. Example: 48

Body Parameters

supplier_order_id   string  optional  

optional The supplier's order reference. Example: SUP-2025-001

status   string  optional  

optional The new status for the order. Example: confirmed

total_cost   integer   

Must be at least 1. Example: 22

total_retail   integer   

Must be at least 1. Example: 67

profit_margin   integer  optional  

Example: 16

shipping_address   object   
name   string  optional  

This field is required when shipping_address is present. Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: b

line1   string  optional  

This field is required when shipping_address is present. Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: n

line2   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: g

city   string  optional  

This field is required when shipping_address is present. Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: z

county   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: m

postcode   string  optional  

This field is required when shipping_address is present. Must not be greater than 20 characters. Example: iyvdljnikhwaykcm

country   string  optional  

This field is required when shipping_address is present. Must be 2 characters. Example: yu

phone   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 50 characters. Example: w

tracking_number   string  optional  

optional The tracking number from supplier. Example: AB123456789GB

carrier   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: w

estimated_delivery   string  optional  

optional Estimated delivery date (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS). Example: 2025-01-20 17:00:00

supplier_response   object  optional  
notes   string  optional  

optional Updated notes or instructions. Example: Updated delivery instructions

supplier_notes   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 2000 characters. Example: g

auto_retry_enabled   boolean  optional  

Example: false

webhook_data   object  optional  

Delete a dropship order

requires authentication

Delete a dropship order if it's in a valid state (pending or cancelled only). This removes the order and all associated order items. Orders that have been sent to suppliers cannot be deleted for audit purposes.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Dropship order deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Dropship order deleted successfully."
}

Example response (400, Cannot delete order):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete dropship order that has been sent to supplier."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Dropship order not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\DropshipOrder] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

dropshipOrder_id   integer   

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to delete. Example: 48

Send dropship order to supplier

requires authentication

Send a pending dropship order to the supplier for fulfillment. This endpoint validates that the order is in pending status and the supplier is active before sending. The order status is updated and integration data is recorded.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/send-to-supplier" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/send-to-supplier"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/send-to-supplier';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/send-to-supplier'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order sent to supplier successfully):


{
    "message": "Dropship order sent to supplier successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "status": "sent_to_supplier",
        "sent_to_supplier_at": "2025-01-16T16:00:00.000000Z",
        "integration_type": "api",
        "supplier": {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "Global Suppliers Ltd"
        }
    }
}

Example response (400, Order already sent):


{
    "message": "Dropship order has already been sent to supplier."
}

Example response (400, Supplier not active):


{
    "message": "Supplier is not active."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to send. Example: 48

Mark dropship order as confirmed

requires authentication

Mark a dropship order as confirmed by the supplier with their order ID and response data. This endpoint updates the order status and records supplier confirmation details.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-confirmed" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"supplier_order_id\": \"SUP-2025-001\",
    \"estimated_delivery\": \"2025-01-25\",
    \"supplier_response\": []
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-confirmed"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "supplier_order_id": "SUP-2025-001",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-25",
    "supplier_response": []
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-confirmed';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'supplier_order_id' => 'SUP-2025-001',
            'estimated_delivery' => '2025-01-25',
            'supplier_response' => [],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-confirmed'
payload = {
    "supplier_order_id": "SUP-2025-001",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-25",
    "supplier_response": []
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order marked as confirmed):


{
    "message": "Dropship order marked as confirmed.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "status": "confirmed",
        "supplier_order_id": "SUP-2025-001",
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-25T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "confirmed_at": "2025-01-16T16:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The supplier order id field is required.",
        "The estimated delivery must be after today."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/dropship-orders/{dropshipOrder_id}/mark-confirmed

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

dropshipOrder_id   integer   

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to mark as confirmed. Example: 48

Body Parameters

supplier_order_id   string   

The supplier's order reference ID. Example: SUP-2025-001

estimated_delivery   string  optional  

optional Estimated delivery date (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-25

supplier_response   object  optional  

optional Additional response data from supplier.

Mark dropship order as shipped

requires authentication

Mark a dropship order as shipped with tracking information from the supplier. This updates the order status and provides tracking details for customer visibility.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-shipped" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"tracking_number\": \"AB123456789GB\",
    \"carrier\": \"Royal Mail\",
    \"estimated_delivery\": \"2025-01-25\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-shipped"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
    "carrier": "Royal Mail",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-25"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-shipped';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'tracking_number' => 'AB123456789GB',
            'carrier' => 'Royal Mail',
            'estimated_delivery' => '2025-01-25',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-shipped'
payload = {
    "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
    "carrier": "Royal Mail",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-25"
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

Example response (200, Order marked as shipped):


{
    "message": "Dropship order marked as shipped.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "status": "shipped",
        "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
        "carrier": "Royal Mail",
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-25T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "shipped_at": "2025-01-18T10:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The tracking number field is required.",
        "The tracking number must be at least 8 characters."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to mark as shipped. Example: 48

optional The carrier name. Example: Royal Mail

estimated_delivery   string  optional  

optional Estimated delivery date (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-25

requires authentication

    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/mark-delivered" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \

    --header "Accept: application/json"

Cancel a dropship order

requires authentication

Cancel a dropship order with an optional reason. This marks the order as cancelled and can trigger refund processes if applicable. Cannot cancel delivered orders.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/cancel" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"reason\": \"Customer requested cancellation\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/cancel"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "reason": "Customer requested cancellation"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/cancel';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'reason' => 'Customer requested cancellation',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/cancel'
payload = {
    "reason": "Customer requested cancellation"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order cancelled successfully):


{
    "message": "Dropship order cancelled successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "status": "cancelled",
        "cancelled_at": "2025-01-17T09:15:00.000000Z",
        "cancellation_reason": "Customer requested cancellation"
    }
}

Example response (400, Cannot cancel delivered order):


{
    "message": "Cannot cancel delivered dropship order."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

POST api/admin/dropship-orders/{dropshipOrder_id}/cancel

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

The ID of the dropship order to cancel. Example: 48

optional Reason for cancellation. Example: Customer requested cancellation

Retry a failed dropship order

requires authentication

Retry a failed dropship order by resetting its status to pending and incrementing the retry count. This is used when orders fail due to temporary issues.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/retry" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/retry"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/retry';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/16/retry'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Order retry initiated):


{
    "message": "Dropship order retry initiated.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "status": "pending",
        "retry_count": 1,
        "last_retry_at": "2025-01-17T10:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (400, Cannot retry order):


{
    "message": "Dropship order cannot be retried."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

POST api/admin/dropship-orders/{dropshipOrder_id}/retry

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

dropshipOrder_id   integer   

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 16

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to retry. Example: 48

Bulk update status of multiple dropship orders

requires authentication

Update the status of multiple dropship orders simultaneously. This is useful for batch processing of orders that need status changes.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/bulk-update-status" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"dropship_order_ids\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    \"status\": \"confirmed\",
    \"notes\": \"Bulk status update\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/bulk-update-status"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "dropship_order_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "status": "confirmed",
    "notes": "Bulk status update"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/bulk-update-status';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'dropship_order_ids' => [
                1,
                2,
                3,
            ],
            'status' => 'confirmed',
            'notes' => 'Bulk status update',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/dropship-orders/bulk-update-status'
payload = {
    "dropship_order_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "status": "confirmed",
    "notes": "Bulk status update"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Orders updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Successfully updated status for 3 dropship orders.",
    "data": {
        "updated_count": 3,
        "new_status": "confirmed"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The dropship order ids field is required.",
        "The status field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/dropship-orders/bulk-update-status

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

dropship_order_ids   string[]   

Array of dropship order IDs to update.
*   integer   

Each order ID must be valid. Example: 1

status   string   

The new status to apply to all orders. Example: confirmed

notes   string  optional  

optional Optional notes for the status change. Example: Bulk status update

Inventory Management

Get inventory overview

requires authentication

Returns low stock and out of stock items for admin dashboard. Provides a complete overview of inventory status for immediate action.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Inventory overview retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Inventory overview retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "low_stock_items": [
            {
                "type": "product",
                "id": 15,
                "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                "current_stock": 8,
                "threshold": 10,
                "vendor": "AudioTech Solutions"
            },
            {
                "type": "variant",
                "id": 24,
                "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones - Color: White",
                "current_stock": 3,
                "threshold": 5,
                "vendor": "AudioTech Solutions"
            }
        ],
        "out_of_stock_items": [
            {
                "type": "product",
                "id": 22,
                "name": "USB-C Cable",
                "vendor": "TechCorp"
            }
        ],
        "summary": {
            "low_stock_count": 2,
            "out_of_stock_count": 1,
            "total_issues": 3
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/inventory/overview

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Update product stock threshold

requires authentication

Updates the low stock threshold for a specific product. When the product's quantity falls to or below this threshold, alerts will be triggered.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"low_stock_threshold\": 15
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 15
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'low_stock_threshold' => 15,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold'
payload = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 15
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product threshold updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Product stock threshold updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 15,
        "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
        "current_stock": 25,
        "old_threshold": 10,
        "new_threshold": 15
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Product] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The low stock threshold field is required.",
        "The low stock threshold must be at least 0."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/inventory/products/{product_id}/threshold

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product. Example: 1

product   integer   

The ID of the product to update. Example: 15

Body Parameters

low_stock_threshold   integer   

The new threshold value (minimum 0). Example: 15

Update variant stock threshold

requires authentication

Updates the low stock threshold for a specific product variant. When the variant's quantity falls to or below this threshold, alerts will be triggered.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/variants/1/threshold" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"low_stock_threshold\": 8
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/variants/1/threshold"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 8
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/variants/1/threshold';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'low_stock_threshold' => 8,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/variants/1/threshold'
payload = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 8
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Variant threshold updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Variant stock threshold updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 24,
        "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones - Color: White",
        "current_stock": 20,
        "old_threshold": 5,
        "new_threshold": 8
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Variant not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductVariant] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The low stock threshold field is required.",
        "The low stock threshold must be at least 0."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/inventory/variants/{variant_id}/threshold

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

variant_id   integer   

The ID of the variant. Example: 1

variant   integer   

The ID of the product variant to update. Example: 24

Body Parameters

low_stock_threshold   integer   

The new threshold value (minimum 0). Example: 8

Trigger manual inventory check

requires authentication

Manually triggers an inventory check and sends alerts if any items are below their thresholds. Useful for testing or immediate inventory review.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/check" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/check"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/check';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/check'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Manual check completed with alerts):


{
    "message": "Inventory check completed. Alerts sent for 3 items.",
    "data": {
        "alerts_sent": true,
        "low_stock_count": 3,
        "items_checked": 156
    }
}

Example response (200, Manual check completed - no alerts needed):


{
    "message": "Inventory check completed. No alerts needed.",
    "data": {
        "alerts_sent": false,
        "low_stock_count": 0,
        "items_checked": 156
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/inventory/check

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Bulk update stock thresholds

requires authentication

Updates stock thresholds for multiple products and variants in a single request. Useful for bulk inventory management operations.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/bulk-update-thresholds" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"products\": [
        \"architecto\"
    ],
    \"variants\": [
        \"architecto\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/bulk-update-thresholds"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "products": [
        "architecto"
    ],
    "variants": [
        "architecto"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/bulk-update-thresholds';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'products' => [
                'architecto',
            ],
            'variants' => [
                'architecto',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/bulk-update-thresholds'
payload = {
    "products": [
        "architecto"
    ],
    "variants": [
        "architecto"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Bulk update completed successfully):


{
    "message": "Bulk threshold update completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "updated_products": 3,
        "updated_variants": 5,
        "total_updated": 8,
        "new_alerts_triggered": 2
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The products.0.id field is required.",
        "The variants.1.low_stock_threshold must be at least 0."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/inventory/bulk-update-thresholds

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

products   string[]  optional  

optional Array of product threshold updates.
id   string   

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: architecto

low_stock_threshold   integer   

Must be at least 0. Example: 39

*   object  optional  
id   integer   

Product ID. Example: 15

low_stock_threshold   integer   

New threshold value. Example: 20

variants   string[]  optional  

optional Array of variant threshold updates.
id   string   

The id of an existing record in the product_variants table. Example: architecto

low_stock_threshold   integer   

Must be at least 0. Example: 39

*   object  optional  
id   integer   

Variant ID. Example: 24

low_stock_threshold   integer   

New threshold value. Example: 10

Order Returns

Create a return request for an order item

requires authentication

Allows authenticated users to request a return for items from their paid orders. Users can only return items from orders they own and that have been successfully paid. Each order item can only have one return request to prevent duplicate submissions. This is the first step in the return process - the request will need admin approval before processing.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/returns" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"order_item_id\": 89,
    \"reason\": \"The wireless headphones arrived with a defective left speaker that produces crackling sounds at any volume level. The product does not match the quality described.\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/returns"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "order_item_id": 89,
    "reason": "The wireless headphones arrived with a defective left speaker that produces crackling sounds at any volume level. The product does not match the quality described."
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/returns';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'order_item_id' => 89,
            'reason' => 'The wireless headphones arrived with a defective left speaker that produces crackling sounds at any volume level. The product does not match the quality described.',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/returns'
payload = {
    "order_item_id": 89,
    "reason": "The wireless headphones arrived with a defective left speaker that produces crackling sounds at any volume level. The product does not match the quality described."
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Return request created successfully):


{
    "message": "Orders return created.",
    "data": {
        "id": 15,
        "reason": "The wireless headphones arrived with a defective left speaker that produces crackling sounds at any volume level. The product does not match the quality described.",
        "status": "Requested",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (400, Item not eligible for return):


{
    "message": "This item is not eligible for return due to its category or condition."
}

Example response (401, User not authenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (403, Unauthorized - not user's order item):


{
    "message": "You are not authorized to return this item."
}

Example response (404, Order item not found):


{
    "message": "Order item not found."
}

Example response (409, Return already exists for this item):


{
    "message": "A return request has already been created for this item."
}

Example response (422, Order not paid):


{
    "message": "Order has not been paid for."
}

Example response (422, Order too old for returns):


{
    "message": "Return window has expired for this order."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The order item id field is required.",
        "The reason field is required.",
        "The reason must be at least 10 characters.",
        "The reason may not be greater than 1000 characters.",
        "The selected order item id is invalid."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/returns

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

order_item_id   integer   

The ID of the specific order item to return. Must belong to a paid order owned by the authenticated user. Example: 89

reason   string   

Detailed reason for the return request. Must be between 10 and 1000 characters to provide sufficient context for review. Example: The wireless headphones arrived with a defective left speaker that produces crackling sounds at any volume level. The product does not match the quality described.

Payment Management

Retrieve paginated list of payments

requires authentication

Get a comprehensive list of all payments in the system with pagination support. This endpoint provides administrators with detailed payment information including transaction details, payment methods, amounts, statuses, and associated order information. Essential for financial reporting, payment reconciliation, and transaction monitoring.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payments?page=2&per_page=25&status=Paid&method=stripe&user_id=123&order_id=456&date_from=2025-01-01&date_to=2025-01-31&amount_min=10.00&amount_max=500.00" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payments"
);

const params = {
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "25",
    "status": "Paid",
    "method": "stripe",
    "user_id": "123",
    "order_id": "456",
    "date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "date_to": "2025-01-31",
    "amount_min": "10.00",
    "amount_max": "500.00",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payments';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'status' => 'Paid',
            'method' => 'stripe',
            'user_id' => '123',
            'order_id' => '456',
            'date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'date_to' => '2025-01-31',
            'amount_min' => '10.00',
            'amount_max' => '500.00',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payments'
params = {
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '25',
  'status': 'Paid',
  'method': 'stripe',
  'user_id': '123',
  'order_id': '456',
  'date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'date_to': '2025-01-31',
  'amount_min': '10.00',
  'amount_max': '500.00',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Payments retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Payments retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 267,
                "gateway": "stripe",
                "amount": 8498,
                "amount_formatted": "£84.98",
                "method": "stripe",
                "status": "Paid",
                "transaction_reference": "pi_1Hxxxxxxxxxxxx",
                "processed_at": "2025-01-15T14:22:00",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:21:00",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:22:00",
                "user": {
                    "id": 123,
                    "name": "Sarah Johnson",
                    "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
                    "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z"
                },
                "order": {
                    "id": 45,
                    "total_amount": 8498,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£84.98",
                    "status": {
                        "id": 3,
                        "name": "Confirmed"
                    },
                    "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
                    "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:22:00.000000Z"
                },
                "payment_method": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "stripe"
                }
            },
            {
                "id": 265,
                "gateway": "stripe",
                "amount": 2999,
                "amount_formatted": "£29.99",
                "method": "stripe",
                "status": "Partially Refunded",
                "transaction_reference": "pi_1Gxxxxxxxxxx",
                "processed_at": "2025-01-10T16:32:00",
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T16:31:00",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-14T11:25:00",
                "user": {
                    "id": 89,
                    "name": "Michael Chen",
                    "email": "michael.chen@example.com",
                    "email_verified_at": "2025-01-08T12:00:00.000000Z"
                },
                "order": {
                    "id": 38,
                    "total_amount": 2999,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
                    "status": {
                        "id": 9,
                        "name": "Partially Refunded"
                    },
                    "created_at": "2025-01-10T16:30:00.000000Z",
                    "updated_at": "2025-01-14T11:25:00.000000Z"
                },
                "payment_method": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "stripe"
                }
            },
            {
                "id": 263,
                "gateway": "stripe",
                "amount": 15500,
                "amount_formatted": "£155.00",
                "method": "stripe",
                "status": "Failed",
                "transaction_reference": "pi_1Fxxxxxxxxxx",
                "processed_at": "2025-01-08T09:15:00",
                "created_at": "2025-01-08T09:14:00",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-08T09:15:00",
                "user": {
                    "id": 67,
                    "name": "Emma Wilson",
                    "email": "emma.wilson@example.com",
                    "email_verified_at": "2025-01-05T14:00:00.000000Z"
                },
                "order": {
                    "id": 34,
                    "total_amount": 15500,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£155.00",
                    "status": {
                        "id": 10,
                        "name": "Failed"
                    },
                    "created_at": "2025-01-08T09:12:00.000000Z",
                    "updated_at": "2025-01-08T09:15:00.000000Z"
                },
                "payment_method": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "stripe"
                }
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 1247,
        "last_page": 84,
        "from": 1,
        "to": 15,
        "path": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/payments",
        "first_page_url": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/payments?page=1",
        "last_page_url": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/payments?page=84",
        "next_page_url": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/payments?page=2",
        "prev_page_url": null
    }
}

Example response (200, Filtered payments with specific status):


{
    "message": "Payments retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 268,
                "gateway": "stripe",
                "amount": 5999,
                "amount_formatted": "£59.99",
                "method": "stripe",
                "status": "Pending",
                "transaction_reference": "pi_1Jxxxxxxxxxx",
                "processed_at": "2025-01-16T10:30:00",
                "created_at": "2025-01-16T10:29:00",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-16T10:30:00",
                "user": {
                    "id": 156,
                    "name": "David Rodriguez",
                    "email": "david.rodriguez@example.com"
                },
                "order": {
                    "id": 47,
                    "total_amount": 5999,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£59.99",
                    "status": {
                        "id": 1,
                        "name": "Pending Payment"
                    }
                },
                "payment_method": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "stripe"
                }
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 23,
        "last_page": 2,
        "from": 1,
        "to": 15
    }
}

Example response (200, No payments found):


{
    "message": "Payments retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The status field must be one of: Paid, Pending, Failed, Canceled, Refunded, Partially Refunded.",
        "The date from field must be a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format.",
        "The amount min field must be a number greater than 0.",
        "The user id field must be an integer."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/payments

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of payments per page (max 100). Default: 15. Example: 25

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by payment status. Available: Paid, Pending, Failed, Canceled, Refunded, Partially Refunded. Example: Paid

method   string  optional  

optional Filter by payment method. Available: stripe, paypal, card, bank transfer, apple pay, google pay. Example: stripe

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter payments by specific user ID. Example: 123

order_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter payments by specific order ID. Example: 456

date_from   string  optional  

optional Filter payments from this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-01

date_to   string  optional  

optional Filter payments to this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-31

amount_min   string  optional  

numeric optional Filter payments with minimum amount in pounds. Example: 10.00

amount_max   string  optional  

numeric optional Filter payments with maximum amount in pounds. Example: 500.00

Payment Method Management

Retrieve all payment methods

requires authentication

Get a complete list of all available payment methods in the system. This endpoint provides administrators with information about supported payment gateways and methods that customers can use to complete their purchases. Essential for payment system configuration and troubleshooting payment-related issues.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Payment methods retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Payment Methods retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "stripe",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "paypal",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "apple pay",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:10:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:10:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "google pay",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:15:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "bank transfer",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:20:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:20:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 6,
            "name": "card",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:25:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:25:00.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (200, No payment methods configured):


{
    "message": "Payment Methods retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
