You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/payment-methods

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new payment method

requires authentication

Add a new payment method to the system. Payment methods must be from a predefined list of supported gateways and cannot be duplicated. This endpoint is essential for configuring which payment options are available to customers during checkout.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"google pay\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"google pay\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"google pay"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods'
payload = {
    "name": "\"google pay\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Payment method created successfully):


{
    "message": "Payment Method created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 7,
        "name": "google pay",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The selected name is invalid. Supported methods: card, paypal, bank transfer, apple pay, google pay, stripe.",
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate payment method):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/payment-methods

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the payment method. Must be one of the supported payment methods: card, paypal, bank transfer, apple pay, google pay, stripe. Example: "google pay"

Update an existing payment method

requires authentication

Modify an existing payment method in the system. The new name must be from the supported list and cannot conflict with other existing payment methods. Use this endpoint to correct payment method names or replace deprecated methods with updated versions.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"apple pay\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"apple pay\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"apple pay"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1'
payload = {
    "name": "\"apple pay\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Payment method updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Payment Method updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 3,
        "name": "apple pay",
        "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:10:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Payment method not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\PaymentMethod] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The selected name is invalid. Supported methods: card, paypal, bank transfer, apple pay, google pay, stripe.",
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Name already exists):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/payment-methods/{paymentMethod_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

paymentMethod_id   integer   

The ID of the paymentMethod. Example: 1

paymentMethod   integer   

The ID of the payment method to update. Example: 3

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the payment method. Must be one of the supported payment methods: card, paypal, bank transfer, apple pay, google pay, stripe. Example: "apple pay"

Delete a payment method

requires authentication

Permanently remove a payment method from the system. This action is irreversible and will prevent customers from using this payment method for future transactions. Exercise caution as this may affect existing payment configurations and customer checkout options.

Warning: Deleting a payment method that is currently being used by active payment integrations may cause payment processing issues.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/payment-methods/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Payment method deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Payment Method deleted successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Payment method not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\PaymentMethod] 999"
}

Example response (409, Payment method in use):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete payment method that has associated payments or transactions."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the payment method."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/payment-methods/{paymentMethod_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

paymentMethod_id   integer   

The ID of the paymentMethod. Example: 1

paymentMethod   integer   

The ID of the payment method to delete. Example: 5

Payment Webhooks

Stripe webhook listener

This endpoint receives webhook events from Stripe when payment-related events occur. It automatically processes payment status updates, handles refunds, and manages order status changes. This endpoint is called directly by Stripe's servers and requires proper webhook signature verification.

Important: This endpoint should be excluded from CSRF protection and rate limiting.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/webhook" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"id\": \"evt_1234567890abcdef\",
    \"object\": \"event\",
    \"type\": \"payment_intent.succeeded\",
    \"data\": {
        \"object\": []
    },
    \"created\": 1640995200,
    \"livemode\": false
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/webhook"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "id": "evt_1234567890abcdef",
    "object": "event",
    "type": "payment_intent.succeeded",
    "data": {
        "object": []
    },
    "created": 1640995200,
    "livemode": false
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/webhook';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'id' => 'evt_1234567890abcdef',
            'object' => 'event',
            'type' => 'payment_intent.succeeded',
            'data' => [
                'object' => [],
            ],
            'created' => 1640995200,
            'livemode' => false,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/webhook'
payload = {
    "id": "evt_1234567890abcdef",
    "object": "event",
    "type": "payment_intent.succeeded",
    "data": {
        "object": []
    },
    "created": 1640995200,
    "livemode": false
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Webhook processed successfully):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Webhook update.",
    "data": null
}

Example response (200, Payment success webhook):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment success webhook processed.",
    "data": null
}

Example response (200, Refund webhook processed):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "External refund processed.",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Invalid Stripe signature):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Invalid Stripe signature",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Invalid payload format):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Invalid payload",
    "data": null
}

Example response (500, Webhook processing error):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "An error occurred while processing the webhook.",
    "data": null
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/payments/stripe/webhook

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

id   string   

The unique identifier for the webhook event. Example: evt_1234567890abcdef

object   string   

Always "event" for webhook events. Example: event

type   string   

The type of event (e.g., payment_intent.succeeded, charge.refunded). Example: payment_intent.succeeded

data   object   

The event data containing the relevant object (payment_intent, charge, etc.).
object   object   

The main object for this event (PaymentIntent, Charge, Refund, etc.).

created   integer   

Unix timestamp when the event was created. Example: 1640995200

livemode   boolean   

Whether this event is from live mode (true) or test mode (false). Example: false

Permission Management

Retrieve all permissions

requires authentication

Get a complete list of all permissions available in the system. Permissions define what actions users can perform and are assigned to roles for access control. This endpoint is essential for role management, security auditing, and understanding system capabilities. Only super admins can manage permissions to maintain system security.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permissions retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "view_users",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "create_users",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "edit_users",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "delete_users",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "view_orders",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 6,
            "name": "create_orders",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 7,
            "name": "edit_orders",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 8,
            "name": "delete_orders",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 9,
            "name": "manage_refunds",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 10,
            "name": "manage_returns",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 11,
            "name": "view_products",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 12,
            "name": "create_products",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (200, No permissions configured):


{
    "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/permissions

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new permission

requires authentication

Add a new permission to the system. Permissions should follow a consistent naming convention (e.g., action_resource format like "view_users", "create_orders"). Once created, permissions can be assigned to roles to control user access. Permission names are automatically converted to lowercase and must be unique across the system.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"create-vendor\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"create-vendor\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"create-vendor"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions'
payload = {
    "name": "\"create-vendor\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permission created successfully):


{
    "message": "Permission created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 13,
        "name": "create-vendor",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate permission name):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/permissions

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the permission. Should follow naming convention (action_resource). Will be converted to lowercase. Example: "create-vendor"

Update an existing permission

requires authentication

Modify an existing permission name. Exercise caution when updating permissions as this may affect role-based access controls throughout the system. Ensure that any name changes are reflected in role assignments and access control logic. Permission names are automatically converted to lowercase and must remain unique.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"create-vendor\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"create-vendor\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"create-vendor"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1'
payload = {
    "name": "\"create-vendor\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permission updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Permission updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 13,
        "name": "create-vendor",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:15:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Permission not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Permission] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Name already exists):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/permissions/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the permission. Example: 1

permission   integer   

The ID of the permission to update. Example: 13

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the permission. Should follow naming convention (action_resource). Will be converted to lowercase. Example: "create-vendor"

Delete a permission

requires authentication

Permanently remove a permission from the system. This action is irreversible and will automatically remove the permission from all roles that currently have it assigned. Exercise extreme caution when deleting permissions as this may break access control throughout the application and potentially lock users out of system features.

Warning: Deleting core system permissions may cause application functionality to become inaccessible to all users, including administrators.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/permissions/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permission deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Permission deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Permission not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Permission] 999"
}

Example response (409, Permission in use):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete permission that is currently assigned to roles."
}

Example response (422, Core permission protection):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete core system permissions required for application functionality."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the permission."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/permissions/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the permission. Example: 1

permission   integer   

The ID of the permission to delete. Example: 13

Product Attribute Management

Retrieve all product attributes

requires authentication

Get a complete list of all product attributes in the system. Product attributes define the variable characteristics of products (like Color, Size, Material, etc.) and are used to create product variants. This endpoint is essential for product catalog management and understanding what customization options are available for products.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product attributes retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Attributes retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [

            "id": 1,

        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Size",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "Material",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:10:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:10:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "Storage",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:15:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "Weight",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:20:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:20:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 6,
            "name": "Style",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:25:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:25:00.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (200, No product attributes found):


{
    "message": "Attributes retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Request      

GET api/admin/product-attributes

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new product attribute

requires authentication

Add a new product attribute to the system. Product attributes represent customizable characteristics of products (such as Color, Size, Material). Once created, these attributes can be used to define product variants with specific values (e.g., Color: Red, Blue, Green). Attribute names should be descriptive and follow consistent naming conventions.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"Color\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"Color\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"Color"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

response.json()

Request      

POST api/admin/product-attributes

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the product attribute. Should be descriptive and unique. Will be used in product variant creation. Example: "Color"

Retrieve a specific product attribute

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific product attribute including its current usage in the system. This endpoint is useful for examining attribute details before making modifications or understanding how the attribute is currently being utilized across products.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Update a product attribute

requires authentication

Modify an existing product attribute name. Exercise caution when updating attributes as they may be referenced by existing product variants. Changing attribute names will affect how they appear in product listings and variant descriptions. Ensure consistency with existing naming conventions and verify the impact on related products.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"Size\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"Size\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"Size"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Request      

POST api/admin/product-attributes/{productAttribute_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productAttribute_id   integer   

The ID of the productAttribute. Example: 1

productAttribute   integer   

The ID of the product attribute to update. Example: 7

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the product attribute. Must be unique and descriptive. Example: "Size"

Delete a product attribute

requires authentication

Permanently remove a product attribute from the system. This action is irreversible and will affect all product variants that currently use this attribute. Before deletion, ensure that no active products depend on this attribute, as removing it may cause data inconsistencies or break product variant functionality.

Warning: Deleting an attribute that is currently used by product variants may cause those variants to become invalid or lose important characteristic information.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-attributes/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product attribute deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Product attribute deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product attribute not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductAttribute] 999"
}

Example response (409, Attribute in use by variants):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete product attribute that is currently used by product variants."
}

Example response (422, Attribute has dependencies):


{
    "message": "This attribute is currently being used by active products and cannot be deleted."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the product attribute."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/product-attributes/{productAttribute_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productAttribute_id   integer   

The ID of the productAttribute. Example: 1

productAttribute   integer   

The ID of the product attribute to delete. Example: 7

Product Catalog

Search and browse products with advanced features

Get a paginated and filtered list of active products with advanced search capabilities. This endpoint supports intelligent search with relevance scoring, faceted filtering, result diversification, and personalized recommendations. Includes comprehensive product information optimized for customer browsing and purchasing decisions.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/products?filter[]=architecto&filter%5Bsearch%5D=wireless+bluetooth+headphones+under+%C2%A350&filter%5Bname%5D=wireless&filter%5Bprice%5D=10.00%2C50.00&filter%5BpriceRanges%5D=0-25%2C50-100&filter%5Bcategory%5D=5%2C12%2C18&filter%5Bavailability%5D=in_stock&filter%5Bvendors%5D=2%2C5%2C8&filter%5Bvendor%5D=apple&filter%5Btags%5D=3%2C7%2C12&filter%5Battributes%5D=color%3Ared%2Csize%3Alarge&filter%5Bcreated_at%5D=2025-01-01%2C2025-01-31&filter%5Binclude%5D=vendor%2Cvariants%2Ccategory&page=2&per_page=24&sort=-relevance%2Cprice&diversify=1" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"filter\": {
        \"name\": \"b\",
        \"search\": \"n\",
        \"price\": \"9,3.1)\",
        \"priceRanges\": \"-1.42)-3268)\",
        \"category\": \"9,31\",
        \"categories\": \"9,31\",
        \"quantity\": \"64\",
        \"availability\": \"low_stock\",
        \"vendors\": \"9,31\",
        \"vendor\": \"i\",
        \"brand\": \"k\",
        \"brands\": \"9,31\",
        \"tags\": \"9,31\",
        \"tag_logic\": \"OR\",
        \"attributes\": \"_JK:AI\",
        \"color\": \"k\",
        \"colors\": \"dLJnIk\",
        \"size\": \"h\",
        \"sizes\": \"DDz1Ys\",
        \"material\": \"h\",
        \"status\": \"w\",
        \"created_at\": \"2559-31-42\",
        \"updated_at\": \"2559-31-42\",
        \"include\": \"uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv\"
    },
    \"page\": 4,
    \"per_page\": 9,
    \"sort\": \"y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH\",
    \"diversify\": true,
    \"explain\": true,
    \"facets\": true,
    \"highlight\": true,
    \"personalize\": true,
    \"typo_tolerance\": true,
    \"exact_match\": false,
    \"boost_new_products\": true,
    \"boost_in_stock\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/products"
);

const params = {
    "filter[0]": "architecto",
    "filter[search]": "wireless bluetooth headphones under ¬£50",
    "filter[name]": "wireless",
    "filter[price]": "10.00,50.00",
    "filter[priceRanges]": "0-25,50-100",
    "filter[category]": "5,12,18",
    "filter[availability]": "in_stock",
    "filter[vendors]": "2,5,8",
    "filter[vendor]": "apple",
    "filter[tags]": "3,7,12",
    "filter[attributes]": "color:red,size:large",
    "filter[created_at]": "2025-01-01,2025-01-31",
    "filter[include]": "vendor,variants,category",
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "24",
    "sort": "-relevance,price",
    "diversify": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "filter": {
        "name": "b",
        "search": "n",
        "price": "9,3.1)",
        "priceRanges": "-1.42)-3268)",
        "category": "9,31",
        "categories": "9,31",
        "quantity": "64",
        "availability": "low_stock",
        "vendors": "9,31",
        "vendor": "i",
        "brand": "k",
        "brands": "9,31",
        "tags": "9,31",
        "tag_logic": "OR",
        "attributes": "_JK:AI",
        "color": "k",
        "colors": "dLJnIk",
        "size": "h",
        "sizes": "DDz1Ys",
        "material": "h",
        "status": "w",
        "created_at": "2559-31-42",
        "updated_at": "2559-31-42",
        "include": "uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv"
    },
    "page": 4,
    "per_page": 9,
    "sort": "y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH",
    "diversify": true,
    "explain": true,
    "facets": true,
    "highlight": true,
    "personalize": true,
    "typo_tolerance": true,
    "exact_match": false,
    "boost_new_products": true,
    "boost_in_stock": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'filter[0]' => 'architecto',
            'filter[search]' => 'wireless bluetooth headphones under ¬£50',
            'filter[name]' => 'wireless',
            'filter[price]' => '10.00,50.00',
            'filter[priceRanges]' => '0-25,50-100',
            'filter[category]' => '5,12,18',
            'filter[availability]' => 'in_stock',
            'filter[vendors]' => '2,5,8',
            'filter[vendor]' => 'apple',
            'filter[tags]' => '3,7,12',
            'filter[attributes]' => 'color:red,size:large',
            'filter[created_at]' => '2025-01-01,2025-01-31',
            'filter[include]' => 'vendor,variants,category',
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '24',
            'sort' => '-relevance,price',
            'diversify' => '1',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'filter' => [
                'name' => 'b',
                'search' => 'n',
                'price' => '9,3.1)',
                'priceRanges' => '-1.42)-3268)',
                'category' => '9,31',
                'categories' => '9,31',
                'quantity' => '64',
                'availability' => 'low_stock',
                'vendors' => '9,31',
                'vendor' => 'i',
                'brand' => 'k',
                'brands' => '9,31',
                'tags' => '9,31',
                'tag_logic' => 'OR',
                'attributes' => '_JK:AI',
                'color' => 'k',
                'colors' => 'dLJnIk',
                'size' => 'h',
                'sizes' => 'DDz1Ys',
                'material' => 'h',
                'status' => 'w',
                'created_at' => '2559-31-42',
                'updated_at' => '2559-31-42',
                'include' => 'uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv',
            ],
            'page' => 4,
            'per_page' => 9,
            'sort' => 'y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH',
            'diversify' => true,
            'explain' => true,
            'facets' => true,
            'highlight' => true,
            'personalize' => true,
            'typo_tolerance' => true,
            'exact_match' => false,
            'boost_new_products' => true,
            'boost_in_stock' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products'
payload = {
    "filter": {
        "name": "b",
        "search": "n",
        "price": "9,3.1)",
        "priceRanges": "-1.42)-3268)",
        "category": "9,31",
        "categories": "9,31",
        "quantity": "64",
        "availability": "low_stock",
        "vendors": "9,31",
        "vendor": "i",
        "brand": "k",
        "brands": "9,31",
        "tags": "9,31",
        "tag_logic": "OR",
        "attributes": "_JK:AI",
        "color": "k",
        "colors": "dLJnIk",
        "size": "h",
        "sizes": "DDz1Ys",
        "material": "h",
        "status": "w",
        "created_at": "2559-31-42",
        "updated_at": "2559-31-42",
        "include": "uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv"
    },
    "page": 4,
    "per_page": 9,
    "sort": "y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH",
    "diversify": true,
    "explain": true,
    "facets": true,
    "highlight": true,
    "personalize": true,
    "typo_tolerance": true,
    "exact_match": false,
    "boost_new_products": true,
    "boost_in_stock": true
}
params = {
  'filter[0]': 'architecto',
  'filter[search]': 'wireless bluetooth headphones under ¬£50',
  'filter[name]': 'wireless',
  'filter[price]': '10.00,50.00',
  'filter[priceRanges]': '0-25,50-100',
  'filter[category]': '5,12,18',
  'filter[availability]': 'in_stock',
  'filter[vendors]': '2,5,8',
  'filter[vendor]': 'apple',
  'filter[tags]': '3,7,12',
  'filter[attributes]': 'color:red,size:large',
  'filter[created_at]': '2025-01-01,2025-01-31',
  'filter[include]': 'vendor,variants,category',
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '24',
  'sort': '-relevance,price',
  'diversify': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (401):

Show headers 
cache-control: no-cache, private
content-type: application/json
x-content-type-options: nosniff
x-frame-options: DENY
x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block
content-security-policy: default-src 'none'; frame-ancestors 'none';
referrer-policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
permissions-policy: camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=(), payment=()
 

{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/products

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

filter   string[]  optional  

optional Array of filter parameters to narrow down results.

filter[search]   string  optional  

optional Intelligent search with typo tolerance and relevance scoring. Example: wireless bluetooth headphones under ¬£50

filter[name]   string  optional  

optional Filter products by name (partial match supported). Example: wireless

filter[price]   string  optional  

optional Filter by price range in pounds. Single value or comma-separated min,max. Example: 10.00,50.00

filter[priceRanges]   string  optional  

optional Multiple price ranges. Example: 0-25,50-100

filter[category]   string  optional  

optional Filter by category ID(s) including child categories. Example: 5,12,18

filter[availability]   string  optional  

optional Filter by stock status. Options: in_stock, available. Example: in_stock

filter[vendors]   string  optional  

optional Filter by brand/vendor ID(s). Example: 2,5,8

filter[vendor]   string  optional  

optional Filter by brand name. Example: apple

filter[tags]   string  optional  

optional Filter by tag ID(s). Example: 3,7,12

filter[attributes]   string  optional  

optional Filter by product attributes. Format: attribute:value. Example: color:red,size:large

filter[created_at]   string  optional  

optional Filter by creation date range. Example: 2025-01-01,2025-01-31

filter[include]   string  optional  

optional Include related data. Options: vendor,variants,category,tags,media. Example: vendor,variants,category

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of products per page (max 100). Default: 15. Example: 24

sort   string  optional  

optional Sort products. Available: name, price, created_at, relevance. Example: -relevance,price

diversify   boolean  optional  

optional Apply result diversification for better variety. Default: false. Example: true

Body Parameters

filter   object  optional  
name   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: b

search   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 500 characters. Example: n

price   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^\d+(.\d{1,2})?(,\d+(.\d{1,2})?)*$/. Example: 9,3.1)

priceRanges   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\d+(.\d{1,2})?-\d+(.\d{1,2})?)(,\d+(.\d{1,2})?-\d+(.\d{1,2})?)*$/. Example: -1.42)-3268)

category   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\d,?)+$/. Example: 9,31

categories   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\d,?)+$/. Example: 9,31

quantity   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^\d+(,\d+)?$/. Example: 64

availability   string  optional  

Example: low_stock

Must be one of:
  • in_stock
  • out_of_stock
  • low_stock
  • available
vendors   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\d,?)+$/. Example: 9,31

vendor   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: i

brand   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: k

brands   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\d,?)+$/. Example: 9,31

tags   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\d,?)+$/. Example: 9,31

tag_logic   string  optional  

Example: OR

Must be one of:
  • AND
  • OR
attributes   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^([a-zA-Z]+:[a-zA-Z0-9-\s]+)(,[a-zA-Z]+:[a-zA-Z0-9-\s]+)*$/. Example: _JK:AI

color   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 50 characters. Example: k

colors   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^([a-zA-Z]+,?)+$/. Example: dLJnIk

size   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 50 characters. Example: h

sizes   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^([a-zA-Z0-9]+,?)+$/. Example: DDz1Ys

material   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 100 characters. Example: h

status   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 50 characters. Example: w

created_at   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}(,\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})?$/. Example: 2559-31-42

updated_at   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}(,\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})?$/. Example: 2559-31-42

include   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(\w+(,\w+)*)?$/. Example: uw,pw,lvq,wrsitc,pscqld,zsnrwt,ujwv

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 4

per_page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100. Example: 9

sort   string  optional  

Must match the regex /^(-?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)(,-?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$/. Example: y8p,Bm,-dp,-Zm,-GH

diversify   boolean  optional  

Example: true

explain   boolean  optional  

Example: true

facets   boolean  optional  

Example: true

highlight   boolean  optional  

Example: true

personalize   boolean  optional  

Example: true

typo_tolerance   boolean  optional  

Example: true

exact_match   boolean  optional  

Example: false

boost_new_products   boolean  optional  

Example: true

boost_in_stock   boolean  optional  

Example: true

Retrieve detailed product information

Get comprehensive information about a specific product including all variants, media, category details, vendor information, and customer-relevant data. This endpoint provides complete product data needed for product detail pages, including high-resolution images, pricing for all variants, inventory levels, and related product suggestions.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/products/1" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/products/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products/1'
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (401):

x-frame-options: DENY
x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block
content-security-policy: default-src 'none'; frame-ancestors 'none';
referrer-policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
permissions-policy: camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=(), payment=()

    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/products/{id}

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the product. Example: 1

product   integer   

The ID of the product to retrieve. Example: 15

Product Category Management

Get all product categories

requires authentication

Retrieve a complete hierarchical list of all product categories in the system. Categories help organize products for better navigation and filtering. This endpoint returns both parent categories and their child subcategories, enabling administrators to understand the complete category structure and manage product organization effectively.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

                    "parent_id": 7,
                    "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:40:00.000000Z",
                    "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:40:00.000000Z",
                    "children": []
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}

Example response (200, No categories found):


{
    "message": "Categories retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/product-categories

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Store a new product category

requires authentication

Create a new product category in the system. Categories can be created as top-level categories (with no parent) or as subcategories under existing categories. This hierarchical structure helps organize products for better navigation and filtering. Category names must be unique across the entire system to avoid confusion.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"Laptops\\\"\",
    \"parent_id\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"Laptops\"",
    "parent_id": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"Laptops"',
            'parent_id' => 1,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories'
payload = {
    "name": "\"Laptops\"",
    "parent_id": 1
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Category created successfully):


{
    "message": "Category created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 10,
        "name": "Laptops",
        "parent_id": 1,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Top-level category created):


{
    "message": "Category created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 11,
        "name": "Home & Garden",
        "parent_id": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:35:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:35:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The parent id must exist in product_categories table.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate category name):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Invalid parent category):


{
    "errors": [
        "The selected parent id is invalid."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-categories

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the category. Must be unique across all categories. Example: "Laptops"

parent_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the parent category. Omit for top-level categories. Example: 1

Get a specific product category

requires authentication

Retrieve detailed information about a specific product category including its subcategories. This endpoint is useful for examining category hierarchies and understanding the structure of product organization within a particular category branch.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

{
    "message": "Category retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Electronics",
        "parent_id": null,

        "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:00:00.000000Z",
        "children": [
            {
                "id": 2,
                "name": "Smartphones",
                "parent_id": 1,
                "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:05:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:05:00.000000Z",
                "children": []
            },
            {
                "id": 3,
                "name": "Laptops",
                "parent_id": 1,
                "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:10:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:10:00.000000Z",
                "children": []
            }
        ]
    }
}

{
    "message": "Category retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Smartphones",
        "parent_id": 1,
        "created_at": "2024-12-01T10:05:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-12-01T10:05:00.000000Z",
        "children": []
    }
}
