Request      

GET api/admin/product-categories/{productCategory_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productCategory_id   integer   

The ID of the productCategory. Example: 1

productCategory   integer   

The ID of the product category to retrieve. Example: 1

Update a product category

requires authentication

Modify an existing product category's name or parent relationship. When changing the parent, ensure that circular references are not created (a category cannot be its own ancestor). The system prevents self-referencing to maintain a valid hierarchical structure.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"Updated Category Name\\\"\",
    \"parent_id\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"Updated Category Name\"",
    "parent_id": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"Updated Category Name"',
            'parent_id' => 2,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1'
payload = {
    "name": "\"Updated Category Name\"",
    "parent_id": 2
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Category updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Category updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 10,
        "name": "Updated Category Name",
        "parent_id": 2,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Category made top-level):


{
    "message": "Category updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 10,
        "name": "Independent Category",
        "parent_id": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:50:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Category not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductCategory] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The parent id must exist in product_categories table.",
        "The parent id field cannot reference the current category (self-reference not allowed)."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Self-reference attempt):


{
    "errors": [
        "A category cannot be its own parent."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Circular reference prevention):


{
    "errors": [
        "Cannot set parent category as it would create a circular reference in the hierarchy."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-categories/{productCategory_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productCategory_id   integer   

The ID of the productCategory. Example: 1

productCategory   integer   

The ID of the product category to update. Example: 10

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the category. Must be unique across all categories. Example: "Updated Category Name"

parent_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the parent category. Cannot be the same as the category being updated. Example: 2

Delete a product category

requires authentication

Permanently remove a product category from the system. Categories can only be deleted if they have no subcategories (children). If a category contains subcategories, those must be deleted first or moved to another parent category. This prevents orphaned categories and maintains the integrity of the hierarchical structure.

Warning: Deleting a category may affect products that are currently assigned to it. Ensure products are reassigned to appropriate categories before deletion.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Category deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Category deleted successfully"
}

Example response (400, Category has subcategories):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete a category with subcategories"
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Category not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductCategory] 999"
}

Example response (409, Category has associated products):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete category that has products assigned to it. Please reassign products to other categories first."
}

Example response (422, Category has dependencies):


{
    "message": "This category cannot be deleted as it has associated products or subcategories."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the category."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/product-categories/{productCategory_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productCategory_id   integer   

The ID of the productCategory. Example: 1

productCategory   integer   

The ID of the product category to delete. Example: 10

Product Reviews

Get reviews for a specific product with filtering and sorting

Retrieve all approved reviews for a product with advanced filtering capabilities. Supports filtering by rating, verified purchases, media presence, and various sorting options. Essential for product detail pages and review browsing functionality.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews?rating[]=4&rating[]=5&verified_only=1&with_media=1&sort_by=helpful&per_page=20&page=2" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": 16,
    \"rating\": [
        2
    ],
    \"verified_only\": true,
    \"with_media\": true,
    \"sort_by\": \"helpful\",
    \"per_page\": 1,
    \"page\": 66
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews"
);

const params = {
    "rating[0]": "4",
    "rating[1]": "5",
    "verified_only": "1",
    "with_media": "1",
    "sort_by": "helpful",
    "per_page": "20",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": true,
    "with_media": true,
    "sort_by": "helpful",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'rating[0]' => '4',
            'rating[1]' => '5',
            'verified_only' => '1',
            'with_media' => '1',
            'sort_by' => 'helpful',
            'per_page' => '20',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 16,
            'rating' => [
                2,
            ],
            'verified_only' => true,
            'with_media' => true,
            'sort_by' => 'helpful',
            'per_page' => 1,
            'page' => 66,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews'
payload = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": true,
    "with_media": true,
    "sort_by": "helpful",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
}
params = {
  'rating[0]': '4',
  'rating[1]': '5',
  'verified_only': '1',
  'with_media': '1',
  'sort_by': 'helpful',
  'per_page': '20',
  'page': '2',
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Reviews retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Product reviews retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 123,
                "user": {
                    "id": 45,
                    "name": "Sarah Johnson",
                    "email": "s***@example.com"
                },
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds",
                    "price_formatted": "£89.99"
                },
                "rating": 5,
                "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
                "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations. The noise cancellation is fantastic and battery life is exactly as advertised.",
                "is_verified_purchase": true,
                "is_featured": false,
                "helpful_votes": 12,
                "total_votes": 15,
                "helpfulness_ratio": 80,
                "user_voted": null,
                "media": [
                    {
                        "id": 67,
                        "media_type": "image",
                        "url": "https://yourapi.com/storage/reviews/review-image-1.jpg",
                        "thumbnail_url": "https://yourapi.com/storage/reviews/thumb_review-image-1.jpg"
                    }
                ],
                "response": null,
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z",
                "can_edit": false,
                "can_delete": false
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 127,
        "last_page": 9
    },
    "meta": {
        "product_id": 15,
        "total_reviews": 127,
        "average_rating": 4.3,
        "rating_breakdown": {
            "1": 2,
            "2": 8,
            "3": 15,
            "4": 45,
            "5": 57
        },
        "verified_purchase_count": 89,
        "with_media_count": 34
    }
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Product] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/products/{product_id}/reviews

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product. Example: 1

product   integer   

The ID of the product to get reviews for. Example: 15

Query Parameters

rating   string[]  optional  

optional Filter by specific ratings (1-5). Can be multiple values.

verified_only   boolean  optional  

optional Show only verified purchase reviews. Default: false. Example: true

with_media   boolean  optional  

optional Show only reviews with photos/videos. Default: false. Example: true

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort reviews. Options: newest, oldest, rating_high, rating_low, helpful. Default: newest. Example: helpful

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of reviews per page (1-50). Default: 15. Example: 20

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Body Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: 16

rating   integer[]  optional  

Must be between 1 and 5.

verified_only   boolean  optional  

Example: true

with_media   boolean  optional  

Example: true

sort_by   string  optional  

Example: helpful

Must be one of:
  • newest
  • oldest
  • rating_high
  • rating_low
  • helpful
per_page   integer  optional  

Must be between 1 and 50. Example: 1

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 66

Get detailed information about a specific review

Retrieve comprehensive details about a single review including user information, media attachments, helpfulness votes, and vendor responses if available.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16'
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Review retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "user": {
            "id": 45,
            "name": "Sarah Johnson",
            "email": "s***@example.com"
        },
        "product": {
            "id": 15,
            "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds",
            "price_formatted": "£89.99",
            "featured_image": "https://yourapi.com/storage/products/featured-image.jpg"
        },
        "rating": 5,
        "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
        "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations...",
        "is_verified_purchase": true,
        "is_featured": false,
        "helpful_votes": 12,
        "total_votes": 15,
        "helpfulness_ratio": 80,
        "user_voted": null,
        "media": [],
        "response": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "can_edit": false,
        "can_delete": false
    }
}

Example response (404, Review not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/reviews/{id}

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to retrieve. Example: 123

Create a new product review

requires authentication

Submit a new review for a product. Users can only review products they have purchased and can only submit one review per product. Supports uploading media files (images/videos) with the review for enhanced credibility.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "product_id=15"\
    --form "order_item_id=234"\
    --form "rating=5"\
    --form "title="Excellent sound quality!""\
    --form "content="These earbuds exceeded my expectations...""\
    --form "media[]=@/tmp/phpwnEen1" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('product_id', '15');
body.append('order_item_id', '234');
body.append('rating', '5');
body.append('title', '"Excellent sound quality!"');
body.append('content', '"These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."');
body.append('media[]', document.querySelector('input[name="media[]"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'multipart/form-data',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'multipart' => [
            [
                'name' => 'product_id',
                'contents' => '15'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'order_item_id',
                'contents' => '234'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'rating',
                'contents' => '5'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'title',
                'contents' => '"Excellent sound quality!"'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'content',
                'contents' => '"These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'media[]',
                'contents' => fopen('/tmp/phpwnEen1', 'r')
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews'
files = {
  'product_id': (None, '15'),
  'order_item_id': (None, '234'),
  'rating': (None, '5'),
  'title': (None, '"Excellent sound quality!"'),
  'content': (None, '"These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."'),
  'media[]': open('/tmp/phpwnEen1', 'rb')}
payload = {
    "product_id": 15,
    "order_item_id": 234,
    "rating": 5,
    "title": "\"Excellent sound quality!\"",
    "content": "\"These earbuds exceeded my expectations...\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, files=files)
response.json()

Example response (201, Review created successfully):


{
    "message": "Review submitted successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "user": {
            "id": 45,
            "name": "Sarah Johnson"
        },
        "product": {
            "id": 15,
            "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds"
        },
        "rating": 5,
        "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
        "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations...",
        "is_verified_purchase": true,
        "is_featured": false,
        "helpful_votes": 0,
        "total_votes": 0,
        "media": [],
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot review product):


{
    "message": "You can only review products you have purchased."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "You have already reviewed this product.",
        "Rating must be between 1 and 5 stars.",
        "Review content must be at least 10 characters long."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product being reviewed. Example: 15

order_item_id   integer  optional  

optional The order item ID for verified purchase reviews. Example: 234

rating   integer   

Rating from 1-5 stars. Example: 5

title   string  optional  

optional Short review title (3-255 characters). Example: "Excellent sound quality!"

content   string   

Detailed review content (10-2000 characters). Example: "These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."

media   file[]  optional  

optional Upload images or videos with review (max 5 files, 10MB each).
*   object  optional  
file   file  optional  

Photo or video file (jpg, jpeg, png, gif, mp4, mov, avi). Example: /tmp/phpL8g6Gt

Update an existing review

requires authentication

Update your own review within the allowed time window (30 days after creation). You can modify the rating, title, content, and add/remove media attachments.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "rating=4"\
    --form "title="Good sound quality""\
    --form "content="Updated thoughts on these earbuds...""\
    --form "remove_media[]=67"\
    --form "media[]=@/tmp/php2JbZuh" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('rating', '4');
body.append('title', '"Good sound quality"');
body.append('content', '"Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."');
body.append('remove_media[]', '67');
body.append('media[]', document.querySelector('input[name="media[]"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'multipart/form-data',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'multipart' => [
            [
                'name' => 'rating',
                'contents' => '4'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'title',
                'contents' => '"Good sound quality"'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'content',
                'contents' => '"Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'remove_media[]',
                'contents' => '67'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'media[]',
                'contents' => fopen('/tmp/php2JbZuh', 'r')
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16'
files = {
  'rating': (None, '4'),
  'title': (None, '"Good sound quality"'),
  'content': (None, '"Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."'),
  'remove_media[]': (None, '67'),
  'media[]': open('/tmp/php2JbZuh', 'rb')}
payload = {
    "rating": 4,
    "title": "\"Good sound quality\"",
    "content": "\"Updated thoughts on these earbuds...\"",
    "remove_media": [
        67,
        68
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, files=files)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Review updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "rating": 4,
        "title": "Good sound quality",
        "content": "Updated thoughts on these earbuds...",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T10:20:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot edit review):


{
    "message": "You can only edit your own reviews within 30 days of creation."
}

Example response (404, Review not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to update. Example: 123

Body Parameters

rating   integer  optional  

optional Updated rating from 1-5 stars. Example: 4

title   string  optional  

optional Updated review title (3-255 characters). Example: "Good sound quality"

content   string  optional  

optional Updated review content (10-2000 characters). Example: "Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."

media   file[]  optional  

optional New media files to add (max 5 total files).

remove_media   integer[]  optional  

optional Array of media IDs to remove.

Delete a review

requires authentication

Delete your own review. This action is irreversible and will also remove all associated media files and helpfulness votes.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Review deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Cannot delete review):


{
    "message": "You can only delete your own reviews."
}

{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}

Vote on review helpfulness

requires authentication

Mark a review as helpful or not helpful. Users cannot vote on their own reviews and can only vote once per review (but can change their vote).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"is_helpful\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "is_helpful": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'is_helpful' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness'
payload = {
    "is_helpful": true
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Vote recorded successfully):


{
    "message": "Thank you for your feedback!",
    "data": {
        "review_id": 123,
        "helpful_votes": 13,
        "total_votes": 16,
        "helpfulness_ratio": 81.3,
        "user_vote": true
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot vote on own review):


{
    "message": "You cannot vote on your own review."
}

Example response (409, Already voted):


{
    "message": "You have already voted on this review with the same rating."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{review_id}/helpfulness

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to vote on. Example: 123

Body Parameters

is_helpful   boolean   

Whether the review was helpful. Example: true

Report an inappropriate review

requires authentication

Report a review for inappropriate content, spam, or other violations. Reported reviews are flagged for admin moderation review.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"reason\": \"spam\",
    \"details\": \"\\\"This review contains promotional links\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "reason": "spam",
    "details": "\"This review contains promotional links\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'reason' => 'spam',
            'details' => '"This review contains promotional links"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report'
payload = {
    "reason": "spam",
    "details": "\"This review contains promotional links\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review reported successfully):


{
    "message": "Review reported successfully. Our moderation team will review it shortly.",
    "data": {
        "report_id": 45,
        "review_id": 123,
        "reason": "spam",
        "status": "pending"
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot report own review):


{
    "message": "You cannot report your own review."
}

Example response (409, Already reported):


{
    "message": "You have already reported this review."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{review_id}/report

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to report. Example: 123

Body Parameters

reason   string   

Reason for reporting. Options: spam, inappropriate_language, fake_review, off_topic, personal_information, other. Example: spam

details   string  optional  

optional Additional details (required if reason is "other"). Example: "This review contains promotional links"

Product Supplier Mappings

Retrieve product supplier mappings

requires authentication

Get a paginated list of all product supplier mappings with comprehensive filtering options. This endpoint supports filtering by product, supplier, status, mapping type, health status, and search queries. Essential for dropshipping management and monitoring.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings?product_id=123&supplier_id=456&is_primary=1&is_active=1&markup_type=percentage&auto_update_price=1&auto_update_stock=1&health_status=healthy&search=iPhone&page=1&per_page=25" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"is_primary\": true,
    \"is_active\": true,
    \"markup_type\": \"percentage\",
    \"search\": \"b\",
    \"auto_update_price\": false,
    \"auto_update_stock\": false,
    \"auto_update_description\": false,
    \"health_status\": \"healthy\",
    \"min_markup\": 39,
    \"max_markup\": 84,
    \"last_price_update_from\": \"2025-07-21T08:45:17\",
    \"last_price_update_to\": \"2051-08-14\",
    \"last_stock_update_from\": \"2025-07-21T08:45:17\",
    \"last_stock_update_to\": \"2051-08-14\",
    \"priority_order\": 22,
    \"page\": 67,
    \"per_page\": 16,
    \"sort_by\": \"priority_order\",
    \"sort_direction\": \"asc\",
    \"include_product\": false,
    \"include_supplier\": true,
    \"include_supplier_product\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings"
);

const params = {
    "product_id": "123",
    "supplier_id": "456",
    "is_primary": "1",
    "is_active": "1",
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "auto_update_price": "1",
    "auto_update_stock": "1",
    "health_status": "healthy",
    "search": "iPhone",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "25",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "is_primary": true,
    "is_active": true,
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "search": "b",
    "auto_update_price": false,
    "auto_update_stock": false,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "health_status": "healthy",
    "min_markup": 39,
    "max_markup": 84,
    "last_price_update_from": "2025-07-21T08:45:17",
    "last_price_update_to": "2051-08-14",
    "last_stock_update_from": "2025-07-21T08:45:17",
    "last_stock_update_to": "2051-08-14",
    "priority_order": 22,
    "page": 67,
    "per_page": 16,
    "sort_by": "priority_order",
    "sort_direction": "asc",
    "include_product": false,
    "include_supplier": true,
    "include_supplier_product": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'product_id' => '123',
            'supplier_id' => '456',
            'is_primary' => '1',
            'is_active' => '1',
            'markup_type' => 'percentage',
            'auto_update_price' => '1',
            'auto_update_stock' => '1',
            'health_status' => 'healthy',
            'search' => 'iPhone',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '25',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'is_primary' => true,
            'is_active' => true,
            'markup_type' => 'percentage',
            'search' => 'b',
            'auto_update_price' => false,
            'auto_update_stock' => false,
            'auto_update_description' => false,
            'health_status' => 'healthy',
            'min_markup' => 39,
            'max_markup' => 84,
            'last_price_update_from' => '2025-07-21T08:45:17',
            'last_price_update_to' => '2051-08-14',
            'last_stock_update_from' => '2025-07-21T08:45:17',
            'last_stock_update_to' => '2051-08-14',
            'priority_order' => 22,
            'page' => 67,
            'per_page' => 16,
            'sort_by' => 'priority_order',
            'sort_direction' => 'asc',
            'include_product' => false,
            'include_supplier' => true,
            'include_supplier_product' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings'
payload = {
    "is_primary": true,
    "is_active": true,
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "search": "b",
    "auto_update_price": false,
    "auto_update_stock": false,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "health_status": "healthy",
    "min_markup": 39,
    "max_markup": 84,
    "last_price_update_from": "2025-07-21T08:45:17",
    "last_price_update_to": "2051-08-14",
    "last_stock_update_from": "2025-07-21T08:45:17",
    "last_stock_update_to": "2051-08-14",
    "priority_order": 22,
    "page": 67,
    "per_page": 16,
    "sort_by": "priority_order",
    "sort_direction": "asc",
    "include_product": false,
    "include_supplier": true,
    "include_supplier_product": true
}
params = {
  'product_id': '123',
  'supplier_id': '456',
  'is_primary': '1',
  'is_active': '1',
  'markup_type': 'percentage',
  'auto_update_price': '1',
  'auto_update_stock': '1',
  'health_status': 'healthy',
  'search': 'iPhone',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '25',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Success with mappings):

    "message": "Product supplier mappings retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [

}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/product-supplier-mappings

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by product ID. Example: 123

supplier_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by supplier ID. Example: 456

is_primary   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by primary mapping status. Example: true

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by active status. Example: true

markup_type   string  optional  

optional Filter by markup type (percentage, fixed). Example: percentage

auto_update_price   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by auto price update setting. Example: true

auto_update_stock   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by auto stock update setting. Example: true

health_status   string  optional  

optional Filter by health status (healthy, inactive, supplier_inactive, sync_issues). Example: healthy

search   string  optional  

optional Search in product or supplier names. Example: iPhone

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of mappings per page (max 100). Default: 15. Example: 25

Body Parameters

product_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the products table.

supplier_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the suppliers table.

is_primary   boolean  optional  

Example: true

is_active   boolean  optional  

Example: true

markup_type   string  optional  

Example: percentage

Must be one of:
  • percentage
  • fixed
search   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: b

auto_update_price   boolean  optional  

Example: false

auto_update_stock   boolean  optional  

Example: false

auto_update_description   boolean  optional  

Example: false

health_status   string  optional  

Example: healthy

Must be one of:
  • healthy
  • inactive
  • supplier_inactive
min_markup   number  optional  

Must be at least 0. Example: 39

max_markup   number  optional  

Must be at least 0. Example: 84

last_price_update_from   string  optional  

Must be a valid date. Example: 2025-07-21T08:45:17

last_price_update_to   string  optional  

Must be a valid date. Must be a date after or equal to last_price_update_from. Example: 2051-08-14

last_stock_update_from   string  optional  

Must be a valid date. Example: 2025-07-21T08:45:17

last_stock_update_to   string  optional  

Must be a valid date. Must be a date after or equal to last_stock_update_from. Example: 2051-08-14

priority_order   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 999. Example: 22

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 67

per_page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100. Example: 16

sort_by   string  optional  

Example: priority_order

Must be one of:
  • priority_order
  • markup_percentage
  • fixed_markup
  • last_price_update
  • last_stock_update
  • created_at
sort_direction   string  optional  

Example: asc

Must be one of:
  • asc
  • desc
include_product   boolean  optional  

Example: false

include_supplier   boolean  optional  

Example: true

include_supplier_product   boolean  optional  

Example: true

Create a new product supplier mapping

requires authentication

Create a new mapping between a product and supplier with pricing, markup, and automation settings. The system validates that the mapping doesn't already exist and handles primary mapping conflicts. Optionally sends notification emails to administrators.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": 123,
    \"supplier_id\": 456,
    \"supplier_product_id\": 789,
    \"is_primary\": true,
    \"is_active\": true,
    \"priority_order\": 1,
    \"markup_percentage\": \"25.50\",
    \"fixed_markup\": \"2000\",
    \"markup_type\": \"percentage\",
    \"minimum_stock_threshold\": 5,
    \"auto_update_price\": true,
    \"auto_update_stock\": true,
    \"auto_update_description\": false,
    \"field_mappings\": {
        \"name\": \"i\",
        \"description\": \"Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.\",
        \"price\": \"k\",
        \"stock\": \"h\",
        \"sku\": \"w\",
        \"weight\": \"a\",
        \"images\": \"y\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": 123,
    "supplier_id": 456,
    "supplier_product_id": 789,
    "is_primary": true,
    "is_active": true,
    "priority_order": 1,
    "markup_percentage": "25.50",
    "fixed_markup": "2000",
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "minimum_stock_threshold": 5,
    "auto_update_price": true,
    "auto_update_stock": true,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "field_mappings": {
        "name": "i",
        "description": "Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.",
        "price": "k",
        "stock": "h",
        "sku": "w",
        "weight": "a",
        "images": "y"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 123,
            'supplier_id' => 456,
            'supplier_product_id' => 789,
            'is_primary' => true,
            'is_active' => true,
            'priority_order' => 1,
            'markup_percentage' => '25.50',
            'fixed_markup' => '2000',
            'markup_type' => 'percentage',
            'minimum_stock_threshold' => 5,
            'auto_update_price' => true,
            'auto_update_stock' => true,
            'auto_update_description' => false,
            'field_mappings' => [
                'name' => 'i',
                'description' => 'Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.',
                'price' => 'k',
                'stock' => 'h',
                'sku' => 'w',
                'weight' => 'a',
                'images' => 'y',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings'
payload = {
    "product_id": 123,
    "supplier_id": 456,
    "supplier_product_id": 789,
    "is_primary": true,
    "is_active": true,
    "priority_order": 1,
    "markup_percentage": "25.50",
    "fixed_markup": "2000",
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "minimum_stock_threshold": 5,
    "auto_update_price": true,
    "auto_update_stock": true,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "field_mappings": {
        "name": "i",
        "description": "Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.",
        "price": "k",
        "stock": "h",
        "sku": "w",
        "weight": "a",
        "images": "y"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

    "data": {

        "is_active": true,
        "markup_type": "percentage",
        "markup_percentage": 25.5,
        "fixed_markup": null,
        "auto_update_price": true,
        "auto_update_stock": true,
        "auto_update_description": false,
        "minimum_stock_threshold": 5,
        "priority_order": 1,
        "product": {
            "id": 123,
            "name": "iPhone 15 Pro",
            "primary_supplier_id": 456
        },
        "supplier": {
            "id": 456,
            "name": "Tech Wholesale Ltd",
            "status": "active"
        },
        "supplier_product": {
            "id": 789,
            "supplier_sku": "TWL-IP15P-128-BLU",
            "supplier_price": 85000,
            "supplier_price_formatted": "£850.00"
        },
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z"
    }

Example response (400, Mapping already exists):


{
    "message": "A mapping between this product and supplier already exists."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The product id field is required.",
        "The supplier id field is required.",
        "The markup type field is required.",
        "The markup percentage field is required when markup type is percentage."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-supplier-mappings

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product to map. Example: 123

supplier_id   integer   

The ID of the supplier to map. Example: 456

supplier_product_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the supplier's product. Example: 789

is_primary   boolean  optional  

optional Whether this is the primary supplier for the product. Default: false. Example: true

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Whether the mapping is active. Default: true. Example: true

priority_order   integer  optional  

optional Priority order for multiple suppliers. Example: 1

markup_percentage   numeric  optional  

optional Markup percentage (required if markup_type is percentage). Example: 25.50

fixed_markup   numeric  optional  

optional Fixed markup amount in pence (required if markup_type is fixed). Example: 2000

markup_type   string   

The type of markup (percentage, fixed). Example: percentage

minimum_stock_threshold   integer  optional  

optional Minimum stock level before alerts. Example: 5

auto_update_price   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update product prices. Default: false. Example: true

auto_update_stock   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update stock levels. Default: false. Example: true

auto_update_description   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update descriptions. Default: false. Example: false

field_mappings   object  optional  
name   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: i

description   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.

price   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: k

stock   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: h

sku   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: w

weight   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: a

images   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: y

Retrieve a specific product supplier mapping

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific product supplier mapping including related product, supplier, and supplier product data. Shows calculated pricing, profit margins, and health status information.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Request      

GET api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/{productSupplierMapping_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to retrieve. Example: 48

Update an existing product supplier mapping

requires authentication

Update mapping details including pricing, markup settings, automation preferences, and status. The system validates status transitions and automatically updates product pricing when markup settings change and auto-pricing is enabled.

Example request:
curl --request PUT \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": \"architecto\",
    \"supplier_id\": \"architecto\",
    \"supplier_product_id\": 789,
    \"is_primary\": true,
    \"is_active\": true,
    \"priority_order\": 1,
    \"markup_percentage\": \"30.00\",
    \"fixed_markup\": \"2500\",
    \"markup_type\": \"percentage\",
    \"minimum_stock_threshold\": 10,
    \"auto_update_price\": true,
    \"auto_update_stock\": true,
    \"auto_update_description\": false,
    \"field_mappings\": {
        \"name\": \"i\",
        \"description\": \"Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.\",
        \"price\": \"k\",
        \"stock\": \"h\",
        \"sku\": \"w\",
        \"weight\": \"a\",
        \"images\": \"y\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": "architecto",
    "supplier_id": "architecto",
    "supplier_product_id": 789,
    "is_primary": true,
    "is_active": true,
    "priority_order": 1,
    "markup_percentage": "30.00",
    "fixed_markup": "2500",
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "minimum_stock_threshold": 10,
    "auto_update_price": true,
    "auto_update_stock": true,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "field_mappings": {
        "name": "i",
        "description": "Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.",
        "price": "k",
        "stock": "h",
        "sku": "w",
        "weight": "a",
        "images": "y"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PUT",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16';
$response = $client->put(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 'architecto',
            'supplier_id' => 'architecto',
            'supplier_product_id' => 789,
            'is_primary' => true,
            'is_active' => true,
            'priority_order' => 1,
            'markup_percentage' => '30.00',
            'fixed_markup' => '2500',
            'markup_type' => 'percentage',
            'minimum_stock_threshold' => 10,
            'auto_update_price' => true,
            'auto_update_stock' => true,
            'auto_update_description' => false,
            'field_mappings' => [
                'name' => 'i',
                'description' => 'Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.',
                'price' => 'k',
                'stock' => 'h',
                'sku' => 'w',
                'weight' => 'a',
                'images' => 'y',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16'
payload = {
    "product_id": "architecto",
    "supplier_id": "architecto",
    "supplier_product_id": 789,
    "is_primary": true,
    "is_active": true,
    "priority_order": 1,
    "markup_percentage": "30.00",
    "fixed_markup": "2500",
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "minimum_stock_threshold": 10,
    "auto_update_price": true,
    "auto_update_stock": true,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "field_mappings": {
        "name": "i",
        "description": "Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.",
        "price": "k",
        "stock": "h",
        "sku": "w",
        "weight": "a",
        "images": "y"
    }
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

Example response (200, Mapping updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Product supplier mapping updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "product_id": 123,
        "supplier_id": 456,
        "supplier_product_id": 789,
        "is_primary": true,
        "is_active": true,
        "markup_type": "percentage",
        "markup_percentage": 30,
        "auto_update_price": true,
        "auto_update_stock": true,
        "minimum_stock_threshold": 10,
        "product": {
            "id": 123,
            "name": "iPhone 15 Pro",
            "current_price": 110500,
            "current_price_formatted": "£1,105.00"
        },
        "supplier": {
            "id": 456,
            "name": "Tech Wholesale Ltd"
        },
        "supplier_product": {
            "id": 789,
            "supplier_price": 85000,
            "supplier_price_formatted": "£850.00"
        },
        "calculated_price": 110500,
        "calculated_price_formatted": "£1,105.00",
        "profit_margin": 25500,
        "profit_margin_formatted": "£255.00",
        "profit_percentage": 30,
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (400, Invalid update):


{
    "message": "Cannot update inactive mapping to primary status."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The markup percentage must be greater than 0.",
        "The minimum stock threshold must be at least 0."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

PUT api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/{productSupplierMapping_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to update. Example: 48

Body Parameters

product_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: architecto

supplier_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the suppliers table. Example: architecto

supplier_product_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the supplier's product. Example: 789

is_primary   boolean  optional  

optional Whether this is the primary supplier for the product. Example: true

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Whether the mapping is active. Example: true

priority_order   integer  optional  

optional Priority order for multiple suppliers. Example: 1

markup_percentage   numeric  optional  

optional Markup percentage (required if markup_type is percentage). Example: 30.00

fixed_markup   numeric  optional  

optional Fixed markup amount in pence (required if markup_type is fixed). Example: 2500

markup_type   string  optional  

optional The type of markup (percentage, fixed). Example: percentage

minimum_stock_threshold   integer  optional  

optional Minimum stock level before alerts. Example: 10

auto_update_price   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update product prices. Example: true

auto_update_stock   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update stock levels. Example: true

auto_update_description   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update descriptions. Example: false

field_mappings   object  optional  
name   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: i

description   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: Fugiat sunt nihil accusantium harum mollitia.

price   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: k

stock   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: h

sku   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: w

weight   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: a

images   string  optional  

Must not be greater than 255 characters. Example: y

Delete a product supplier mapping

requires authentication

Remove a product supplier mapping with an optional reason. If the mapping being deleted is the primary mapping, the system will automatically promote another active mapping to primary status. Cannot delete the only mapping for a product with active orders.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"reason\": \"Supplier no longer available\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "reason": "Supplier no longer available"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'reason' => 'Supplier no longer available',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16'
payload = {
    "reason": "Supplier no longer available"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Mapping deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Product supplier mapping deleted successfully."
}

Example response (400, Cannot delete mapping):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete the only mapping for a product with active orders."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/{productSupplierMapping_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to delete. Example: 48

Body Parameters

reason   string  optional  

optional Reason for deletion. Example: Supplier no longer available

Set mapping as primary supplier

requires authentication

Make the specified mapping the primary supplier for its product. This automatically removes the primary status from any existing primary mapping and updates the product's primary supplier reference. Only active mappings can be set as primary.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/make-primary" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/make-primary"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/make-primary';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/make-primary'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('PATCH', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Mapping made primary successfully):


{
    "message": "Mapping set as primary successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "product_id": 123,
        "supplier_id": 456,
        "is_primary": true,
        "is_active": true,
        "product": {
            "id": 123,
            "name": "iPhone 15 Pro",
            "primary_supplier_id": 456
        },
        "supplier": {
            "id": 456,
            "name": "Tech Wholesale Ltd"
        }
    }
}

Example response (400, Cannot make primary):


{
    "message": "Cannot make inactive mapping primary."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

PATCH api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/{productSupplierMapping_id}/make-primary

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to make primary. Example: 48

Activate a product supplier mapping

requires authentication

Activate the specified product supplier mapping, enabling it for dropship operations. This will restore automated sync operations if they were configured and allow the mapping to be used for order fulfillment.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/activate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/activate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/activate';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/activate'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('PATCH', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Mapping activated successfully):


{
    "message": "Mapping activated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "is_active": true,
        "product": {
            "id": 123,
            "name": "iPhone 15 Pro"
        },
        "supplier": {
            "id": 456,
            "name": "Tech Wholesale Ltd"
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

productSupplierMapping   integer

Deactivate a product supplier mapping

requires authentication

Deactivate the specified product supplier mapping, disabling it from dropship operations. This will pause automated sync operations and prevent the mapping from being used for new orders. Cannot deactivate the primary mapping if it's the only active mapping.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/deactivate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/deactivate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/deactivate';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('PATCH', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Mapping deactivated successfully):


{
    "message": "Mapping deactivated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "is_active": false,
        "is_primary": false,
        "product": {
            "id": 123,
            "name": "iPhone 15 Pro"
        },
        "supplier": {
            "id": 456,
            "name": "Tech Wholesale Ltd"
        }
    }
}

Example response (400, Cannot deactivate):


{
    "message": "Cannot deactivate the only active mapping for this product."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.
