Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to deactivate. Example: 48

Update markup settings

requires authentication

Update the markup configuration for the specified mapping including markup type and value. When apply_immediately is set to true, the system will instantly recalculate and update the product's selling price based on the new markup settings.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/update-markup" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"markup_type\": \"percentage\",
    \"markup_value\": \"30.50\",
    \"apply_immediately\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/update-markup"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "markup_value": "30.50",
    "apply_immediately": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/update-markup';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'markup_type' => 'percentage',
            'markup_value' => '30.50',
            'apply_immediately' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/update-markup'
payload = {
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "markup_value": "30.50",
    "apply_immediately": true
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Markup updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Markup updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "markup_type": "percentage",
        "markup_percentage": 30.5,
        "fixed_markup": null,
        "supplier_product": {
            "supplier_price": 85000,
            "supplier_price_formatted": "£850.00"
        },
        "calculated_price": 110925,
        "calculated_price_formatted": "£1,109.25",
        "profit_margin": 25925,
        "profit_margin_formatted": "£259.25",
        "profit_percentage": 30.5,
        "pricing_applied": true
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The markup type field is required.",
        "The markup value field is required.",
        "The markup value must be greater than 0."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/{productSupplierMapping_id}/update-markup

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to update markup for. Example: 48

Body Parameters

markup_type   string   

The type of markup (percentage, fixed). Example: percentage

markup_value   numeric   

The markup value (percentage or amount in pence). Example: 30.50

apply_immediately   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to apply pricing changes immediately. Default: false. Example: true

Sync product data from supplier

requires authentication

Manually trigger a synchronization of product data from the supplier product. This updates pricing, stock levels, and product information based on the current supplier data and the mapping's automation settings. Only works for active mappings with valid supplier products.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/sync-from-supplier" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/sync-from-supplier"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/sync-from-supplier';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/16/sync-from-supplier'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Sync completed successfully):


{
    "message": "Product synced from supplier successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "last_price_update": "2025-01-15T16:45:00.000000Z",
        "last_stock_update": "2025-01-15T16:45:00.000000Z",
        "product": {
            "id": 123,
            "current_price": 110925,
            "current_price_formatted": "£1,109.25",
            "stock_quantity": 25
        },
        "supplier_product": {
            "supplier_price": 85000,
            "supplier_price_formatted": "£850.00",
            "stock_quantity": 25,
            "last_synced": "2025-01-15T16:45:00.000000Z"
        },
        "sync_summary": {
            "price_updated": true,
            "stock_updated": true,
            "description_updated": false,
            "changes_applied": 2
        }
    }
}

Example response (400, Cannot sync):


{
    "message": "Cannot sync from inactive mapping."
}

Example response (400, No supplier product):


{
    "message": "No supplier product found for this mapping."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/{productSupplierMapping_id}/sync-from-supplier

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to sync from supplier. Example: 48

Bulk update mapping settings

requires authentication

Perform bulk operations on multiple product supplier mappings such as updating automation settings, stock thresholds, or other configuration options. This is useful for applying consistent settings across multiple mappings efficiently. Returns detailed results.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-update-settings" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"mapping_ids\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    \"auto_update_price\": true,
    \"auto_update_stock\": true,
    \"auto_update_description\": false,
    \"minimum_stock_threshold\": 10
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-update-settings"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "mapping_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "auto_update_price": true,
    "auto_update_stock": true,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "minimum_stock_threshold": 10
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-update-settings';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'mapping_ids' => [
                1,
                2,
                3,
            ],
            'auto_update_price' => true,
            'auto_update_stock' => true,
            'auto_update_description' => false,
            'minimum_stock_threshold' => 10,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-update-settings'
payload = {
    "mapping_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "auto_update_price": true,
    "auto_update_stock": true,
    "auto_update_description": false,
    "minimum_stock_threshold": 10
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Bulk operation completed):


{
    "message": "Successfully updated settings for 3 mappings.",
    "data": {
        "updated_count": 3,
        "applied_settings": {
            "auto_update_price": true,
            "auto_update_stock": true,
            "minimum_stock_threshold": 10
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The mapping ids field is required.",
        "The mapping ids must contain at least 1 items.",
        "The minimum stock threshold must be at least 0."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-update-settings

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

mapping_ids   string[]   

Array of mapping IDs to update.
*   integer   

Each mapping ID must be a valid integer. Example: 1

auto_update_price   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update prices. Example: true

auto_update_stock   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update stock levels. Example: true

auto_update_description   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically update descriptions. Example: false

minimum_stock_threshold   integer  optional  

optional Minimum stock level before alerts. Example: 10

Bulk sync prices from suppliers

requires authentication

Perform bulk price synchronization for multiple product supplier mappings. This fetches the latest supplier pricing and updates product prices according to each mapping's markup settings. Only processes active mappings with auto-pricing enabled. Returns detailed sync results.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-sync-prices" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"mapping_ids\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-sync-prices"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "mapping_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-sync-prices';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'mapping_ids' => [
                1,
                2,
                3,
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-sync-prices'
payload = {
    "mapping_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Bulk sync completed):


{
    "message": "Bulk price sync completed.",
    "data": {
        "synced": 2,
        "failed": 0,
        "skipped": 1
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The mapping ids field is required.",
        "The mapping ids must contain at least 1 items."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/bulk-sync-prices

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

mapping_ids   string[]   

Array of mapping IDs to sync prices for.
*   integer   

Each mapping ID must be a valid integer. Example: 1

Get comprehensive health report

requires authentication

Retrieve a comprehensive health report for all product supplier mappings including summary statistics, health issues identification, sync status monitoring, and performance metrics. Essential for system monitoring and identifying potential problems.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/health-report" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/health-report"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/health-report';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/health-report'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Health report generated successfully):


{
    "message": "Health report generated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "summary": {
            "total_mappings": 247,
            "active_mappings": 198,
            "primary_mappings": 156,
            "auto_price_sync_enabled": 145,
            "auto_stock_sync_enabled": 167
        },
        "health_issues": {
            "inactive_mappings": 49,
            "missing_supplier_products": 12,
            "inactive_supplier_products": 23,
            "sync_failed_products": 8,
            "low_stock_suppliers": 15,
            "inactive_suppliers": 5
        },
        "sync_status": {
            "recent_price_updates": 67,
            "recent_stock_updates": 89,
            "outdated_price_sync": 23,
            "outdated_stock_sync": 14
        },
        "performance_metrics": {
            "avg_markup_percentage": 28.5,
            "avg_fixed_markup": 1250,
            "most_used_markup_type": "percentage"
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/product-supplier-mappings/health-report

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Product Tag Management

Retrieve all product tags

requires authentication

Get a complete list of all product tags in the system. Product tags are used to label and categorize products for better searchability and organization. Tags help customers find products through filtering and search functionality. This endpoint provides administrators with an overview of all available tags and their usage statistics.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "message": "Tags retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/product-tags

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new product tag

requires authentication

Add a new product tag to the system. Tags should be descriptive, concise, and follow consistent naming conventions (typically lowercase, hyphen-separated for multi-word tags). Once created, tags can be assigned to products to improve searchability and organization. Tag names must be unique across the system.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"wireless-charging\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"wireless-charging\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"wireless-charging"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags'
payload = {
    "name": "\"wireless-charging\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tag created successfully):


{
    "message": "Tag created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "wireless-charging",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate tag name):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-tags

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the product tag. Should be descriptive and follow naming conventions (lowercase, hyphen-separated). Example: "wireless-charging"

Retrieve a specific product tag

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific product tag including its associated products. This endpoint is useful for examining tag usage and understanding which products are currently tagged with specific labels. Helpful for tag management and optimization.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tag found with associated products):


{
    "message": "Tag retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "wireless-charging",
        "products": [
            {
                "id": 15,
                "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                "price": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"
            },
            {
                "id": 23,
                "name": "Smartphone Wireless Charger",
                "price": 2999,
                "price_formatted": "£29.99",
                "created_at": "2025-01-12T16:20:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "products_count": 2,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Product tag with no associated products):


{
    "message": "Tag retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "wireless-charging",
        "products": [],
        "products_count": 0,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product tag not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductTag] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/product-tags/{productTag_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productTag_id   integer   

The ID of the productTag. Example: 1

productTag   integer   

The ID of the product tag to retrieve. Example: 9

Update an existing product tag

requires authentication

Modify an existing product tag name. Exercise caution when updating tags as they may be referenced by multiple products and affect search functionality. Ensure that any name changes maintain consistency with existing tagging conventions and don't create confusion for customers or administrators.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"fast-wireless-charging\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"fast-wireless-charging\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"fast-wireless-charging"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1'
payload = {
    "name": "\"fast-wireless-charging\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tag updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Tag updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "fast-wireless-charging",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product tag not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductTag] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Name already exists):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-tags/{productTag_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productTag_id   integer   

The ID of the productTag. Example: 1

productTag   integer   

The ID of the product tag to update. Example: 9

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the product tag. Must be unique and follow naming conventions. Example: "fast-wireless-charging"

Delete a product tag

requires authentication

Permanently remove a product tag from the system. This action is irreversible and will automatically remove the tag from all products that currently have it assigned. Before deletion, consider the impact on product searchability and organization. Customers may no longer be able to find products using this tag for filtering or search.

Warning: Deleting a widely-used tag may significantly affect product discoverability and customer search experience.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tag deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Tag deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product tag not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductTag] 999"
}

Example response (409, Tag in use by products):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete product tag that is currently assigned to products. Please remove the tag from all products first."
}

Example response (422, Tag has dependencies):


{
    "message": "This tag is currently being used by active products and cannot be deleted."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the product tag."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/product-tags/{productTag_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productTag_id   integer   

The ID of the productTag. Example: 1

productTag   integer   

The ID of the product tag to delete. Example: 9

Public Review Responses

Get all responses for a specific review (Public viewing)

requires authentication

Retrieve all approved vendor responses for a specific review. This endpoint is publicly accessible and does not require authentication.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses?per_page=20&page=2" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses"
);

const params = {
    "per_page": "20",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'per_page' => '20',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses'
params = {
  'per_page': '20',
  'page': '2',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Responses retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Review responses retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "vendor": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Tech Haven"
                },
                "content": "Thank you for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed our product.",
                "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 2,
        "last_page": 1
    }
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/reviews/{review_id}/responses

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 123

Query Parameters

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of responses per page (1-50). Default: 15. Example: 20

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Get individual response details (Public viewing)

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

  'Accept': 'application/json'

response.json()

Request      

GET api/reviews/{review_id}/responses/{response_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

response_id   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 123

response   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 45

Public Shipping Tracking

Track shipment by tracking number

requires authentication

Track a shipment using its tracking number without requiring authentication. This endpoint fetches the latest tracking information from the carrier and returns the current status, delivery information, and tracking history. Public endpoint for customer tracking pages.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipment tracking information retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipment tracking information retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
        "status": "in_transit",
        "status_label": "In Transit",
        "carrier": "Royal Mail",
        "service_name": "Tracked 48",
        "shipped_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z",
        "delivered_at": null,
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-17T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "tracking_url": "https://track.royalmail.com/AB123456789GB",
        "tracking_history": [
            {
                "timestamp": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z",
                "status": "shipped",
                "description": "Item dispatched",
                "location": "London Mail Centre",
                "carrier_status": "DISPATCHED"
            },
            {
                "timestamp": "2025-01-16T08:30:00.000000Z",
                "status": "in_transit",
                "description": "Item in transit",
                "location": "Birmingham Mail Centre",
                "carrier_status": "IN_TRANSIT"
            },
            {
                "timestamp": "2025-01-16T14:45:00.000000Z",
                "status": "out_for_delivery",
                "description": "Out for delivery",
                "location": "Manchester Delivery Office",
                "carrier_status": "OUT_FOR_DELIVERY"
            }
        ],
        "order_id": 123
    }
}

Example response (404, Tracking number not found):


{
    "message": "Tracking number not found."
}

Example response (503, Tracking service unavailable):


{
    "message": "Unable to retrieve tracking information at this time."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/tracking/{trackingNumber}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

trackingNumber   string   

The tracking number to look up. Example: AB123456789GB

Get basic shipment status

requires authentication

Get basic status information for a shipment by tracking number without fetching full tracking updates from the carrier. This is a faster, lightweight endpoint for checking shipment status without detailed tracking history.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB/status" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB/status"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB/status';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/tracking/AB123456789GB/status'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipment status retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipment status retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
        "status": "shipped",
        "status_label": "Shipped",
        "status_color": "blue",
        "is_delivered": false,
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-17T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "delivered_at": null,
        "days_in_transit": 2,
        "is_overdue": false
    }
}

Example response (404, Tracking number not found):


{
    "message": "Tracking number not found."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/tracking/{trackingNumber}/status

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

trackingNumber   string   

The tracking number to look up. Example: AB123456789GB

Refund Processing

Process a refund for an approved return through the specified payment gateway

requires authentication

Execute a refund transaction for an approved return request through the specified payment gateway. This endpoint handles the actual refund processing, updates order statuses, and maintains audit trails. Only approved returns can be processed for refunds. The system automatically calculates refund amounts and updates payment statuses accordingly.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Refund processed successfully):


{
    "message": "Refund processed successfully."
}

Example response (400, Unsupported payment gateway):


{
    "message": "Unsupported payment gateway"
}

Example response (400, Return not approved for refund):


{
    "message": "This return has not been approved for refund."
}

Example response (400, Insufficient refundable amount):


{
    "message": "Refund amount exceeds the remaining refundable balance for this order."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Return request not found):


{
    "message": "Return request not found."
}

Example response (404, No payment found for order):


{
    "message": "No valid payment found for this order. Cannot process refund."
}

Example response (409, Refund already processed):


{
    "message": "A refund has already been processed for this return request."
}

Example response (422, Refund failed at gateway):


{
    "message": "Refund failed. Please try again later."
}

Example response (422, Payment intent not found):


{
    "message": "Payment intent not found in payment gateway. Cannot process refund."
}

Example response (422, Order not in refundable state):


{
    "message": "Order is not in a state that allows refunds (must be paid or partially refunded)."
}

Example response (500, Gateway communication error):


{
    "message": "Unable to communicate with payment gateway. Please try again later."
}

Example response (500, Refund processing error):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while processing the refund."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/refunds/{gateway}/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

gateway   string   

The payment gateway to process the refund through. Currently supports: stripe. Example: stripe

id   integer   

The ID of the return request to refund. Must be an approved return. Example: 15

Return Management

Retrieve a paginated list of all return requests

requires authentication

Get a comprehensive list of all return requests in the system with detailed information about customer reasons, order details, product information, and current status. This endpoint is essential for customer service management, return processing workflows, and administrative oversight of the returns process. Includes complete audit trail and customer communication history.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns?page=2&per_page=25&status=Requested&date_from=2025-01-01&date_to=2025-01-31&order_id=8&user_id=3&product_id=12&reason=damaged" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns"
);

const params = {
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "25",
    "status": "Requested",
    "date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "date_to": "2025-01-31",
    "order_id": "8",
    "user_id": "3",
    "product_id": "12",
    "reason": "damaged",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'status' => 'Requested',
            'date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'date_to' => '2025-01-31',
            'order_id' => '8',
            'user_id' => '3',
            'product_id' => '12',
            'reason' => 'damaged',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns'
params = {
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '25',
  'status': 'Requested',
  'date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'date_to': '2025-01-31',
  'order_id': '8',
  'user_id': '3',
  'product_id': '12',
  'reason': 'damaged',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

        "current_page": 1,

        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

{
    "errors": [
        "The status field must be one of: Requested, Under Review, Approved, Rejected, Return Shipped, Return Received, Completed, Cancelled, Pending.",
        "The date from field must be a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format.",
        "The order id field must be an integer.",
        "The user id field must be an integer."
    ]
}

Request      

GET api/admin/returns

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of returns per page (max 100). Default: 20. Example: 25

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by return status. Available: Requested, Under Review, Approved, Rejected, Return Shipped, Return Received, Completed, Cancelled, Pending. Example: Requested

date_from   string  optional  

optional Filter returns from this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-01

date_to   string  optional  

optional Filter returns to this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-31

order_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter returns by specific order ID. Example: 8

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter returns by specific customer ID. Example: 3

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter returns by specific product ID. Example: 12

reason   string  optional  

optional Filter by return reason (partial text search). Example: damaged

Review and update the status of a return request

requires authentication

Process a return request by changing its status through the review workflow. This endpoint allows administrators to move returns through different stages: review, approve, or reject. Status changes trigger appropriate notifications to customers and update the order processing workflow. Only returns in appropriate states can be transitioned to prevent invalid workflows.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Return approved successfully):


{
    "message": "Return status updated to Approved.",
    "data": {
        "id": 15,
        "order_item_id": 25,
        "reason": "Product damaged on arrival - speaker has crackling sound at any volume level",
        "order_return_status_id": 3,
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Return moved to review):


{
    "message": "Return status updated to Under Review.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "order_item_id": 18,
        "reason": "Product does not match description - advertised as waterproof but failed during first use",
        "order_return_status_id": 2,
        "created_at": "2025-01-14T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T09:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Return rejected):


{
    "message": "Return status updated to Rejected.",
    "data": {
        "id": 8,
        "order_item_id": 22,
        "reason": "Wrong size ordered by mistake",
        "order_return_status_id": 4,
        "created_at": "2025-01-12T11:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T16:15:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (400, Return window expired):


{
    "message": "Return request cannot be approved as the return window has expired."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Return request not found):


{
    "message": "Return request not found."
}

Example response (409, Return already has refund):


{
    "message": "Cannot modify return status as a refund has already been processed for this item."
}

Example response (422, Return already processed):


{
    "message": "Return is already processed."
}

Example response (422, Invalid action provided):


{
    "message": "Invalid action provided."
}

Example response (422, Invalid status transition):


{
    "message": "Cannot change return status from Completed to Under Review. Invalid status transition."
}

Example response (422, Order not eligible for returns):


{
    "message": "Order is not in a state that allows returns (must be delivered or completed)."
}

Example response (500, Status update failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while updating the return status."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/returns/{returnId}/{action}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

returnId   integer   

The ID of the return request to review. Example: 15

action   string   

The action to perform on the return. Must be one of: review, approve, reject. Example: approve

Role Management

Retrieve all user roles

requires authentication

Get a complete list of all user roles in the system. Roles define user access levels and permissions within the application. This endpoint is essential for user management, access control configuration, and understanding the system's permission structure. Only administrators with proper permissions can view roles to maintain system security.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Roles retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Roles retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "super_admin",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "admin",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "manager",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "customer_service",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "vendor",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:20:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:20:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 6,
            "name": "user",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:25:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:25:00.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (200, No roles configured):


{
    "message": "Roles retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/roles

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new user role

requires authentication

Add a new role to the system for user access control. Roles define what permissions users have and what actions they can perform within the application. Role names should follow a consistent naming convention (lowercase, underscore-separated) and must be unique. Once created, roles can be assigned to users and configured with specific permissions.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"customer_service\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "customer_service"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'customer_service',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles'
payload = {
    "name": "customer_service"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Role created successfully):


{
    "message": "Role created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 7,
        "name": "customer_service",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate role name):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the role. Should follow naming convention (lowercase, underscore-separated). Will be converted to lowercase automatically. Example: customer_service

Update an existing role

requires authentication

Modify an existing role name in the system. Exercise caution when updating roles as this may affect user access throughout the application. Ensure that any name changes are reflected in user assignments and access control logic. Role names are automatically converted to lowercase and must remain unique across all roles.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"senior_customer_service\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "senior_customer_service"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'senior_customer_service',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

    "name": "senior_customer_service"
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}
