response.json()

Example response (200, Role updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Role updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 7,
        "name": "senior_customer_service",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:15:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Name already exists):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 1

role   integer   

The ID of the role to update. Example: 7

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the role. Should follow naming convention (lowercase, underscore-separated). Will be converted to lowercase automatically. Example: senior_customer_service

Delete a role

requires authentication

Permanently remove a role from the system. This action is irreversible and will affect all users currently assigned to this role. Before deletion, ensure that users with this role are reassigned to appropriate alternative roles to maintain proper access control. Exercise extreme caution when deleting roles as this may impact user access throughout the application.

Warning: Deleting a role that is currently assigned to users may leave those users without proper access permissions, potentially locking them out of system features.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Role deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Role deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (409, Role in use by users):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete role that is currently assigned to users."
}

Example response (422, Core role protection):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete core system roles required for application functionality."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the role."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/roles/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 1

role   integer   

The ID of the role to delete. Example: 7

Role Permission Management

Retrieve all permissions for a specific role

requires authentication

Get a complete list of permissions assigned to a specific role. This endpoint is essential for understanding what actions users with this role can perform within the system. It provides administrators with visibility into the current permission structure and helps with access control auditing and role management decisions.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permissions retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "permissions": [
            "view_users",
            "create_users",
            "edit_users",
            "view_orders",
            "create_orders",
            "edit_orders",
            "view_products",
            "create_products",
            "edit_products",
            "view_vendors",
            "manage_returns",
            "view_payments"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Role with no permissions):


{
    "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "new_role",
        "permissions": []
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 1

role   integer   

The ID of the role to retrieve permissions for. Example: 3

Assign specific permissions to a role

requires authentication

Grant specific permissions to a role, enabling users with that role to perform the associated actions. This endpoint allows fine-grained control over role capabilities by selectively assigning permissions. Permissions are added to existing ones (not replaced), so you can incrementally build up role permissions without losing previously assigned ones.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"permissions\": [
        \"architecto\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "permissions": [
        "architecto"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'permissions' => [
                'architecto',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions'
payload = {
    "permissions": [
        "architecto"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permissions assigned successfully):


{
    "message": "Permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "assigned_permissions": [
            "delete_users",
            "manage_refunds",
            "view_reports"
        ],
        "total_permissions": 15
    }
}

Example response (200, Permissions already assigned):


{
    "message": "Permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "assigned_permissions": [],
        "note": "All specified permissions were already assigned to this role",
        "total_permissions": 12
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The permissions field is required.",
        "The permissions must be an array.",
        "The permissions.0 is invalid. Permission 'invalid_permission' does not exist.",
        "The permissions.1 is invalid. Permission 'another_invalid' does not exist."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Invalid permission names):


{
    "errors": [
        "The following permissions do not exist: invalid_permission, fake_permission"
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 1

role   integer   

The ID of the role to assign permissions to. Example: 3

Body Parameters

permissions   string[]   

List of permission names to assign to the role. All permission names must exist in the system.
*   string   

The name of each permission to assign. Must be exact permission names as stored in the database. Example: "view_users"

Assign all available permissions to a role

requires authentication

Grant all permissions in the system to a specific role, effectively creating a "super" role with complete access to all system functionality. Use this endpoint with extreme caution as it provides unrestricted access to all features. This is typically used for super administrator roles or during initial system setup. The operation will assign every permission that exists in the system.

Warning: This gives complete system access to users with this role. Ensure this is intentional and that the role is assigned only to trusted administrators.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/assign-all" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/assign-all"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/assign-all';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/assign-all'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, All permissions assigned successfully):


{
    "message": "All permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "super_admin",
        "total_permissions_assigned": 47,
        "newly_assigned": 12,
        "already_assigned": 35,
        "permissions": [
            "view_users",
            "create_users",
            "edit_users",
            "delete_users",
            "view_orders",
            "create_orders",
            "edit_orders",
            "delete_orders",
            "view_products",
            "create_products",
            "edit_products",
            "delete_products",
            "view_vendors",
            "create_vendors",
            "edit_vendors",
            "delete_vendors",
            "view_payments",
            "manage_refunds",
            "manage_returns",
            "view_roles",
            "create_roles",
            "edit_roles",
            "delete_roles",
            "view_permissions",
            "create_permissions",
            "edit_permissions",
            "delete_permissions",
            "view_reports",
            "export_data",
            "import_data",
            "system_settings",
            "user_management",
            "security_settings"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Role already has all permissions):


{
    "message": "All permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "super_admin",
        "total_permissions_assigned": 47,
        "newly_assigned": 0,
        "already_assigned": 47,
        "note": "Role already had all available permissions"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (500, Assignment failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while assigning all permissions to the role."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions/assign-all

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 1

role   integer   

The ID of the role to assign all permissions to. Example: 1

Revoke a specific permission from a role

requires authentication

Remove a specific permission from a role, preventing users with that role from performing the associated action. This endpoint provides fine-grained control over role capabilities by allowing selective removal of permissions. Use this when you need to restrict access to specific features for users with a particular role while maintaining their other permissions.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/1/permissions/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permission revoked successfully):


{
    "message": "Permission revoked successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "revoked_permission": "delete_users",
        "remaining_permissions_count": 11,
        "remaining_permissions": [
            "view_users",
            "create_users",
            "edit_users",
            "view_orders",
            "create_orders",
            "edit_orders",
            "view_products",
            "create_products",
            "edit_products",
            "view_vendors",
            "manage_returns"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Permission was not assigned):


{
    "message": "Permission revoked successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "permission": "super_admin_only",
        "note": "Permission was not assigned to this role",
        "remaining_permissions_count": 12
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (404, Permission not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Permission] 999"
}

Example response (422, Cannot revoke core permission):


{
    "message": "Cannot revoke core system permissions that are required for role functionality."
}

Example response (500, Revocation failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while revoking the permission from the role."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions/{permission_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 1

permission_id   integer   

The ID of the permission. Example: 1

role   integer   

The ID of the role to revoke the permission from. Example: 3

permission   integer   

The ID of the permission to revoke from the role. Example: 12

Shipment Management

Retrieve paginated list of shipments

requires authentication

Get a paginated list of all shipments in the system with comprehensive filtering options. This endpoint supports filtering by status, carrier, tracking number, order ID, shipping dates, and can identify overdue shipments. Essential for shipment management and monitoring.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments?status=shipped&carrier=royal-mail&tracking_number=AB123456789GB&order_id=123&shipped_date_from=2025-01-01&shipped_date_to=2025-01-31&overdue=1&page=1&per_page=25" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments"
);

const params = {
    "status": "shipped",
    "carrier": "royal-mail",
    "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
    "order_id": "123",
    "shipped_date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "shipped_date_to": "2025-01-31",
    "overdue": "1",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "25",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'status' => 'shipped',
            'carrier' => 'royal-mail',
            'tracking_number' => 'AB123456789GB',
            'order_id' => '123',
            'shipped_date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'shipped_date_to' => '2025-01-31',
            'overdue' => '1',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '25',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments'
params = {
  'status': 'shipped',
  'carrier': 'royal-mail',
  'tracking_number': 'AB123456789GB',
  'order_id': '123',
  'shipped_date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'shipped_date_to': '2025-01-31',
  'overdue': '1',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '25',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Success with shipments):


{
    "message": "Shipments retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "order_id": 123,
                "shipping_method_id": 2,
                "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
                "carrier": "Royal Mail",
                "service_name": "Tracked 48",
                "status": "shipped",
                "status_label": "Shipped",
                "status_color": "blue",
                "shipping_cost": 599,
                "shipping_cost_formatted": "£5.99",
                "label_url": "https://example.com/labels/123.pdf",
                "tracking_url": "https://track.royalmail.com/AB123456789GB",
                "shipped_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z",
                "delivered_at": null,
                "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-17T17:00:00.000000Z",
                "days_in_transit": 2,
                "is_overdue": false,
                "is_delivered": false,
                "is_shipped": true,
                "is_pending": false,
                "is_cancelled": false,
                "has_tracking_number": true,
                "has_label": true,
                "notes": "Handle with care",
                "order": {
                    "id": 123,
                    "total_amount": 2999,
                    "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
                    "created_at": "2025-01-14T14:30:00.000000Z",
                    "user": {
                        "id": 45,
                        "name": "John Smith",
                        "email": "john@example.com"
                    }
                },
                "shipping_method": {
                    "id": 2,
                    "name": "Standard Delivery",
                    "carrier": "Royal Mail",
                    "estimated_delivery": "3-5 days"
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T09:45:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 47,
        "last_page": 4
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/shipments

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by shipment status (pending, processing, shipped, delivered, etc.). Example: shipped

carrier   string  optional  

optional Filter by carrier name (partial match supported). Example: royal-mail

tracking_number   string  optional  

optional Filter by tracking number (partial match supported). Example: AB123456789GB

order_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter shipments for specific order ID. Example: 123

shipped_date_from   string  optional  

optional Filter shipments shipped from this date (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-01

shipped_date_to   string  optional  

optional Filter shipments shipped until this date (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2025-01-31

overdue   boolean  optional  

optional Show only overdue shipments (past estimated delivery). Example: true

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of shipments per page (max 100). Default: 15. Example: 25

Create a new shipment

requires authentication

Create a new shipment for an order with specified shipping method and carrier details. The system validates that the order can be shipped and doesn't already have active shipments. Optionally auto-purchase shipping labels and send notifications to customers.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"order_id\": 123,
    \"shipping_method_id\": 2,
    \"carrier\": \"Royal Mail\",
    \"service_name\": \"Tracked 48\",
    \"shipping_cost\": \"5.99\",
    \"estimated_delivery\": \"2025-01-20 17:00:00\",
    \"notes\": \"Handle with care\",
    \"auto_purchase_label\": true,
    \"send_notification\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "order_id": 123,
    "shipping_method_id": 2,
    "carrier": "Royal Mail",
    "service_name": "Tracked 48",
    "shipping_cost": "5.99",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-20 17:00:00",
    "notes": "Handle with care",
    "auto_purchase_label": true,
    "send_notification": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'order_id' => 123,
            'shipping_method_id' => 2,
            'carrier' => 'Royal Mail',
            'service_name' => 'Tracked 48',
            'shipping_cost' => '5.99',
            'estimated_delivery' => '2025-01-20 17:00:00',
            'notes' => 'Handle with care',
            'auto_purchase_label' => true,
            'send_notification' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments'
payload = {
    "order_id": 123,
    "shipping_method_id": 2,
    "carrier": "Royal Mail",
    "service_name": "Tracked 48",
    "shipping_cost": "5.99",
    "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-20 17:00:00",
    "notes": "Handle with care",
    "auto_purchase_label": true,
    "send_notification": true
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipment created successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipment created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "order_id": 123,
        "shipping_method_id": 2,
        "tracking_number": null,
        "carrier": "Royal Mail",
        "service_name": "Tracked 48",
        "status": "pending",
        "status_label": "Pending",
        "status_color": "orange",
        "shipping_cost": 599,
        "shipping_cost_formatted": "£5.99",
        "label_url": null,
        "tracking_url": null,
        "shipped_at": null,
        "delivered_at": null,
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-20T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "days_in_transit": null,
        "is_overdue": false,
        "is_delivered": false,
        "is_shipped": false,
        "is_pending": true,
        "is_cancelled": false,
        "has_tracking_number": false,
        "has_label": false,
        "notes": "Handle with care",
        "order": {
            "id": 123,
            "total_amount": 2999,
            "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
            "created_at": "2025-01-14T14:30:00.000000Z"
        },
        "shipping_method": {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Standard Delivery",
            "carrier": "Royal Mail"
        },
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (400, Order cannot be shipped):


{
    "message": "Order already has an active shipment."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The order id field is required.",
        "The shipping method id field is required.",
        "The carrier field is required.",
        "The shipping cost field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/shipments

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

order_id   integer   

The ID of the order to create shipment for. Example: 123

shipping_method_id   integer   

The shipping method to use. Example: 2

carrier   string   

The carrier name (e.g., "Royal Mail", "DPD"). Example: Royal Mail

service_name   string  optional  

optional The specific service name (e.g., "Tracked 48"). Example: Tracked 48

shipping_cost   numeric   

The shipping cost in pounds. Example: 5.99

estimated_delivery   string  optional  

optional Estimated delivery date (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS). Example: 2025-01-20 17:00:00

notes   string  optional  

optional Additional notes for the shipment. Example: Handle with care

auto_purchase_label   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to automatically purchase shipping label. Default: false. Example: true

send_notification   boolean  optional  

optional Whether to send notification to customer. Default: true. Example: true

Get shipment statistics

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive statistics about shipments including totals, status breakdowns, carrier performance, and delivery metrics. Useful for dashboard displays and reporting. Data can be filtered by date range for specific periods.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/stats?date_from=2025-01-01&date_to=2025-01-31" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/stats"
);

const params = {
    "date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "date_to": "2025-01-31",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/stats';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'date_to' => '2025-01-31',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

params = {
  'date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'date_to': '2025-01-31',
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

            "pending": 12,
            "processing": 8,
            "shipped": 45,
            "delivered": 89,
            "cancelled": 2
        },

            "Royal Mail": 78,
            "DPD": 45,
            "UPS": 23,
            "Parcelforce": 10
        },
        "average_delivery_time": 2.8
    }
}

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Request      

GET api/admin/shipments/stats

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

date_from   string  optional  

optional Start date for statistics (YYYY-MM-DD). Default: 30 days ago. Example: 2025-01-01

date_to   string  optional  

optional End date for statistics (YYYY-MM-DD). Default: now. Example: 2025-01-31

Get overdue shipments

requires authentication

Retrieve all shipments that are past their estimated delivery date and haven't been delivered or cancelled. This is critical for customer service and proactive communication about delayed shipments. Results are ordered by estimated delivery date.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/overdue" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/overdue"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/overdue';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/overdue'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "message": "Overdue shipments retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 23,
                "tracking_number": "CD987654321GB",
                "carrier": "Royal Mail",
                "status": "shipped",
                "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-10T17:00:00.000000Z",
                "days_overdue": 5,
                "order": {
                    "id": 89,
                    "user": {
                        "id": 34,
                        "name": "Jane Doe",
                        "email": "jane@example.com"
                    }
                },
                "shipping_method": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "Standard Delivery",
                    "carrier": "Royal Mail"
                }
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 50,
        "total": 3
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Retrieve a specific shipment

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific shipment including order details, shipping method, and current tracking status. If the shipment has a tracking number and isn't delivered, the system will attempt to update tracking information from the carrier.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipments/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipment found):


{
    "message": "Shipment retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 48,
        "order_id": 123,

        "tracking_number": "AB123456789GB",
        "carrier": "Royal Mail",
        "service_name": "Tracked 48",
        "status": "shipped",
        "status_label": "Shipped",
        "status_color": "blue",
        "shipping_cost": 599,
        "shipping_cost_formatted": "£5.99",
        "label_url": "https://example.com/labels/123.pdf",
        "tracking_url": "https://track.royalmail.com/AB123456789GB",
        "shipped_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000000Z",
        "delivered_at": null,
        "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-17T17:00:00.000000Z",
        "days_in_transit": 2,
        "is_overdue": false,
        "is_delivered": false,
        "is_shipped": true,
        "is_pending": false,
        "is_cancelled": false,
        "has_tracking_number": true,
        "has_label": true,
        "notes": "Handle with care",
        "order": {
            "id": 123,
            "total_amount": 2999,
            "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
