Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shippingZone_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingZone. Example: 1

shippingZone   integer   

The ID of the shipping zone to delete. Example: 9

Activate a shipping zone

requires authentication

Activate a shipping zone to make it available for shipping calculations. Activated zones will be considered when determining available shipping methods and rates for customer addresses.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/activate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/activate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/activate';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'

response.json()

        "id": 9,

    }

Request      

PATCH api/admin/shipping-zones/{shippingZone_id}/activate

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shippingZone_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingZone. Example: 1

shippingZone   integer   

The ID of the shipping zone to activate. Example: 9

Deactivate a shipping zone

requires authentication

Deactivate a shipping zone to remove it from shipping calculations. Deactivated zones will not be considered when determining available shipping methods and rates, but existing orders remain unaffected.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/deactivate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/deactivate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/deactivate';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "Nordic Countries",
        "is_active": false,
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T16:05:00.000000Z"
    }

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."

Request      

PATCH api/admin/shipping-zones/{shippingZone_id}/deactivate

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shippingZone_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingZone. Example: 1

shippingZone   integer   

The ID of the shipping zone to deactivate. Example: 9

Reorder shipping zones

requires authentication

Update the display order of shipping zones. This affects the priority in which zones are evaluated for shipping calculations. Zones with lower sort_order values are processed first and take precedence in case of overlapping coverage.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/reorder" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"zones\": [
        1,
        2,
        9,
        3
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/reorder"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "zones": [
        1,
        2,
        9,
        3
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/reorder';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'zones' => [
                1,
                2,
                9,
                3,
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/reorder'
payload = {
    "zones": [
        1,
        2,
        9,
        3
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipping zones reordered successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipping zones reordered successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The zones field is required.",
        "The zones must be an array.",
        "The zones.0 must be an integer.",
        "The zones.1 must exist in shipping_zones table."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/shipping-zones/reorder

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

zones   string[]   

Array of shipping zone IDs in desired order.
*   integer   

Each zone ID must be a valid shipping zone ID. Example: 1

Attach shipping method to zone

requires authentication

Associate a shipping method with a shipping zone, making that method available for addresses within the zone. Can specify if the method is active within the zone and set the display order for methods within the zone.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"method_id\": 3,
    \"is_active\": true,
    \"sort_order\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "method_id": 3,
    "is_active": true,
    "sort_order": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'method_id' => 3,
            'is_active' => true,
            'sort_order' => 1,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods'
payload = {
    "method_id": 3,
    "is_active": true,
    "sort_order": 1
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Shipping method attached successfully):


{
    "message": "Shipping method attached to zone successfully."
}

Example response (400, Method already attached):


{
    "message": "Shipping method is already attached to this zone."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The method id field is required.",
        "The method id must be an integer.",
        "The method id must exist in shipping_methods table."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/shipping-zones/{shippingZone_id}/methods

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shippingZone_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingZone. Example: 1

shippingZone   integer   

The ID of the shipping zone. Example: 9

Body Parameters

method_id   integer   

The ID of the shipping method to attach. Example: 3

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Whether the method is active in this zone. Default: true. Example: true

sort_order   integer  optional  

optional Display order within the zone. Default: 0. Example: 1

Detach shipping method from zone

requires authentication

Remove the association between a shipping method and a shipping zone. This makes the method unavailable for addresses within the zone. Also removes any rates configured for this method-zone combination.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

{
    "message": "Shipping method detached from zone successfully."
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Method not attached to zone):


{
    "message": "Shipping method is not attached to this zone."

Request      

DELETE api/admin/shipping-zones/{shippingZone_id}/methods/{shippingMethod_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

shippingZone_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingZone. Example: 1

shippingMethod_id   integer   

The ID of the shippingMethod. Example: 1

shippingZone   integer   

The ID of the shipping zone. Example: 9

shippingMethod   integer   

The ID of the shipping method to detach. Example: 3

Update method settings within zone

requires authentication

Update the settings for a shipping method within a specific zone. This allows fine-tuning of method availability and display order on a per-zone basis without affecting the method globally.

Example request:
curl --request PUT \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"is_active\": false,
    \"sort_order\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "is_active": false,
    "sort_order": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PUT",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/shipping-zones/1/methods/1';
$response = $client->put(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'is_active' => false,
            'sort_order' => 2,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

    "is_active": false,
    "sort_order": 2
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

PUT api/admin/shipping-zones/{shippingZone_id}/methods/{shippingMethod_id}

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Whether the method is active in this zone. Example: false

sort_order   integer  optional  

optional Display order within the zone. Example: 2

Shopping Cart

Retrieve user's shopping cart

requires authentication

Get the current cart contents for the authenticated user. Returns cart items with product details, pricing information, availability status, and total calculations. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/cart" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Cart retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Cart retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 15998,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£159.98",
        "total_items_count": 3,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": false,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "product_variant_id": 24,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price_snapshot": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "line_total": 15998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£159.98",
                "current_price": 7999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "is_available": true,
                "available_stock": 20,
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                    "description": "Premium quality wireless headphones",
                    "price": 7499,
                    "price_formatted": "£74.99",
                    "featured_image": "https://yourapi.com/storage/products/headphones.jpg",
                    "status": "Active"
                },
                "product_variant": {
                    "id": 24,
                    "value": "White",
                    "additional_price": 500,
                    "additional_price_formatted": "£5.00",
                    "quantity": 20,
                    "product_attribute": {
                        "id": 1,
                        "name": "Color"
                    }
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:35:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "Cart retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 13,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 0,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£0.00",
        "total_items_count": 0,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": true,
        "items": [],
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}

You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/cart

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Add item to shopping cart

requires authentication

Add a product (with optional variant) to the authenticated user's shopping cart. If the item already exists, the quantities will be combined. Validates product availability, stock levels, and pricing. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": 15,
    \"product_variant_id\": 24,
    \"quantity\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": 15,
    "product_variant_id": 24,
    "quantity": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 15,
            'product_variant_id' => 24,
            'quantity' => 2,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

    "product_id": 15,
    "product_variant_id": 24,
    "quantity": 2
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "product_variant_id": 24,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price_snapshot": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "line_total": 15998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£159.98",
                "current_price": 7999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "is_available": true,
                "available_stock": 18,
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                    "status": "Active"
                },
                "product_variant": {
                    "id": 24,
                    "value": "White",
                    "additional_price": 500,
                    "quantity": 18
                }
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (400, Product not available):


{
    "message": "Product is not available for purchase."
}

Example response (400, Insufficient stock):


{
    "message": "Insufficient stock. Only 5 items available."
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "The selected product is not available."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):

    "errors": [
        "Please select a product to add to cart.",
        "Quantity must be at least 1.",
        "The selected product variant does not belong to the specified product."
    ]
}

You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/cart/items

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product to add to cart. Example: 15

product_variant_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the product variant (for products with variants like color, size). Example: 24

quantity   integer   

The quantity to add to cart (1-999). Example: 2

Update cart item quantity

requires authentication

Update the quantity of a specific item in the authenticated user's cart. Setting quantity to 0 will remove the item from the cart. Validates stock availability and updates pricing to current product price if it has changed since adding to cart. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"quantity\": 3
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "quantity": 3
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'quantity' => 3,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

    "quantity": 3
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

    "message": "Cart updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 23997,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£239.97",
        "total_items_count": 3,

        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": false,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "product_variant_id": 24,

                "price_snapshot": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "line_total": 23997,
                "line_total_formatted": "£239.97",
                "current_price": 7999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "is_available": true,
                "available_stock": 17
            }
        ]
    }
}

    "message": "Cart updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 0,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£0.00",
        "total_items_count": 0,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_empty": true,
        "items": []
    }
}

Example response (400, Insufficient stock):


{
    "message": "Insufficient stock. Only 2 items available."
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}

Example response (404, Cart item not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\CartItem] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "Please specify the quantity.",
        "Cannot have more than 999 items of the same product."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/cart/items/{cartItem}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

cartItem   integer   

The ID of the cart item to update. Example: 45

Body Parameters

quantity   integer   

The new quantity for the cart item (0 to remove). Example: 3

Remove item from cart

requires authentication

Remove a specific item completely from the authenticated user's shopping cart. This action cannot be undone. The cart totals and item count will be automatically recalculated. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Item removed successfully):


{
    "message": "Item removed from cart successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 7999,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£79.99",
        "total_items_count": 1,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": false,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 46,
                "product_id": 22,
                "quantity": 1,
                "line_total": 7999,
                "line_total_formatted": "£79.99"
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}

Example response (404, Cart item not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\CartItem] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/cart/items/{cartItem}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

cartItem   integer   

The ID of the cart item to remove. Example: 45

Clear entire cart

requires authentication

Remove all items from the authenticated user's shopping cart. This action cannot be undone and will result in an empty cart. Useful for starting over or clearing expired/unavailable items. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Cart cleared successfully):


{
    "message": "Cart cleared successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 0,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£0.00",
        "total_items_count": 0,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": true,
        "items": [],
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/cart/clear

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Synchronize cart prices

requires authentication

Update all cart item prices for the authenticated user to match current product prices. This is useful when product prices have changed since items were added to the cart. Returns information about which items had price changes. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Prices synchronized successfully):


{
    "message": "Cart prices synchronized. 2 items updated.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 17998,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£179.98",
        "total_items_count": 2,
        "expires_at": null,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price_snapshot": 8999,
                "price_formatted": "£89.99",
                "line_total": 17998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£179.98",
                "current_price": 8999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "price_change": 1000
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, No price changes):


{
    "message": "Cart prices synchronized. 0 items updated.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 15998,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£159.98",
        "expires_at": null,
        "items": []
    }
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Supplier Integrations

Retrieve paginated list of supplier integrations

requires authentication

Get a paginated list of all supplier integrations in the system. This endpoint supports filtering by supplier, integration type, status, and health status. Includes integration performance metrics.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations?supplier_id=1&integration_type=api&is_active=1&status=active&search=GlobalTech&healthy=1&page=1&per_page=20" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations"
);

const params = {
    "supplier_id": "1",
    "integration_type": "api",
    "is_active": "1",
    "status": "active",
    "search": "GlobalTech",
    "healthy": "1",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "20",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'supplier_id' => '1',
            'integration_type' => 'api',
            'is_active' => '1',
            'status' => 'active',
            'search' => 'GlobalTech',
            'healthy' => '1',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '20',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations'
params = {
  'supplier_id': '1',
  'integration_type': 'api',
  'is_active': '1',
  'status': 'active',
  'search': 'GlobalTech',
  'healthy': '1',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '20',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Success with integrations):


{
    "message": "Supplier integrations retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "supplier_id": 1,
                "integration_type": "api",
                "name": "GlobalTech API Integration",
                "is_active": true,
                "status": "active",
                "configuration": {
                    "api_endpoint": "https://api.globaltech-dist.com/v1",
                    "rate_limit": 100,
                    "timeout": 30,
                    "format": "json"
                },
                "sync_frequency_minutes": 60,
                "auto_retry_enabled": true,
                "max_retry_attempts": 3,
                "consecutive_failures": 0,
                "last_successful_sync": "2025-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z",
                "last_failed_sync": null,
                "last_error": null,
                "webhook_events": [
                    "order.status_changed",
                    "product.stock_updated"
                ],
                "supplier": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "GlobalTech Distributors",
                    "status": "active"
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 4,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": 1,
        "to": 4
    }
}

Example response (200, No integrations found):


{
    "message": "Supplier integrations retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The supplier id field must be an integer.",
        "The integration type field must be one of: api, webhook, email, ftp, manual."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/supplier-integrations

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

supplier_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter integrations by specific supplier ID. Example: 1

integration_type   string  optional  

optional Filter by integration type (api, webhook, email, ftp, manual). Example: api

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by active status (1 for active, 0 for inactive). Example: true

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by integration status (active, inactive, error, maintenance). Example: active

search   string  optional  

optional Search integrations by name or supplier name. Example: GlobalTech

healthy   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by health status (1 for healthy, 0 for unhealthy). Example: true

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of integrations per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 20

Create a new supplier integration

requires authentication

Create a new integration for a supplier with specified configuration and authentication settings. Only one integration per supplier can be active at a time. Creating an active integration will automatically deactivate existing ones for the same supplier.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"supplier_id\": 1,
    \"integration_type\": \"api\",
    \"name\": \"GlobalTech API v2\",
    \"is_active\": true,
    \"configuration\": {
        \"api_endpoint\": \"https:\\/\\/api.example.com\\/v1\",
        \"rate_limit\": 100
    },
    \"authentication\": {
        \"type\": \"api_key\",
        \"api_key\": \"your-api-key\"
    },
    \"sync_frequency_minutes\": 30,
    \"auto_retry_enabled\": true,
    \"max_retry_attempts\": 5,
    \"webhook_events\": [
        \"order.created\",
        \"stock.updated\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "supplier_id": 1,
    "integration_type": "api",
    "name": "GlobalTech API v2",
    "is_active": true,
    "configuration": {
        "api_endpoint": "https:\/\/api.example.com\/v1",
        "rate_limit": 100
    },
    "authentication": {
        "type": "api_key",
        "api_key": "your-api-key"
    },
    "sync_frequency_minutes": 30,
    "auto_retry_enabled": true,
    "max_retry_attempts": 5,
    "webhook_events": [
        "order.created",
        "stock.updated"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'supplier_id' => 1,
            'integration_type' => 'api',
            'name' => 'GlobalTech API v2',
            'is_active' => true,
            'configuration' => [
                'api_endpoint' => 'https://api.example.com/v1',
                'rate_limit' => 100,
            ],
            'authentication' => [
                'type' => 'api_key',
                'api_key' => 'your-api-key',
            ],
            'sync_frequency_minutes' => 30,
            'auto_retry_enabled' => true,
            'max_retry_attempts' => 5,
            'webhook_events' => [
                'order.created',
                'stock.updated',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations'
payload = {
    "supplier_id": 1,
    "integration_type": "api",
    "name": "GlobalTech API v2",
    "is_active": true,
    "configuration": {
        "api_endpoint": "https:\/\/api.example.com\/v1",
        "rate_limit": 100
    },
    "authentication": {
        "type": "api_key",
        "api_key": "your-api-key"
    },
    "sync_frequency_minutes": 30,
    "auto_retry_enabled": true,
    "max_retry_attempts": 5,
    "webhook_events": [
        "order.created",
        "stock.updated"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Integration created successfully):


{
    "message": "Supplier integration created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 5,
        "supplier_id": 1,
        "integration_type": "api",
        "name": "GlobalTech API v2",
        "is_active": true,
        "status": "active",
        "configuration": {
            "api_endpoint": "https://api.example.com/v1",
            "rate_limit": 100,
            "timeout": 30
        },
        "sync_frequency_minutes": 30,
        "auto_retry_enabled": true,
        "max_retry_attempts": 5,
        "webhook_events": [
            "order.created",
            "stock.updated"
        ],
        "consecutive_failures": 0,
        "last_successful_sync": null,
        "supplier": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "GlobalTech Distributors",
            "status": "active"
        },
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T18:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T18:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Supplier not found):


{
    "message": "The selected supplier id is invalid."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The supplier id field is required.",
        "The integration type field must be one of: api, webhook, email, ftp, manual.",
        "The configuration field is required.",
        "The authentication field is required."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to create supplier integration."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/supplier-integrations

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

supplier_id   integer   

The ID of the supplier for this integration. Example: 1

integration_type   string   

Integration method (api, webhook, email, ftp, manual). Example: api

name   string   

Display name for the integration. Example: GlobalTech API v2

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Whether this integration is active. Default: true. Example: true

configuration   object   

Integration-specific configuration parameters.

authentication   object   

Authentication credentials and settings.

sync_frequency_minutes   integer  optional  

optional Sync frequency in minutes. Default: 60. Example: 30

auto_retry_enabled   boolean  optional  

optional Enable automatic retry on failures. Default: true. Example: true

max_retry_attempts   integer  optional  

optional Maximum retry attempts. Default: 3. Example: 5

webhook_events   string[]  optional  

optional Webhook events to subscribe to.

Retrieve a specific supplier integration

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific supplier integration including configuration, authentication settings, sync statistics, and health metrics.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

    "message": "Supplier integration retrieved successfully.",

        "id": 1,

        "is_active": true,

            "api_endpoint": "https://api.globaltech-dist.com/v1",

            "format": "json",

                "products": "/products",
                "orders": "/orders",
                "stock": "/stock"
            }
        },
        "authentication": {
            "type": "api_key",
            "headers": {
                "Authorization": "Bearer {api_key}",
                "Content-Type": "application/json"
            }
        },
        "sync_frequency_minutes": 60,
        "auto_retry_enabled": true,
        "max_retry_attempts": 3,
        "consecutive_failures": 0,
        "last_successful_sync": "2025-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z",
        "last_failed_sync": null,
        "last_error": null,
        "webhook_events": [
            "order.status_changed",
            "product.stock_updated"
        ],
        "supplier": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "GlobalTech Distributors",
            "company_name": "GlobalTech Distributors Ltd",
            "status": "active",
            "integration_type": "api"
        },
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierIntegration] 999"

Request      

GET api/admin/supplier-integrations/{supplierIntegration_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

supplierIntegration_id   integer   

The ID of the supplierIntegration. Example: 16

supplierIntegration   integer   

The ID of the integration to retrieve. Example: 1

Update an existing supplier integration

requires authentication

Update integration configuration, authentication settings, and operational parameters. Activating an integration will automatically deactivate other integrations for the same supplier.

Example request:
curl --request PUT \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"integration_type\": \"webhook\",
    \"name\": \"Updated GlobalTech API\",
    \"is_active\": true,
    \"configuration\": {
        \"api_endpoint\": \"https:\\/\\/api.example.com\\/v2\"
    },
    \"authentication\": {
        \"type\": \"bearer\",
        \"token\": \"new-token\"
    },
    \"sync_frequency_minutes\": 30,
    \"auto_retry_enabled\": false,
    \"max_retry_attempts\": 5,
    \"webhook_events\": [
        \"order.shipped\",
        \"stock.updated\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "integration_type": "webhook",
    "name": "Updated GlobalTech API",
    "is_active": true,
    "configuration": {
        "api_endpoint": "https:\/\/api.example.com\/v2"
    },
    "authentication": {
        "type": "bearer",
        "token": "new-token"
    },
    "sync_frequency_minutes": 30,
    "auto_retry_enabled": false,
    "max_retry_attempts": 5,
    "webhook_events": [
        "order.shipped",
        "stock.updated"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PUT",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16';
$response = $client->put(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'integration_type' => 'webhook',
            'name' => 'Updated GlobalTech API',
            'is_active' => true,
            'configuration' => [
                'api_endpoint' => 'https://api.example.com/v2',
            ],
            'authentication' => [
                'type' => 'bearer',
                'token' => 'new-token',
            ],
            'sync_frequency_minutes' => 30,
            'auto_retry_enabled' => false,
            'max_retry_attempts' => 5,
            'webhook_events' => [
                'order.shipped',
                'stock.updated',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16'
payload = {
    "integration_type": "webhook",
    "name": "Updated GlobalTech API",
    "is_active": true,
    "configuration": {
        "api_endpoint": "https:\/\/api.example.com\/v2"
    },
    "authentication": {
        "type": "bearer",
        "token": "new-token"
    },
    "sync_frequency_minutes": 30,
    "auto_retry_enabled": false,
    "max_retry_attempts": 5,
    "webhook_events": [
        "order.shipped",
        "stock.updated"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('PUT', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Integration updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Supplier integration updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "supplier_id": 1,
        "integration_type": "webhook",
        "name": "Updated GlobalTech API",
        "is_active": true,
        "sync_frequency_minutes": 30,
        "auto_retry_enabled": false,
        "max_retry_attempts": 5,
        "webhook_events": [
            "order.shipped",
            "stock.updated"
        ],
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T19:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Integration not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierIntegration] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The integration type field must be one of: api, webhook, email, ftp, manual.",
        "The sync frequency minutes must be at least 1."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to update supplier integration."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

PUT api/admin/supplier-integrations/{supplierIntegration_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

supplierIntegration_id   integer   

The ID of the supplierIntegration. Example: 16

supplierIntegration   integer   

The ID of the integration to update. Example: 1

Body Parameters

integration_type   string  optional  

optional Integration method (api, webhook, email, ftp, manual). Example: webhook

name   string  optional  

optional Display name for the integration. Example: Updated GlobalTech API

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Whether this integration is active. Example: true

configuration   object  optional  

optional Integration-specific configuration parameters.

authentication   object  optional  

optional Authentication credentials and settings.

sync_frequency_minutes   integer  optional  

optional Sync frequency in minutes. Example: 30

auto_retry_enabled   boolean  optional  

optional Enable automatic retry on failures. Example: false

max_retry_attempts   integer  optional  

optional Maximum retry attempts. Example: 5

webhook_events   string[]  optional  

optional Webhook events to subscribe to.

Delete a supplier integration

requires authentication

Permanently delete a supplier integration. Only inactive integrations can be deleted. This action cannot be undone and will remove all configuration and historical data.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Integration deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Supplier integration deleted successfully."
}

Example response (400, Cannot delete active integration):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete active integration. Disable it first."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Integration not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierIntegration] 999"
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to delete supplier integration."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Enable a supplier integration

requires authentication

Activate a supplier integration, making it the primary integration for the supplier. This will automatically disable any other active integrations for the same supplier.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/enable" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/enable"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/enable';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'

response.json()

    "message": "Supplier integration enabled successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "GlobalTech API Integration",
        "is_active": true,
        "status": "active",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T19:15:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierIntegration] 999"

}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Disable a supplier integration

requires authentication

Deactivate a supplier integration, stopping all automated sync and webhook operations. The integration configuration will be preserved for potential future reactivation.

Example request:
curl --request PATCH \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/disable" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/disable"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PATCH",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/disable';
$response = $client->patch(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Test supplier integration connection

requires authentication

Test the connection and configuration of a supplier integration to verify it's working correctly. This endpoint validates authentication, connectivity, and basic functionality.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/test" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/test"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/test';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

    "message": "Integration test completed.",
    "data": {
        "success": true,
        "response_time": 245,
        "status_code": 200,
        "integration_type": "api",
        "endpoint_tested": "https://api.globaltech-dist.com/v1/test",
        "message": "Connection successful",
        "additional_info": {
            "api_version": "1.2.3",
            "rate_limit_remaining": 98,
            "server_time": "2025-01-15T19:25:00Z"
        }
    }
}

Example response (200, Connection test failed):


{
    "message": "Integration test completed.",
    "data": {
        "success": false,
        "response_time": null,
        "status_code": 401,
        "integration_type": "api",
        "endpoint_tested": "https://api.globaltech-dist.com/v1/test",
        "message": "Authentication failed",
        "error_details": "Invalid API key provided"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Integration not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierIntegration] 999"
}

{
    "message": "Failed to test integration."
}

Manually sync supplier integration

requires authentication

Trigger a manual synchronization for an active supplier integration. This will attempt to sync products, stock levels, and order statuses depending on the integration configuration.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/sync" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/sync"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/sync';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/sync'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Sync completed successfully):


{
    "message": "Sync completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "started_at": "2025-01-15T19:30:00.000000Z",
        "integration_type": "api",
        "supplier_name": "GlobalTech Distributors",
        "status": "completed",
        "products_processed": 45,
        "products_updated": 12,
        "duration_seconds": 8.5,
        "errors": []
    }
}

Example response (200, Sync completed with errors):


{
    "message": "Sync completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "started_at": "2025-01-15T19:30:00.000000Z",
        "integration_type": "api",
        "supplier_name": "GlobalTech Distributors",
        "status": "completed_with_errors",
        "products_processed": 45,
        "products_updated": 10,
        "duration_seconds": 12.3,
        "errors": [
            "Product GT-001 not found in supplier catalog",
            "Rate limit exceeded for stock update"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (400, Cannot sync inactive integration):


{
    "message": "Cannot sync inactive integration."
}

Example response (400, Manual sync not supported):


{
    "message": "Manual integrations cannot be synced automatically."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Integration not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierIntegration] 999"
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to sync integration."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Reset integration failure counters

requires authentication

Reset the consecutive failure counter and clear error status for a supplier integration. This is useful when issues have been resolved and you want to restart the retry mechanism.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/reset-failures" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/reset-failures"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-integrations/16/reset-failures';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Accept': 'application/json'

response.json()

    "message": "Integration failures reset successfully.",

        "id": 1,
        "consecutive_failures": 0,
        "last_error": null,
        "status": "active",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T19:35:00.000000Z"
    }
}

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.
