Request      

GET api/admin/supplier-products/{supplierProduct_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

supplierProduct_id   integer   

The ID of the supplierProduct. Example: 16

supplierProduct   integer   

The ID of the supplier product to retrieve. Example: 1

Delete a supplier product

requires authentication

Soft delete a supplier product after validating that there are no active dependencies. Products with active dropship orders cannot be deleted. If the product is mapped to a store product, the mapping will be updated accordingly.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Supplier product deleted successfully."
}

Example response (400, Cannot delete - has active orders):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete supplier product with active dropship orders."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierProduct] 999"
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to delete supplier product."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/supplier-products/{supplierProduct_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

supplierProduct_id   integer   

The ID of the supplierProduct. Example: 16

supplierProduct   integer   

The ID of the supplier product to delete. Example: 1

Sync products from supplier

requires authentication

Trigger a synchronization of products from a specific supplier using their active integration. This will fetch the latest product catalog, prices, and stock levels from the supplier's system.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/suppliers/16/sync" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/suppliers/16/sync"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/suppliers/16/sync';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/suppliers/16/sync'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Sync completed successfully):


{
    "message": "Product sync completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "products_found": 45,
        "products_created": 3,
        "products_updated": 12,
        "errors": []
    }
}

Example response (200, Sync completed with errors):


{
    "message": "Product sync completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "products_found": 45,
        "products_created": 3,
        "products_updated": 10,
        "errors": [
            "Product GT-005 missing required attributes",
            "Invalid price format for product GT-007"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (400, No integration found):


{
    "message": "No active integration found for this supplier."
}

Example response (400, Integration not automated):


{
    "message": "Supplier integration does not support automated syncing."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Supplier not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Supplier] 999"
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to sync supplier products."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/supplier-products/suppliers/{supplier_id}/sync

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

supplier_id   integer   

The ID of the supplier. Example: 16

supplier   integer   

The ID of the supplier to sync products from. Example: 1

Map supplier product to store product

requires authentication

Create a mapping between a supplier product and a store product. This can either map to an existing product or create a new product automatically. The mapping includes markup configuration and sync settings.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16/map-to-product" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"create_new_product\": false,
    \"product_id\": 25,
    \"markup_percentage\": \"78.5\",
    \"markup_type\": \"percentage\",
    \"fixed_markup\": 1000
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16/map-to-product"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "create_new_product": false,
    "product_id": 25,
    "markup_percentage": "78.5",
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "fixed_markup": 1000
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16/map-to-product';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'create_new_product' => false,
            'product_id' => 25,
            'markup_percentage' => '78.5',
            'markup_type' => 'percentage',
            'fixed_markup' => 1000,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/16/map-to-product'
payload = {
    "create_new_product": false,
    "product_id": 25,
    "markup_percentage": "78.5",
    "markup_type": "percentage",
    "fixed_markup": 1000
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product mapped successfully):


{
    "message": "Supplier product mapped successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "supplier_id": 1,
        "supplier_sku": "GT-WH-001",
        "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones Pro",
        "is_mapped": true,
        "product": {
            "id": 25,
            "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones Pro",
            "price": 7999,
            "is_dropship": true
        },
        "product_mapping": {
            "id": 1,
            "is_primary": true,
            "is_active": true,
            "markup_percentage": 78.5,
            "markup_type": "percentage"
        }
    }
}

Example response (200, New product created and mapped):


{
    "message": "Supplier product mapped successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "is_mapped": true,
        "product": {
            "id": 52,
            "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones Pro",
            "price": 7999,
            "is_dropship": true,
            "created_from_supplier": true
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\SupplierProduct] 999"
}

Example response (409, Product already mapped):


{
    "message": "This supplier product is already mapped to a store product."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The product id field is required when create new product is false.",
        "The markup percentage must be greater than 0."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to map supplier product."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/supplier-products/{supplierProduct_id}/map-to-product

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

supplierProduct_id   integer   

The ID of the supplierProduct. Example: 16

supplierProduct   integer   

The ID of the supplier product to map. Example: 1

Body Parameters

create_new_product   boolean   

Whether to create a new product or map to existing. Example: false

product_id   integer  optional  

required_if:create_new_product,false The ID of existing product to map to. Example: 25

markup_percentage   numeric  optional  

optional Markup percentage for pricing. Example: 78.5

markup_type   string  optional  

optional Markup type (percentage, fixed). Default: percentage. Example: percentage

fixed_markup   integer  optional  

optional Fixed markup amount in pennies (if markup_type is fixed). Example: 1000

Bulk update stock quantities

requires authentication

Update stock quantities for multiple supplier products in a single operation. This is useful for processing bulk stock updates from supplier feeds or integrations.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-stock" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"updates\": [
        {
            \"supplier_product_id\": 1,
            \"stock_quantity\": 150
        }
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-stock"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "updates": [
        {
            "supplier_product_id": 1,
            "stock_quantity": 150
        }
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-stock';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => \Symfony\Component\VarExporter\Internal\Hydrator::hydrate(
            $o = [
                clone (\Symfony\Component\VarExporter\Internal\Registry::$prototypes['stdClass'] ?? \Symfony\Component\VarExporter\Internal\Registry::p('stdClass')),
            ],
            null,
            [
                'stdClass' => [
                    'supplier_product_id' => [
                        1,
                    ],
                    'stock_quantity' => [
                        150,
                    ],
                ],
            ],
            [
                'updates' => [
                    $o[0],
                ],
            ],
            []
        ),
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-stock'
payload = {
    "updates": [
        {
            "supplier_product_id": 1,
            "stock_quantity": 150
        }
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Stock updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Successfully updated stock for 3 products.",
    "data": {
        "updated_count": 3,
        "total_requested": 3
    }
}

Example response (200, Partial success):


{
    "message": "Successfully updated stock for 2 products.",
    "data": {
        "updated_count": 2,
        "total_requested": 3
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The updates field is required.",
        "The updates.0.supplier product id field is required.",
        "The updates.0.stock quantity must be at least 0."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to bulk update stock."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-stock

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

updates   string[]   

Array of stock update objects.
supplier_product_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the supplier_products table. Example: architecto

stock_quantity   integer   

Must be at least 0. Example: 39

*   object  optional  
supplier_product_id   integer   

The supplier product ID to update. Example: 1

stock_quantity   integer   

The new stock quantity. Example: 150

Bulk update prices

requires authentication

Update supplier and retail prices for multiple supplier products in a single operation. This is useful for processing bulk price updates from supplier feeds or applying market-wide pricing changes.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-prices" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"updates\": [
        {
            \"supplier_product_id\": 1,
            \"supplier_price\": 4750,
            \"retail_price\": 8500
        }
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-prices"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "updates": [
        {
            "supplier_product_id": 1,
            "supplier_price": 4750,
            "retail_price": 8500
        }
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-prices';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => \Symfony\Component\VarExporter\Internal\Hydrator::hydrate(
            $o = [
                clone (\Symfony\Component\VarExporter\Internal\Registry::$prototypes['stdClass'] ?? \Symfony\Component\VarExporter\Internal\Registry::p('stdClass')),
            ],
            null,
            [
                'stdClass' => [
                    'supplier_product_id' => [
                        1,
                    ],
                    'supplier_price' => [
                        4750,
                    ],
                    'retail_price' => [
                        8500,
                    ],
                ],
            ],
            [
                'updates' => [
                    $o[0],
                ],
            ],
            []
        ),
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-prices'
payload = {
    "updates": [
        {
            "supplier_product_id": 1,
            "supplier_price": 4750,
            "retail_price": 8500
        }
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Prices updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Successfully updated prices for 3 products.",
    "data": {
        "updated_count": 3,
        "total_requested": 3
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The updates field is required.",
        "The updates.0.supplier price must be greater than 0."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to bulk update prices."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-update-prices

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

updates   string[]   

Array of price update objects.
supplier_product_id   string   

The id of an existing record in the supplier_products table. Example: architecto

supplier_price   integer   

Must be at least 0. Example: 39

retail_price   integer  optional  

Must be at least 0. Example: 84

*   object  optional  
supplier_product_id   integer   

The supplier product ID to update. Example: 1

supplier_price   integer   

The new supplier price in pennies. Example: 4750

retail_price   integer  optional  

optional The new retail price in pennies. Example: 8500

Bulk mark sync status

requires authentication

Update the sync status for multiple supplier products in a single operation. This is useful for marking products as synced, out of sync, or having sync errors after batch processing operations.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-mark-status" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"supplier_product_ids\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    \"sync_status\": \"synced\",
    \"notes\": \"Batch sync completed successfully\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-mark-status"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "supplier_product_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "sync_status": "synced",
    "notes": "Batch sync completed successfully"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-mark-status';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'supplier_product_ids' => [
                1,
                2,
                3,
            ],
            'sync_status' => 'synced',
            'notes' => 'Batch sync completed successfully',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-mark-status'
payload = {
    "supplier_product_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "sync_status": "synced",
    "notes": "Batch sync completed successfully"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Status updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Successfully updated status for 3 products.",
    "data": {
        "updated_count": 3,
        "new_status": "synced"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The supplier product ids field is required.",
        "The sync status field must be one of: synced, pending_sync, out_of_sync, sync_error."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to bulk update status."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/supplier-products/bulk-mark-status

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

supplier_product_ids   string[]   

Array of supplier product IDs to update.

sync_status   string   

New sync status (synced, pending_sync, out_of_sync, sync_error). Example: synced

notes   string  optional  

optional Additional notes about the status change. Example: Batch sync completed successfully

User Orders

Retrieve user's orders

requires authentication

Get a paginated list of orders for the authenticated user. This endpoint allows users to view their order history with optional filtering by status. Orders include complete information about items purchased, payment status, delivery details, and current order status. Users can only access their own orders for privacy and security.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/orders?user_id=123&status_id=2&page=2&per_page=10" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/orders"
);

const params = {
    "user_id": "123",
    "status_id": "2",
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "10",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'user_id' => '123',
            'status_id' => '2',
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '10',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders'
params = {
  'user_id': '123',
  'status_id': '2',
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '10',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

        "last_page_url": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/orders?page=1",
        "next_page_url": null,
        "prev_page_url": null
    }
}

Example response (200, No orders found for user):


{
    "message": "Orders retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

Example response (401, User not authenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (403, Access denied to other user's orders):


{
    "message": "You can only access your own orders."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The user id must be an integer.",
        "The status id must exist in order_statuses table."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/orders

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter orders by user ID (must match authenticated user). Example: 123

status_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter orders by specific status ID. See order statuses endpoint for available options. Example: 2

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of orders per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 10

Body Parameters

user_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the users table.

status_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the order_statuses table.

Retrieve a specific order

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific order belonging to the authenticated user. This includes complete order details, all purchased items with product information, payment records, shipping status, and any returns or refunds. Users can only access their own orders. This endpoint is perfect for order confirmation pages and order tracking.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

            "id": 123,
            "name": "Sarah Johnson",
            "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
            "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",

                "id": 45,
                "address_line1": "123 Oak Street",
                "address_line2": "Apartment 4B",

                "state": "England",
                "country": "United Kingdom",

            }
        },

                "id": 90,
                "quantity": 1,
                "price": 499,
                "price_formatted": "£4.99",

                "line_total_formatted": "£4.99",

                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:20:00.000000Z",
                "product": {
                    "id": 28,
                    "name": "USB-C Charging Cable",
                    "description": "High-speed USB-C to USB-A charging cable - 1 meter length",
                    "price": 499,
                    "price_formatted": "£4.99",
                    "featured_image": "https://yourapi.com/storage/products/usb-cable-featured.jpg"
                },
                "product_variant": null,
                "order_return": null
            }
        ],
        "payments": [
            {
                "id": 67,
                "amount": 8498,
                "amount_formatted": "£84.98",
                "status": "Paid",
                "method": "stripe",
                "transaction_reference": "pi_1Hxxxxxxxxxxxx",
                "processed_at": "2025-01-15T14:22:00.000000Z",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T14:21:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:22:00.000000Z",
                "payment_method": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "stripe"
                }
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Order with returns and refunds):


{
    "message": "Order retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 38,
        "total_amount": 2999,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£29.99",
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T16:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T11:30:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "user": {
            "id": 123,
            "name": "Sarah Johnson",
            "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com"
        },

            "id": 8,
            "name": "Partially Refunded"
        },
        "order_items": [

                "id": 75,
                "quantity": 1,
                "price": 2999,

                            "status": {
                                "id": 3,
                                "name": "Refunded"
                            },
                            "created_at": "2025-01-15T11:20:00.000000Z",

                "processed_at": "2025-01-10T16:32:00.000000Z"

        ]
    }
}

{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

{
    "message": "You can only access your own orders."
}

Request      

GET api/orders/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the order. Example: 1

order   integer   

The ID of the order to retrieve. Must belong to the authenticated user. Example: 45

User Profile

Retrieve user profile information

requires authentication

Get detailed profile information for a specific user. Users can view their own complete profile including personal details, address information, security settings, and account status. Other authenticated users can only view basic public profile information for privacy protection. This endpoint is commonly used for profile pages and account management interfaces.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/users/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/users/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "data": {

        "name": "Sarah Johnson",

        "stripe_customer_id": "cus_1234567890abcdef",
        "password_changed_at": "2025-01-01T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "last_login_at": "2025-01-16T09:15:00.000000Z",
        "last_login_ip": "192.168.1.100",
        "created_at": "2024-12-15T10:30:00.000000Z",

                "score": 85,

Request      

GET api/users/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the user. Example: 1

user   integer   

The ID of the user whose profile to retrieve. Example: 123

Update user profile information

requires authentication

Update the authenticated user's profile information including personal details and address. Users can only update their own profiles for security reasons. This endpoint supports partial updates - only provided fields will be updated, others remain unchanged. Password updates require the current password for security verification.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/users/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"Sarah Jane Johnson\",
    \"email\": \"sarah.johnson.new@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"MyNewSecurePassword123!\",
    \"role_id\": 7,
    \"address\": {
        \"address_line1\": \"456 Maple Avenue\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"country\": \"United Kingdom\",
        \"postal_code\": \"M1 1AA\",
        \"address_line2\": \"Suite 201\",
        \"state\": \"Greater Manchester\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/users/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson",
    "email": "sarah.johnson.new@example.com",
    "password": "MyNewSecurePassword123!",
    "role_id": 7,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "M1 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Suite 201",
        "state": "Greater Manchester"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'Sarah Jane Johnson',
            'email' => 'sarah.johnson.new@example.com',
            'password' => 'MyNewSecurePassword123!',
            'role_id' => 7,
            'address' => [
                'address_line1' => '456 Maple Avenue',
                'city' => 'Manchester',
                'country' => 'United Kingdom',
                'postal_code' => 'M1 1AA',
                'address_line2' => 'Suite 201',
                'state' => 'Greater Manchester',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/1'
payload = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson",
    "email": "sarah.johnson.new@example.com",
    "password": "MyNewSecurePassword123!",
    "role_id": 7,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "M1 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Suite 201",
        "state": "Greater Manchester"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

        "password_changed_at": "2025-01-01T12:00:00.000000Z",

            "id": 45,
            "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
            "address_line2": "Suite 201",
            "city": "Manchester",
            "state": "Greater Manchester",
            "country": "United Kingdom",

                "score": 85,
                "level": "good",
                "issues": [
                    "Consider enabling two-factor authentication"
                ]
            },
            "is_account_locked": false
        }
    }
}

{
    "message": "User updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "name": "Sarah Johnson",
        "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
        "user_address": {
            "id": 67,
            "address_line1": "789 Pine Street",
            "address_line2": null,
            "city": "Edinburgh",
            "state": "Scotland",
            "country": "United Kingdom",
            "postal_code": "EH1 1YZ"
        }
    }
}

Example response (400, Email verification required):


{
    "message": "Email verification required after email change. Please check your new email for verification link."
}

Example response (401, User not authenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (403, Cannot update other user's profile):


{
    "message": "You can only update your own profile."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions for role change):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, User not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\User] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The email has already been taken.",
        "The password must be at least 8 characters.",
        "The address.address_line1 field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.city field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.country field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.postal_code field is required when address is present."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/users/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the user. Example: 1

user   integer   

The ID of the user to update. Must match the authenticated user's ID. Example: 123

Body Parameters

name   string  optional  

optional The user's full name. Will be automatically formatted with proper capitalization. Example: Sarah Jane Johnson

email   string  optional  

optional The user's email address. Must be unique across all users. Example: sarah.johnson.new@example.com

password   string  optional  

optional New password. Must be at least 8 characters. Requires current password verification via separate endpoint. Example: MyNewSecurePassword123!

role_id   integer  optional  

optional The user's role ID. Only admins can change user roles. Example: 7

address   object  optional  

optional Complete address information for shipping and billing.
address_line1   string   

Primary address line. Example: 456 Maple Avenue

city   string   

City name. Example: Manchester

country   string   

Country name. Example: United Kingdom

postal_code   string   

Postal or ZIP code. Example: M1 1AA

address_line2   string  optional  

optional Secondary address line (apartment, suite, etc.). Example: Suite 201

state   string  optional  

optional State or region. Example: Greater Manchester

Vendor Dropshipping

Get vendor dropshipping dashboard

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive dropshipping dashboard data for the authenticated vendor including overview statistics, recent orders, top suppliers, profit analysis, alerts, and performance metrics. This provides a complete view of the vendor's dropshipping operations.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/dashboard" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/dashboard"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/dashboard';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/dashboard'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

                "id": 15,

Request      

GET api/vendor/dropshipping/dashboard

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Get vendor dropship orders

requires authentication

Retrieve a paginated list of dropship orders for the authenticated vendor's products. This endpoint supports filtering by status, supplier, and search terms. Only orders containing the vendor's products are included.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders?status=confirmed&supplier_id=1&search=GT001&page=1&per_page=20" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders"
);

const params = {
    "status": "confirmed",
    "supplier_id": "1",
    "search": "GT001",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "20",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'status' => 'confirmed',
            'supplier_id' => '1',
            'search' => 'GT001',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '20',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders'
params = {
  'status': 'confirmed',
  'supplier_id': '1',
  'search': 'GT001',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '20',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Orders retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Dropship orders retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 15,
                "order_id": 98,
                "supplier_id": 1,
                "status": "confirmed",
                "supplier_order_id": "GT-2025-001",
                "tracking_number": null,
                "tracking_url": null,
                "total_cost": 4500,
                "total_cost_formatted": "£45.00",
                "total_retail": 7999,
                "total_retail_formatted": "£79.99",
                "profit_margin": 3499,
                "profit_margin_formatted": "£34.99",
                "shipping_address": {
                    "name": "John Smith",
                    "line1": "123 Main Street",
                    "city": "London",
                    "postcode": "SW1A 1AA",
                    "country": "GB"
                },
                "estimated_delivery": "2025-01-18T00:00:00.000000Z",
                "sent_to_supplier_at": "2025-01-15T16:25:00.000000Z",
                "confirmed_by_supplier_at": "2025-01-15T17:30:00.000000Z",
                "shipped_by_supplier_at": null,
                "delivered_at": null,
                "order": {
                    "id": 98,
                    "total_amount": 7999,
                    "user": {
                        "id": 5,
                        "name": "John Smith",
                        "email": "john@example.com"
                    }
                },
                "supplier": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "GlobalTech Distributors",
                    "status": "active"
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T16:20:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T17:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 23,
        "last_page": 2,
        "from": 1,
        "to": 15
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Vendor profile not found):


{
    "message": "Vendor profile not found."
}

Example response (500, Server error):


{
    "message": "Failed to retrieve dropship orders."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/vendor/dropshipping/orders

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

status   string  optional  

optional Filter orders by status (pending, confirmed, shipped, delivered, cancelled). Example: confirmed

supplier_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter orders by specific supplier ID. Example: 1

search   string  optional  

optional Search orders by supplier order ID or tracking number. Example: GT001

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of orders per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 20

Get specific vendor dropship order

requires authentication

Retrieve detailed information about a specific dropship order for the authenticated vendor. Only orders containing the vendor's products can be accessed. Includes comprehensive order details, items, and fulfillment status.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/orders/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Request      

GET api/vendor/dropshipping/orders/{dropshipOrder_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

dropshipOrder_id   integer   

The ID of the dropshipOrder. Example: 1

dropshipOrder   integer   

The ID of the dropship order to retrieve. Example: 15

Get vendor suppliers

requires authentication

Retrieve a paginated list of suppliers that have product mappings with the authenticated vendor's products. This shows suppliers that are actively working with the vendor for dropshipping operations.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/suppliers?status=active&search=Tech&page=1&per_page=20" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/suppliers"
);

const params = {
    "status": "active",
    "search": "Tech",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "20",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/suppliers';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'status' => 'active',
            'search' => 'Tech',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '20',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/suppliers'
params = {
  'status': 'active',
  'search': 'Tech',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '20',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Suppliers retrieved successfully):

    "message": "Suppliers retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {

                "country": "GB",

                "maximum_order_value": 5000,

                "dropship_orders_count": 45,
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:25:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 3,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": 1,
        "to": 3
    }
}

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Accept

optional Filter suppliers by status (active, inactive, pending_approval). Example: active

optional Search suppliers by name or company name. Example: Tech

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of suppliers per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 20

requires authentication

    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/suppliers/16" \

    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \

Get vendor supplier products

requires authentication

Retrieve a paginated list of supplier products that are mapped to the authenticated vendor's products. This shows the inventory available for dropshipping from suppliers.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-products?supplier_id=1&sync_status=synced&is_active=1&search=Wireless&page=1&per_page=20" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-products"
);

const params = {
    "supplier_id": "1",
    "sync_status": "synced",
    "is_active": "1",
    "search": "Wireless",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "20",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'supplier_id' => '1',
            'sync_status' => 'synced',
            'is_active' => '1',
            'search' => 'Wireless',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '20',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Request      

GET api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-products

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

supplier_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter products by specific supplier ID. Example: 1

sync_status   string  optional  

optional Filter by sync status (synced, pending_sync, out_of_sync, sync_error). Example: synced

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by active status (1 for active, 0 for inactive). Example: true

search   string  optional  

optional Search products by name or supplier SKU. Example: Wireless

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of products per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 20

Get specific vendor supplier product

requires authentication

Retrieve detailed information about a specific supplier product that is mapped to one of the authenticated vendor's products. Includes mapping information and recent orders.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-products/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-products/16"
);

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);

Request      

GET api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-products/{supplierProduct_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

supplierProduct_id   integer   

The ID of the supplierProduct. Example: 16

supplierProduct   integer   

The ID of the supplier product to retrieve. Example: 1

Get vendor product mappings

requires authentication

Retrieve a paginated list of product-supplier mappings for the authenticated vendor's products. This shows how vendor products are connected to suppliers for dropshipping.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings?supplier_id=1&is_primary=1&is_active=1&search=Headphones&page=1&per_page=20" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings"
);

const params = {
    "supplier_id": "1",
    "is_primary": "1",
    "is_active": "1",
    "search": "Headphones",
    "page": "1",
    "per_page": "20",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'supplier_id' => '1',
            'is_primary' => '1',
            'is_active' => '1',
            'search' => 'Headphones',
            'page' => '1',
            'per_page' => '20',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings'
params = {
  'supplier_id': '1',
  'is_primary': '1',
  'is_active': '1',
  'search': 'Headphones',
  'page': '1',
  'per_page': '20',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Mappings retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Product supplier mappings retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "product_id": 25,
                "supplier_id": 1,
                "supplier_product_id": 1,
                "is_primary": true,
                "is_active": true,
                "priority_order": 1,
                "markup_percentage": 78,
                "markup_type": "percentage",
                "minimum_stock_threshold": 5,
                "auto_update_price": true,
                "auto_update_stock": true,
                "last_price_update": "2025-01-15T14:30:00.000000Z",
                "last_stock_update": "2025-01-15T15:45:00.000000Z",
                "product": {
                    "id": 25,
                    "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones Pro",
                    "price": 7999,
                    "vendor": {
                        "id": 1,
                        "name": "Tech Haven"
                    }
                },
                "supplier": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "name": "GlobalTech Distributors",
                    "status": "active"
                },
                "supplier_product": {
                    "id": 1,
                    "supplier_sku": "GT-WH-001",
                    "supplier_price": 4500,
                    "stock_quantity": 150
                }
            }
        ]
    }

    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Request      

GET api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

supplier_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter mappings by specific supplier ID. Example: 1

is_primary   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by primary mapping status (1 for primary, 0 for secondary). Example: true

is_active   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by active status (1 for active, 0 for inactive). Example: true

search   string  optional  

optional Search mappings by product name. Example: Headphones

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 1

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of mappings per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 20

Get specific vendor product mapping

requires authentication

Retrieve detailed information about a specific product-supplier mapping for one of the authenticated vendor's products. Includes configuration and performance data.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/product-mappings/16';

    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);

print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productSupplierMapping_id   integer   

The ID of the productSupplierMapping. Example: 16

productSupplierMapping   integer   

The ID of the mapping to retrieve. Example: 1

Get vendor dropshipping analytics

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive analytics and performance metrics for the authenticated vendor's dropshipping operations. Includes overview statistics, trends, supplier performance, profit analysis, and fulfillment metrics.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/analytics" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/analytics"
);

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [

        ],

Get vendor profit margins

requires authentication

Retrieve detailed profit margin analysis for the authenticated vendor's dropshipping operations. Includes profit margins by product, supplier, and time period.

Example request:

    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/profit-margins" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/profit-margins"
);

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,

Get vendor supplier performance

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive performance metrics for suppliers working with the authenticated vendor. Includes fulfillment rates, processing times, success rates, and reliability metrics.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-performance" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/dropshipping/supplier-performance"
);

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,

            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',

        ],
    ]
);

Vendor Profile

Retrieve a specific vendor profile

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific vendor including their profile details, logo, and media. This endpoint is typically used for vendor profile pages and allows authenticated users to view vendor information. Vendors can view their own complete profile, while other users may see limited public information depending on privacy settings.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "message": "Vendor details retrieved.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "name": "TechCraft Solutions",
        "description": "Innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting.",
        "user": {
            "id": 45,
            "name": "Sarah Mitchell",
            "email": "sarah@techcraft.com",
            "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",
            "created_at": "2024-12-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-01-16T09:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        "logo": "https://yourapi.com/storage/vendor-logos/techcraft-logo.jpg",
        "media": [
            {
                "id": 78,
                "url": "https://yourapi.com/storage/vendor-logos/techcraft-logo.jpg",
                "name": "TechCraft Logo",
                "file_name": "techcraft-logo.jpg",
                "mime_type": "image/jpeg",
                "size": 156789
            }
        ],
        "products_count": 23,
        "created_at": "2025-01-05T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T16:45:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null
    }
}

Request      

GET api/vendors/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the vendor. Example: 1

vendor   integer   

The ID of the vendor to retrieve. Example: 12

Update vendor profile information

requires authentication

Update the authenticated vendor's profile information including business details, description, and logo. Vendors can only update their own profiles. This endpoint supports partial updates - only provided fields will be updated, others remain unchanged. Logo uploads are processed securely with validation.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "user_id=45"\
    --form "name=TechCraft Solutions Ltd"\
    --form "description=Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud migration services, and digital transformation consulting with over 10 years of industry experience."\
    --form "logo=@/tmp/phpOw18Xy" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('user_id', '45');
body.append('name', 'TechCraft Solutions Ltd');
body.append('description', 'Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud migration services, and digital transformation consulting with over 10 years of industry experience.');
body.append('logo', document.querySelector('input[name="logo"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'multipart/form-data',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'multipart' => [
            [
                'name' => 'user_id',
                'contents' => '45'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'name',
                'contents' => 'TechCraft Solutions Ltd'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'description',
                'contents' => 'Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud migration services, and digital transformation consulting with over 10 years of industry experience.'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'logo',
                'contents' => fopen('/tmp/phpOw18Xy', 'r')
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1'
files = {
  'user_id': (None, '45'),
  'name': (None, 'TechCraft Solutions Ltd'),
  'description': (None, 'Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud migration services, and digital transformation consulting with over 10 years of industry experience.'),
  'logo': open('/tmp/phpOw18Xy', 'rb')}
payload = {
    "user_id": 45,
    "name": "TechCraft Solutions Ltd",
    "description": "Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud migration services, and digital transformation consulting with over 10 years of industry experience."
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, files=files)
response.json()

    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "name": "TechCraft Solutions Ltd",

            "id": 45,
