{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (403, Cannot update other vendor's profile):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions for user_id change):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Vendor not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Vendor] 999"
}

Example response (413, Logo file too large):


{
    "message": "File too large. Maximum size is 2.0 MB."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The description may not be greater than 1000 characters.",
        "The logo must be an image.",
        "The logo may not be greater than 2048 kilobytes.",
        "The logo must be a file of type: jpg, jpeg, png."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Invalid file type):


{
    "message": "File type .gif not allowed. Allowed types: jpg, jpeg, png"
}

Example response (500, Logo upload failed):


{
    "message": "Failed to process logo file: Unable to write file to disk."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/vendors/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the vendor. Example: 1

vendor   integer   

The ID of the vendor to update. Must belong to the authenticated user. Example: 12

Body Parameters

user_id   integer  optional  

optional The user ID associated with this vendor. Only admins can change this. Example: 45

name   string  optional  

optional The vendor's business name. Will be used for public display. Example: TechCraft Solutions Ltd

description   string  optional  

optional Detailed description of the vendor's business, services, or products. Maximum 1000 characters. Example: Leading provider of innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud migration services, and digital transformation consulting with over 10 years of industry experience.

logo   file  optional  

optional New logo file for the vendor. Must be an image (JPG, JPEG, PNG) with maximum size of 2MB. Will replace existing logo if provided. Example: /tmp/phpOw18Xy

Vendor Review Responses

Store a new vendor response to a review

requires authentication

Allows vendors to respond to reviews on their products. Each vendor can only respond once per review, but can edit their response within 24 hours.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"content\": \"\\\"Thank you for your feedback! We\'re glad you enjoyed our product.\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "content": "\"Thank you for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed our product.\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'content' => '"Thank you for your feedback! We\'re glad you enjoyed our product."',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses'
payload = {
    "content": "\"Thank you for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed our product.\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (201, Response created successfully):


{
    "message": "Response submitted successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 45,
        "review_id": 123,
        "vendor": {
            "id": 15,
            "name": "Tech Haven"
        },
        "user": {
            "id": 12,
            "name": "John Vendor"
        },
        "content": "Thank you for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed our product.",
        "is_approved": true,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Not authorized to respond):


{
    "message": "You can only respond to reviews on your products."
}

Example response (409, Already responded):


{
    "message": "You have already responded to this review."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{review_id}/responses

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to respond to. Example: 123

Body Parameters

content   string   

Response content (10-1000 characters). Example: "Thank you for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed our product."

Update an existing vendor response

requires authentication

Vendors can edit their response within 24 hours of creation. After 24 hours, responses become locked to maintain transparency.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"content\": \"\\\"Thank you for your updated feedback!\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "content": "\"Thank you for your updated feedback!\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'content' => '"Thank you for your updated feedback!"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16'
payload = {
    "content": "\"Thank you for your updated feedback!\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Response updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Response updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 45,
        "content": "Thank you for your updated feedback!",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot edit response):


{
    "message": "You can only edit your responses within 24 hours of creation."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{review_id}/responses/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

id   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 123

response   integer   

The ID of the response to update. Example: 45

Body Parameters

content   string   

Updated response content (10-1000 characters). Example: "Thank you for your updated feedback!"

Delete a vendor response

requires authentication

Vendors can delete their response within 24 hours of creation. This action is irreversible.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/responses/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Response deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Response deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Cannot delete response):


{
    "message": "You can only delete your responses within 24 hours of creation."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/reviews/{review_id}/responses/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

id   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 123

response   integer   

The ID of the response to delete. Example: 45

Get vendor's responses (for vendor dashboard)

requires authentication

Retrieve all responses made by the authenticated vendor with filtering and sorting options for vendor dashboard management.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses?product_id=15&rating[]=1&rating[]=2&sort_by=newest&per_page=20&page=2" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses"
);

const params = {
    "product_id": "15",
    "rating[0]": "1",
    "rating[1]": "2",
    "sort_by": "newest",
    "per_page": "20",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'product_id' => '15',
            'rating[0]' => '1',
            'rating[1]' => '2',
            'sort_by' => 'newest',
            'per_page' => '20',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses'
params = {
  'product_id': '15',
  'rating[0]': '1',
  'rating[1]': '2',
  'sort_by': 'newest',
  'per_page': '20',
  'page': '2',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Responses retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Your responses retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "review": {
                    "id": 123,
                    "rating": 4,
                    "title": "Good product",
                    "content": "Works well but could be better...",
                    "user": {
                        "name": "Customer Name"
                    },
                    "product": {
                        "id": 15,
                        "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds"
                    }
                },
                "content": "Thank you for your feedback!",
                "is_approved": true,
                "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
                "can_edit": true,
                "can_delete": true
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 25,
        "last_page": 2
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/vendor/responses

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific product ID. Example: 15

rating   string[]  optional  

optional Filter by review ratings.

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort responses. Options: newest, oldest, rating_high, rating_low. Default: newest. Example: newest

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of responses per page (1-50). Default: 15. Example: 20

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Get individual response details

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/responses/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/vendor/responses/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 16

Get unanswered reviews for vendor

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/unanswered-reviews" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/unanswered-reviews"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/unanswered-reviews';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendor/unanswered-reviews'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

content-security-policy: default-src 'none'; frame-ancestors 'none';
referrer-policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
permissions-policy: camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=(), payment=()
